text:
This was probably the best seafood meal I have ever had! And in Pittsburgh!! Who knew? 2 locals on the strip recommended this restaurant when I asked where we should eat atop Mount Washington. They both stated Monterey Bay Fish Grotto. 
The drinks were excellent, as was the ambiance. The view was amazing and we weren't even by the window, but elevated to where we could see everything. Incredible! The appetizer was to die for, and the meal itself was superb! I had the parmesan crusted swordfish, my husband had the crabcake with sea scallops, and our daughter had the crabcakes. All were cooked to perfection and plated beautifully. Our server knew what she was talking about and was very helpful in our selections. For dessert, we shared creme brulee and the angel food grilled cheese. Oh my word, talk about delicious! If you don't eat anywhere else in Pittsburgh, this is THE place to try!

Excellent service and everything from the starters to the dessert was absolutely fantastic! Everyone in our party of 8 tried a different type of fish and the vegetarian ravioli and nothing disappointed. The best part of the meal was the angel food grilled cheese for dessert. Our waiter recommended it and he was spot on. I would highly recommend it as well!

I was there about two months ago, wanted to write the review but kept forgetting.  Anyway, it wasn't an impressive dinner at all, mostly because of the service.  That night was very easy to recall because there was a false alarm go off right after we got seated.  We went back to continue our dinner after things were clear.  Server, Jason, was nice and introduced himself.  However, his service was not so remarkable.  Didn't give us water until almost 20 minutes later.  I asked him to give me a taste of two different wine, he only brought one glass?!!!! Really? After I told him which one I liked, I waited forever for him to bring over the wine (it was busy at all btw).  Then soup was served, without spoon.... Main courses came, but he didn't clear the table first...  At the end, he gave us a check without asking me if I would like dessert.. SMH. I had dessert anyway.  I ended up tipping him 20% not because his service was good, just because I used to be a server, and I don't know how to tip less than that.  
I just think, a nice high class restaurant like that should have trained the server better.  I was very disappointed.  Food was good but unfortunately I will not go back.

Ok, so this place has amazing seafood and a fantastic view of the city too.  Probably one of the best views you find.  The entree portions are BIG, the plating is beautiful and the fish tastes great.  The fish is flown in fresh daily.  My wife ordered the Branzino and she got a full fish for her entree and it was prepared perfectly.  I ordered the red snapper and thoroughly enjoyed it too.  For starters we had a special combo platter that had swordfish and salmon skewers, lump crab cake (all crab, no fillers) and Cajun seasoned tiger prawn shrimp.  Great way to start a meal.  The service was superb too.  The only catch is that you get what you pay for and this place is definitely not inexpensive.  If you're thinking about going, plan to spend around $65-75 per person.

I liked the restaurant although the fake, painted poles supposed to look like palm trees are a little hokey.   The view of the city made up for that.   The food was delicious including the amazing crab cakes.  I'd definitely dine here again!

My mom and I had lunch here yesterday in a spur of the moment decision. We were very happy with the food and the service. We remember when Monterrey Bay was on top of the Jennette Building and its predecessor, the Rodi Grill. 

We both had the scallops and they were wonderful...more like a scampi...they just melted in your mouth.

Our waiter, Robert, was attentive without being obtrusive and very polite. The manager, Karen, stopped by our table to introduce herself.

The d√©cor is not overly stiff or formal...we felt comfortable there wearing jeans, having just finished shopping.

As far as the prices go...for the satisfying potions of seafood we were served, the price was reasonable. I believe most lunch items come with a side dish.

Server was very professional, knowledgeable. 
 Arr on time for a 6:30 reservation made 6 weeks prior. asked for window table - denied although there were several empty tables.  NOW, there is a table wait list.  nothing more than a ploy for bar business.  Seated at an elev booth that was so tight couldn't move. View - of the other side of the booth, with a screeching drunk carrying on just above at the bar.  Poor waitress couldn't reach far enough to serve the meal or clear plates. so, we served ourselves basically. 1 drink, 8 scallops, 2 salads = $160 - not so much.  the remodel is grey, drab. 
Had 2 handicap guests.  No handicap bathroom on dining floor after remodel.  What's that all about!  entry benches are new, low modern style for kindergarten kids.  Had to assist both seating and rising for handicap.  the designer is clueless when it comes to handicap and senior citizens. 
Across the street, other Mt. Washington restaurant are superior, classy ambience compared to Monterey.

My wife and I stayed in Pittsburg on our way to a wedding.  A friend from Chicago recommended we try this place.  We sat at the bar on the upper level and the view was beautiful.  We had a few drinks and some excellent apps.  Mike was our bartender and provided, along with the great drinks, some information about the area.  The only thing better than the view and drinks, was the firecracker of a General manager Jennifer!  She was an absolute riot and could not have been a better proponent of her restaurant and city.  She said she might run for either mayor or governor and I think she'd win both! 
Highly recommend MBFG

Kurt & Cookie

I LOVE Monterey Bay.  The restaurant is located high in Mt Washington and has excellent views of the entire Pittsburgh skyline.  The staff is polite and very helpful.  The best part though is the food.  If you like seafood, this is the place for you, if you don't like seafood, you will still find something you enjoy.  I didn't always like seafood so the first time I ate here I ordered the steak and it was delicious.  Now I like many different types of seafood so I can appreciate the cuisine even more.  They fly in fresh fish daily and you can tell.  The crab cakes are spectacular, they're my favorite.  They also have a great wine list and the last time we visited, their sommelier recommended a fantastic bottle for us.  It can be pricey especially if you are ordering bottles of wine, so we only go for special occasions, but I always look forward to it and leave completely satisfied.
5 stars for best crab cakes I've ever had!  Best views of the city and great ambiance for a date or large groups.  Prices are also very reasonable.
This place is amazing... the only downfall is the price, and sides are now a la cart. Entrees use to come with a salad and a side. They no longer do...

As everyone before me mentioned this place has the best view of the skyline in the city.  Prices are high, but this is considered to be one of the finer dining experiences one can have while in Pittsburgh.

I would recomend this as a great location for a business meeting or a date.  While fish is the speciality on the menu, thier beef and chicken dishes are just as tasty!!

There is just no arguing that the Monterey Bay Fish Grotto has amazing views. Simply spectacular.  Inside, it has a nice decor and comfortable atmosphere.  That is where things began to break down.  The wine service was disappointing for a Wine Spectator Award of Excellence restaurant.  I ordered a specific vintage of Pinot Noir and reiterated the year to the waitress. The wine steward brought the wrong vintage, very poor for such a highly rated restaurant.  She was able to find the right bottle after I pointed out the error to her, but I shouldn't have had to point it out.  I also ordered the fish special, which came at a premium price, but it arrived lukewarm.  Again, disappointing. The food and wine "experience" downgraded the overall evening and showed that you can't live on ambiance alone in the restaurant business.  It will make me think twice before dining at the Monterey Bay Fish Grotto again.

Perfect destination for a special occasion. The view of Pittsburgh's skyline and all three rivers is beautiful and complemented the amazing service. Our server was extremely personable and knowledgable about the menu. His recommendations did not disappoint. The warm, romantic ambiance of the dining room makes you want to stay even after you've finished your meal. Everything from the crabcake appetizer, lobster bisque, entrees, dessert and cappuccinos were delicious.

We had been wanting to try this restaurant for some time and are so glad we did. Everything was excellent.

The food was outstanding: We started with the featured appetizer special, which was simply outstanding. We also enjoyed the two dinner specials and a bottle of wine from the wide selection on the wine list. The service was impeccable.

The view was fantastic. We did not have a window seat, but sat in the "second row" on the upper level. I think the view was just as good, and we did not feel rushed. In fact, our server encouraged us to take our time and enjoy ourselves.

The service was great from start to finish: valet parking, reception, server, sommelier, etc.

We are looking forward to a return visit.....

Monterey Bay Fish Grotto was a wonderful experience for my girlfriend and I. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. We got the sampler for the appetizer which came with 2 large shrimp, crab cake, and a bbq fish skewer. The app was delicious. My favorite was the crab cake which was made with nice lump crab meat and paired with a tasty hollandaise sauce. We both ordered fish for our entrees, she ordered the swordfish and I got the chilean sea bass. The fish was cooked perfectly. The neat thing about the menu are the numerous ways you can get your fish prepared. For desert we shared a creambule which was just as good as everything else we ate. Overall we had a great time and I would recomend this place to anyone who loves seafood.

By far, probably the the best maryland style crab cakes ever. I've tried several other places including ones in Manhattan (where I live now) and no one can beat their crab cakes. The taste, texture and consistency is hands down the best I've had.  It's also a good portion so you're not left hungry.  

The fish is also pretty fresh and the dishes are delicious though as I recall, the fish dishes were uninspiring, offering very little creativity. The ingredients didn't jump out at me. Presentation and ambience is great for Pittsburgh, offering great views of the city. Nice place to take clients or your date. Next to the Original Fish Market in downtown, this is the only place I go for seafood in Pittsburgh because they do it right.

My first time in town and my boyfriend took me here for their well-known fresh seafood.

We ordered a sampler appetizer, two Chilean Sea Bass with Caribbean-Jerk spices with pineapple, red peppers and chives as well as a side of asparagus and red peppers.

Food:
The sampler appetizer included 2 tiger shrimps, crab cake, and 5 bite size pieces of swordfish, salmon and tuna.
- Chilled jumbo shrimps were fresh, bouncy and flavourful with the cocktail sauce.
- Crab cake was fresh and soft with loads of crab meats instead of breadcrumbs.      *Best crab cake I ever had. 
- Five bite size pieces of fresh swordfish, salmon and tuna taste very unique with the Ancho chili mayonnaise.
-The Chilean Sea Bass was very tasty, soft, fresh and full of flavours. It's sweet with a hint of spicy jerk taste.  
-Asparagus and red peppers side dish was delicious.

Atmosphere:
It has a spectacular city night view and the atmosphere is very romantic and classy. I really like the palm trees decors. It's a great place to celebrate any kind of special occasion.

Service:
Excellence service!! The waiter is very friendly and courteous. He's always on the roll of keeping our table spotlessly clean and our glass cups were never empty. Also the manager stopped by our table to ensure everything is going well.

Overall, this was a very memorable experience and one of the best highlight of my trip. Excellent quality of food and service! I'll be looking forward to my next trip to Pittsburgh for more delicious seafood food at Monterey Bay and hopefully we'll get the window seats.

My first trip here was for my cousin's rehearsal dinner in 2005. I had the crabcakes and they have had me ever since. 

My most recent visit was at the end of April. An old college roommate was in town shooting a video for a client, and our other roommate had recently moved back to the Burgh from DC, so I planned to come in for the weekend. Both friends are new mothers, and a dinner out- let alone with old pals- was a rare treat. 

I called the restaurant and let the host know of our special occasion. I feel like the host must have tweeted it or something, because from the moment we walked in, we were treated like gold. A manager even stopped by and ensured we were being taken care of! 

A great table with a spectacular view, attentive service (including accommodating my friend's dairy restrictions without missing a beat), and fantastic food. We shared an appetizer that came with roasted shrimp, a fish kebab, and a crabcake. Those crabcakes, damn! For my entree, I had the ahi tuna- it was fresh and buttery soft, yes!

We lingered and laughed and told tawdry tales and no one rushed us out. Our server even told us usually tables of women aren't her favorite but we were a joy to serve. We left smiling ear to ear. Bravo, Monterey Bay!

I went here awhile ago and never got around to posting. My host (for my stay in Pittsburgh) took me to out to the most classic place that people need to go to for food and views. I didn't know anything about Monterey Bay, so I thought it would be another cool dig to chow down at.

Little did I know that this was for those who are looking for a nice, EXPENSIVE night out. Luckily having a full-time job helps, but families and savvy savers might want to avoid this one.

I'm sure everyone has mentioned the location, so I'll get to the food. We opted for the bar downstairs because it's self-seating, and much more intimate (honestly with better views, too). Skipped out on the drinks because I had an early start the next day, and my host and I decided to settle on the ceviche. I thought it was okay. Appreciated the ahi tuna, but the flavor was more than lacking - the taste was slightly pickled and nothing else. I've had better ceviche.

Running on an ahi tuna high, I went with that done sashimi style (seared rare) with pickled ginger and sesame seeds. That was good, much enjoyed and the cut was almost too huge for me to finish. It was worth it, the main dishes all around are worth it. Unfortunately, I forgot what my host ordered, but she said it was a go-to for her - so, I'm assuming she loves it!

Obviously, if we're breaking the bank, might as well get dessert. She did the angel food grilled cheese sandwich, which was absolutely heavenly and I'd eat that all day. I went with a favorite classic: cheesecake, which put me to bed because it was creamier than most I've had, and a little less sweet. 

I cried a little inside looking at the bill, but it was definitely for the views that you get. In all honesty, it reminds me of places like XIX or R2L in Philly, and it's great for a one-time date or a special occasion, but I could find better uses and places for my money. Worth it for the trip and experience, but you're not missing out on anything at all.

Horrible service and food. We received the lobster bisque and it was very dry and not even lobster it was crawfish. Also out Chilean sea bass I highly doubt was Seabass not flaky at all. Altius is right next door please go there the food never lets u down

Made reservations the day of to celebrate our wedding annivesary. Never having been to this restaurant before we we excited to experience the fresh seafood this establishment prepares. Our waiter Chad was excellent in his recommendations for appetizers, Maryland crab soup and pistachio, mandarin salad with goat cheese in a blood orange vinegarette. Very flavorful and would have been satisfied with these as our main entrees. He suggested the Chilean sea bass with macademia crusted topping and the grouper with the artichokes.,olives and mushrooms. Loved both of these dishes as they were extremely tasty and full  of flavor. Sea bass was our top choice. They also provided us with a free dessert for our annivesary, the angelfood cheese sandwich. We usually sway towards chocolate for desserts but wanted to try something different.  Best non chocolate  dessert  we ever had. Definitely  was worth the two hour drive to get here.
Will come back after  they renovate in January. Palm tress are coming down. Can't wait to see the make over. Thanks  for a memorable evening  with the amazing view of the city !

I came here with my family on the Friday after Thanksgiving.  We spent about $120 for the four of us.  A lot of the cost is because of the view, and not necessarily the food.  

There is a nice elevator ride up to the top of this hotel building.  They have some nice aquariums with bubbles rising for ambience, though I think the palm tree columns seem a little tacky.  

The fresh bread they served was good.  However, service was slow.  The place was quite empty, and yet somehow we still had to wait for an hour for our food.  

We started off with the crab cake and ichiban.  The crab cake had remoulade sauce and was very good.  The ichiban has several different fish.  The salmon was good, but it seems like some of the other fish were not cooked to the same consistency.  

For the main course, my family had several different fish.  I had the Yellow Fin Tuna stuffed with spinach, mushrooms and goat cheese drizzled with
a Marsala wine sauce (my waiter recommended it).  While the rest of my family seemed to like their Mahi Mahi for instance, my fish was a little dry and the vegetables inside seemed soggy.  

Mediocre food, but come here primarily for its location and view.

We suffered a very sorry meal at this allegedly highly rated restaurant.  The butternut squash tasted like almond paste.  My husband's crab claws arrived at the table, hardly cracked.  After serving us, the waiter disappeared and my husband had to get up from the table to ask for a claw cracker.  The waiter returned quickly enough, full of apology.  Apparently, this establishment expects their patrons to dig the crab out of the legs with a dinner fork and knife.  While the waiter was well-versed on the selection of fish available, when he was asked the size of the stone crab claws, he replied "a half pound".   The standard answer at restaurants whose specialty is stone crabs is "small, medium or large"......FAIL.   The owner would be well-advised to clean the carpeting and find an air freshener that doesn't smell like stale socks.   On the upside, the view of the city is incomparable.  Wish the food and service was close.

Great food, typically great service, great view. I have been a few times for special occasions and am always very satisfied with my meal. It is expensive, but you get what you pay for. The mangers have also helped me get a special table for a special occasion when it is not too busy. Valet parking guys are also quick and professional.

I've eaten here quite a few times and have never been disappointed! Great view, excellent food and friendly, attentive service. Each and every dish that I've tried has been perfectly prepared and tasted great and I loveee the lava cake dessert! I've moved to San Francisco since eating here last and even after living in a city that has really high food standards I think Monterey Bay Fish Grotto has excellent food and reasonable prices for the location and the view. This is definitely my favorite special occasion restaurant in Pittsburgh.

I was thoroughly disappointed with the restaurant.  Basically, we paid for a view.  The appetizer was good.  The main course was horrible.  I don't know how the lobster made it out of the kitchen.  It was cold and tasted sour.  On the inner shell, it was blackened and gray.  The kitchen dissected my lobster and came up with with the same conclusion. My husband's dinner (the tuna) was supposed to be seared on both sides and only one side was seated.   The Brussels sprouts were unevenly cut.  The main course was bad all around.  Not worth the money, don't go......,

my expectations fail me again. the decor inside was beautiful. art deco grotto type feel with all the waterfalls and metal art.  the waitress was nice but knew nothing about the wine selection. finally the sommelier came and helped us out. the food was less than par for the price. altho they did have a pretty wide selection of different types of fish, the portions were a bit small and the sides were so BLAH. i definitely would not recommend this place to anyone.

Best view of the city I have scene thus far.  They do not take reservations for window seats however from my view it seems there isn't a bad seat in the house regarding the view.  The service was outstanding.  The food was very good.  The bar has a great view as well and is just below the restaurant so it is a nice spot to grab a drink and relax.

We had family in to Pittsburgh for the very first time from Indiana. The trip was planned for months and being from Pittsburgh myself I wanted them to experience Mt Washington and the incredible view as well as what I believed would be one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. We were a party of 5 and made our reservation for Saturday night September 21st at 9pm in order to not be in the busiest time period. We arrived at 5 minutes to 9 and were rudely treated at first by the valet parking attendant as the entry to the valet parking area is actually very tight and very confusing. He literally shouted at us to "back up" and in general just made us feel like school kids!!.....well up in the elevator to the restaurant itself and indeed the views are spectacular....unfortunately that was the last "spectacular" item of the evening. After checking in at the host stand it took another 15 minutes before out table was ready??....and it was NOT busy at this stage and as above one of the reasons we made the later booking. After being seated it was at least another 10 minutes before anyone came to attend to us other than getting served ice water???....the waitress finally came to the table and gave us the menus and told us of the specials....took our cocktail orders and was off.....another 10 minutes passed and finally we were served 1 small bread basket with one small dish of butter....for 5 people??....still no cocktails but we placed an appetizer order and also our entree order as well as we were really hungry at this point.....well another 10 minutes passed and still no cocktails or appetizers.....we had devoured the small bread basket long ago so we asked another different waiter if we could get another basket and it seemed like we were asking for something way out of line???.....finally our waitress came back to our table (after we observed her across the room at another table chatting for at least 10 minutes) and asked about our cocktails which by now had been ordered about 20 minutes ago.....5 minutes later the cocktails arrived and 5 minutes after that the appetizers arrived....had oysters rockefeller which were cold and just very bland in general. Approximately another 15 minutes later our entrees arrived and as 3 in our group had ordered steaks we found that all 3 were NOT at anywhere near the requested level of temperature other than the one filet that had been requested as medium well and since it was butterflied it had been cooked to a piece of shoe leather!!!....the other 2 were to be medium and were basically what anyone would call very rare to rare at best....with the length of time it had taken just to get served we were not about to try and send anything back....the one Chilean Sea Bass entree was very good....the salmon entree was again cold, bland and just not what one would expect from a establishment with the reputation the Monterey Bay Fish Grotto was supposed to have....oh and the $12 tricolor roasted potatoes were also cold, bland and tasteless!!.....we ate what we could and left after a $400 bill with significant disappointment!!.....I know some will say why did you go to the "Fish Grotto" and order steaks but thats what our group chose and if it is on the menu and at the prices charged they also should be nothing short of excellent which they were NOT....having dined all over the Pittsburgh area for the last 35 years I can assure diners who are looking for a great dining experience that there are FAR BETTER choices than the MBFG.....unless you want to spend $80 per person (with NO wine) just for the chance of having a table with the great view I highly suggest you look elsewhere even on Mt Washington....as per the title simply not even close to "The Standard" expected and deserved.

To start, this restaurant has some of the finest views of the Pittsburgh skyline. The large wall to ceiling windows allow diners to enjoy panoramic views from their table. I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with a glass of Argentine Malbec and thoroughly enjoyed it. The desserts were great as well.

This is literally one of the best meals my husband and I have ever eaten. We considered moving to Pittsburgh after eating here. The sushi was fresh and delicious, and the entrees were nice portions but more importantly tasted amazing. Nothing about this place disappointed, including the view. Our waitress Casey was knowledgable and gracious. We're still talking about the grilled cheese angel food dessert. Keep up the great work!

This restaurant has a spectacular view of Pittsburgh from Mount Washington.  That gets it three stars before you even think about eating.  The decor is understated and elegant.  I was entertaining guests from 
Europe and the were impressed by the ambiance.

They have a diverse selection of fish flown in daily from various parts of the world, but mainly from the US.  One guest had the sea food bisque served over lump crab meat as a starter.  He indicated that it was good.  The other individual had the calamari which he enjoyed and I had the spinach salad.

For our main course one of my guests had the halibut, and my other guest and I had the crab cakes.  The waitress indicated that the crab cakes were a specialty.  They were very good, just enough breading to call them cakes barely holding together the jumbo lump crab.  They sat in a delicious sauce that was lightly applied to the plate.

Excellent warm bread was served with meal.

I am not a wine expert, but the list while not extensive seemed to span the range of wines appropriate for the menu and various budgets.  We had a chardonnay from the Columbia River Valley.  It was nice.

Often restaurants with great views have so so food.  That is not the case here.  It is a great place for a special event or to entertain business associates.

I went to Monterey Bay Fish Grotto for a friend's fancy birthday dinner. 

If you're dishing out $50 of appetizers and entrees, then shouldn't you be expecting something amazing? Unfortunately, I didn't get that from Monterey Bay. I ordered the scallop and shrimp teriyaki brochette, and the dish was extremely salty. 

I wasn't really pleased with the ambiance either because it had a gaudy interior design. Fake palm trees? Please.

Per their website they stop serving dinner at 10 on Friday, but upon arriving we were told they changed hours and now close at 9. 

Please update your website.

These people are totally stuck in the 80's. Blue plates? Decor anyone?

The fish is average and the view is great.

First off, the food is absolutely amazing.  A must visit. Plus the view is spectacular.  But tonight, my review is about the customer service - stellar.  There were a few mishaps with the meal, but if there was ever a way to salvage a mistake, MB did it with flying colors.  The management handled everything perfectly.  But the real applause goes to Jessica, who works in the lounge.  She is on her game, knows how to treat a customer, and, well, is VERY easy on the eyes...  She's the reason I'll definitely be going back.

Great food, great view, and amazing customer service.
Holy chicago this place is fire. The calamari the sushi the steak the ahi tuna the asparagus was all sexy. Well done. I recommend getting a window seat if you can. Sick view.
Excellent place with terrific views.  And the food is delicious.
Best seafood in Pittsburgh. Fresh and has so much flavor. Food was just amazing and the service was just as good. I will be definitely coming back with family.

An amazing view of Pittsburgh?  It's true.  This was my first visit to Pittsburgh and a client suggested we try Monterey Bay.  Located on top of what I guest is the Mount Washington section of Pittsburgh, Monterey Bay is located in what appears to be an older high rise apartment building.  At the entrance you take an elevator up to the main dining room on one floor or the bar on another floor or the wine cellar on another floor.  The view of the downtown three river section of the city is really quite exceptional, particularly as the sun goes down.  By the way the seafood was as good as or better than the view.
One of the worst dining experiences I have ever had in the city of Pittsburgh. Horrible service and cheap food trying to be passed off as high end.

We went here for a date night when we were visiting Pittsburgh.  The Food was Great.  We both had fish and they were done to perfection.  On top of the food being so good the service was even better.  We showed up right as the opened for the evening and we had no problems getting a table.  As a matter a fact we had the best table in the house.  Chad was our server and he was awesome.  The view from the place Is jaw dropping.      We also got the Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich for dessert.  Best dessert I have ever had.

The first time I went to Monterey Bay, the only thing I remembered was the view. The second time I went, my salad had a hair in it. The third time, I was so displeased with my overall experience that I felt compelled to write something.

I usually don't complain about service or food but to be treated the way I was on all levels is disrespectful. I understand you're trying to maintain a reputation on par with the other establishments along Grandview Avenue, but you're failing, Monterey Bay. On multiple levels.

I've never made reservations for the dining room. Why should you when the bar downstairs is more romantic and almost always guarantees a view of the city? If you do ever venture to Monterey Bay, keep that in mind.

I, along with two other people, saddled up to the bar and patiently waited for a table to become available. Naturally, we wanted a drink while we waited. That wouldn't have been a problem if our bartender didn't act like we didn't exist. Ok, Mr. Bartender, I get you are busy but the rudeness and unwelcoming environment you created is truly unnecessary. While I may look young, my money is just as good as everyone surrounding me. And actually you should be catering to me since I'm at an age where I have a "disposable income" to waste on things like a tip. You might have known that if you taken the time to ask me anything other than "drink?"

We almost left after that. Unfortunately, a table opened up.

Fifteen minutes after we sat at our table filled with dishes and glasses, I finally waved someone over. He apologized and cleared the table and sent our waitress over. Have you ever been scolded at a fine dining establishment? I have. It was really... interesting. Our waitress asked if we planned on eating, if we payed our bar tab, and a myriad of other questions you might ask a group of teenagers looking to dine-and-dash.

She then proceeded to ignore us in favor of her 3 other tables (One was a couple celebrating their anniversary, one was a couple waiting for a table upstairs and the other was a family). She didn't make any recommendations, she barely engaged in conversation, and she gave us different dinnerware than everyone else. The last one is not a big deal but I notice these things.

When our food came out it was cold. Not even under a heat lamp cold. It was just cold. And fish is not very tasty cold. My scallops were gritty and missing ingredients listed on the menu. And for the price, I expected my knife to melt through the scallop like it was hot butter. But I guess sawing through a scallop is ok too.

It's a real shame I won't ever be going back to Monterey Bay because that snack mix they had at the bar was seriously amazing.

Stopped in on Saturday early evening for date night. We opted to park on the street versus Valet for $6, simply because we were able to get a street spot easily and had a feeling we needed a little walk after we stuffed ourselves silly with all the great food! 

We took the elevator up along with the crowd of people waiting, which had a large window overlooking the city so you can catch a glimpse if you enter the elevator facing the back. Since we had a reservation, we were seated promptly at a table in the main dining room facing the floor to ceiling windows. Although all the tables by the windows were taken, we didn't mind since it was foggy and rainy, there wasn't much of a view. 

I forget the name of our server, but he was polite and efficient. He let us know of the specials and recommendations and gave us enough time to look over the menu. We continued to order the Sakari Sushi Roll for our appetizer, which was phenomenal. It was probably my favorite part of the meal. The sushi tasted fresh and the texture of the tempura outer shell was crispy and light. Very tasty, indeed. For entrees, we ordered the Salmon special which was accompanied by a sweet potato and flash fried shrimp. My date thought it was delicious. I ordered the famous crab cakes, and boy the other reviewers weren't kidding about how good they were. The crab cakes had 90% crab and hardly any fillers. Well worth the $36 price tag. For the side dish, we shared the crab Mac and cheese. This was the only dish I wasn't crazy for. Especially for the $19 price tag, there was barely any crab and the cheese was overly creamy and the macaroni was a little too al dente for my taste. For dessert we got the Angel food cake grilled cheese. Although it was delicious, I regret not getting the Pineapple Upside down bread pudding instead. Another table had ordered it and I was drooling at the sight of it. And they were shoveling it down faster than I could blink, so I imagine it was tasty! :) 

Overall, with a couple of drinks and coffee, our bill came to just under $200. I think this meal was very good, but I think I would have saved it for more of a special occasion like a birthday or Anniversary. But the service was impeccable and the Manager Skylar was very nice and checked in a couple of times to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.

This place is great! I loved their seabass. They definitely did a great job. The tuna tartar and dessert were tasty too. Food presentation and spectacular view from the restaurant made this place a great place for dinner.

One of my favorite places for a splurge

Excellent fish
Great view
Superb wines (but very expensive)

Went there for dinner Friday night as a pre-Valentine's Day dinner. It was great. I haven't been to all of the restaurants on Mt. Washington but I've been to several and this is by far the coolest/best view.  The restaurant is on the top floor of the building so you get this cool view of the city on the elevator ride up. Once in the restaurant, it's just a neat view. It's panoramic and a different view from any of the restaurants on the cliff side of Grandview Ave. 
The food was awesome.  Service was great, food was great. For dessert I got the Angel Food Grilled Cheese sandwich. How weird does that sound? It was really really really good!

We took some guests to this restaurant while doing business in Monroeville and we were very disappointed.   The restaurant was almost empty and for good reason.   The food was tasteless and the service uneven and unprofessional.    The only thing that was good was the ichiban and I still don't know exactly what I was eating!     The walleye was completely tasteless and had no seasoning - sauteed with a mealy crust that was colorless and unappetizing.   The steak and swordfish didn't look much better.   This place needs an overhaul, badly!

This was one of the most disappointing experiences I have had in what should be a wonderful restaurant given the creative menu and the prices.  My food --- yellowfin tuna au poivre -- was heavy with pepper that was too finely ground and not fresh.  The mustard cream sauce was too sharp and had no finesse at all.  It was priced at $32.95 with a side dish and small salad which would be reasonable if it had been special.  The chef is not up to the challenges of the nice menu. The restaurant had beautiful decor but the staff and service were lacking in ambiance -- my server hardly had a smile, the tray service was stilted and dated, and the place was all but empty. Perhaps the location, at a mall, is the wrong place for this restaurant that is steeped in white table clothes, a fine wine cellar, and a terrific selection of seafood.

The view, service, and food are all exceptional.  Plan to spend some time here and enjoy the entire experience - it is great for special occasions or just a night out.

Just a few tips:
1. Make a reservation.  You can't request window seating until you're there so at least reserve a table and then ask.  There isn't a bad seat in the house, though.  They've built it so each table has some kind of view even if they're not right next to the window. 

2. It is a little more expensive than people lead on - for shared appetizers, entrees, one drink and one dessert, it is roughly $90 to $100 per person.  If you go just for the entrees, then you're closer to that $30 - $50 range listed.  If you're going, I'd recommend spending the extra money if you can.  The drinks, wine list, appetizers, and desserts are amazing.

3.  Take the incline to get there.  It is touristy (and only takes exact change in cash) but the views are amazing.  If you time it right, you can go up the incline during the day and go down at night so you get both views.

I'll definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I came here with a couple of friends in town for business and we loved it. The food was absolutely awesome, we ordered the oysters which were really fresh and good. We also got the Lobster Bisque which was good but a bit too thick for me. We ordered sushi with came out beautifully presented, it looked like a flower and it tasted great and fresh. I ordered the SeaBass and it was so good I didn't have any left. 
My only one complaint is that we were there for awhile and were the second last table to leave  and my friend made a joke about something and our waitress made a rude comment back about how she deserved a glass of wine since she had to "deal" with us. Keep in mind we weren't loud or obnoxious we just stayed for awhile, which was too her benefit because we ate and drank the whole night so our bill was not cheap. Other than that we had a fantastic time and will definitely be back.

It's also a great spot for a date since it has a beautiful view of downtown!

I only ate at the Monroeville location twice and order Lobster Tail both times.  If you like Lobster this is the best place in our area. It melts in your mouth. It's hard to find anywhere besides Red Lobster (which is awful) that serves Lobster Tail. The only negative is the price.  It's expensive and doesn't have that "5 Star" atmosphere and service you would expect for the price. Has a good variety of wines available and beers (recommend trying the Chimay beer if you never have).

Overall, at Monterey Bay, you're paying for the exquisite view and stellar service that you are receiving.  

Drinks run about 10 -15 dollars.  As an app my lovely boyrfiend, Ryan B, ordered the Ichiban - 2, yes only 2, skewers of various fish cooked in a terryaki liked glaze.  Not bad...overpriced at $14.  Next, the lobster bisque.  Biggest upset of the year 2010.  Well presented, bisque poured over a chunk of lobster claw - however, the soup was cold and more like Cambell's tomatoe with some chives in it.  

Salads were next - loaded with way too much vinaigrette, a very Asian feel with crispy noodles and a gingery taste.  Ask for dressing on the side.  The bread is amazing, though!

Ryan's entree was a flash fried ahi steak, stuffed with spicy crabmeat and coated in penko.  Only one bite truly was spicy.  It was over a bed of rice - however, they called it couscous, and ONE head of bokchoy.  Also, a bit cold for my liking.  ($45!!! OMG)

I ordered red snapper prepared Oscar style stuffed with crabmeat.  Not bad at all!  Green beans on the side were delicious.  ($33, could have whipped this up at home for about $10.)

Sampled the calamari - very good, a great app for a group.  Crabcake was great too - but, best crabcake in Pittsburgh can be found at Willow in the North Hills!  

I would recommend drinks and apps here with out of towners.  Know in advance it is a lot of money for a restaurant whose view does not compare with its food.

Recently came here for dinner with a group of family who are big fish eaters.  The first thing to note is that the view is the #1 reason to come (especially if from out of town like us).  It is perched on the hill overlooking the city and after dark, it is nice to look down on the city.  

Unfortunately, the restaurant decor itself is fairly outdated, but to be honest the view dominates so much that we did not notice.

Service was consistent and attentive.  The wine list was nice but overpriced.

The food unfortunately is what got this place 3 stars.  While the fish was definitely fresh (they claim flown in daily), the preparations that were ordered at my table just didnt work.  Some of them (mahi mahi) were too sweet, some too buttery, some to nutty, etc.  They didnt highlight the fish as much as they could have and tended to overpower the fish.

All in all this was a nice spot for dinner especially for people from out of town due to the view.

I came to this restaurant on Saturday night with a co-worker and his wife during an un-expected weekend trip to Pittsburgh.   This restaurant has a great view and it was a great way for a first timer to Pittsburgh like me to see the various areas of the city and the way the rivers connect and the skyline of downtown.  I was impressed by the wide selection of seafood, both type and preparation on the menu, so much I was pretty overwhelmed making my selection.  I am always impressed by restaurants that have the date on the top of their menu, showing that they change their menu daily based on what is fresh and available.

I finally decided on the yellow fin tuna with the stuffed preparation, which had mushrooms, and goat cheese and finished with a marsala sauce.  Our party chose the fingerling potatoes and creamed spinach as our sides to split.  When my meal came I was extremely impressed by the presentation - it was a generous serving of tuna and the preparation with the mushrooms and sauce looked delicious.  It reminded me of a preparation you would normally see for steak rather than fish, but tuna being a meatier fish it could handle this preparation.

The waitress had explained when we ordered that all fish is prepared to medium, except the tuna which is cooked to medium rare.  Well that was probably my only complaint about this dish - my tuna was cooked to a medium maybe even medium well (one inch thick steak with about a quarter inch of sear on either side) and I would have enjoyed it less well done.

Our sides were also delicious!  I was unsure if I would enjoy the creamed spinach, but it was prepared au gratin (who doesn't love anything which has cheese on it) and was well seasoned with nutmeg and salt, but not too salty.  Overall my dining experience here was pleasant - good food and good atmosphere. Also the waitress was very well versed in the different preparation of the fish and took her time in lots of detail explaining their daily specials which I always appreciate in a higher end restaurant like this!
The best crab cakes I have ever eaten. Fish is always very good. One of the few upscale places around. Have eaten here when they used to be at jonnet building.
We always dine at the Monterey Bay Fish Grotto, when we are in Pittsburgh. The experience is so satisfying. The people are so nice and the food is outstanding. Thanks for taking such good care of us.

Luckily the view grabs your attention before the poorly placed Palm tree paintings. My boyfriend and I had soup for an appetizer, very good. I had the crab cakes for the main course, also tasty. The shared dishes left something to be desired. They were not bad by any means, but I am in no hurry to go back.  Wait staff was great. Very friendly, and let us take our time over a bottle of wine.

I would definitely recommend coming here for the perfect mid-week date night.  We had reservations on a late Monday night and it was not packed at all.  Service was excellent.  The drinks were so-so.  I tried the two off of the specialty drink menu and one cosmopolitan.  The soup of the day was a fire-roasted tomato with shrimp and crab.  That was excellent, especially if you like spicy food!  I ordered the Mahi Mahi cape cod style, which was cranberries and orange in a very light sauce.  I think it would have been much better if the sauce had more of a thickness so it would stick on the fish.  The fish itself was cooked nicely.  Overall, the view was phenomenal, food was delicious, and drinks were alright.  I would definitely come back for dinner again!
Great view and wait staff. Food was good.

Supposedly the best seafood house in Pittsburgh and if you really know fish... this place will sorely disappoint you.  That start positive and view is amazing but so what,  I am here to eat and not take $200 photos.  Let's start with service.  All nice but clearly not managed and trained well.  Forgot bread, did not show us the wine before pouring, clumsily dripped it on each refill.  Came in on wrong side with nearly everything crossing your face with his arm.  Ok to the fish.  Preparations are 1980s with heavy sauces, lots of "crusts" and side from an old steak house.  Assuming it is fresh, I want to taste the fish and not the sauce.  Seems like they are hiding it.  It would also help to know the fish.  Description of rock fish was like a red snapper, flaky but with meatier taste.  Wrong.  It is super dense like a swordfish so the preparation he raved about make it too heavy.  Apps were also average and uninspired.  Soup was ok but it is soup.  For over $100 per person in Pittsburgh it should be better.  This place is resting on its laurels and needs a total refresh.  With all the creative new Food coming to our town... this place is a pass and spend your date night enjoying something you will remember.
Entrees are too salty. Lobster bisque soup was a failure but Crab cake is one of those Must-Try.

Monterey Bay is a wonderful place! The food is delicious and above all consistent. I've been three times and have not been disappointed. It's definitely not a place I would be going once a week because it is a bit pricey, but for special occasions, absolutely! The view is to die for! Go at sunset. Magical!  The decor is dated but I think they may be changing this soon if they have not already. 
I definitely recommend this restaurant if you've never been. The food, the service and the amazing view create an unforgettable dining experience.

Awesome food. The table had crab cakes, sea bass, seared tuna, and bbq'd salmon. Each was prepared expertly, and cooked perfectly. The tuna was especially good, with a delicious crust and a perfectly rare middle.

The service was exceptional. The view was gorgeous. 

The bill at the end of the night was... well, for what you get, you know what the bill is going to look like.

We went here tonight for my birthday. Fantastic. The soup special was clam chowder and it was by far the best soup I have ever had. Not just the best clam chowder but the best soup ever!!! Loved our waitress, the appetizer for 2 is a must. I would literally eat this every day if I could! Monterey Bay is one of my favorite places in the whole world. You should eat here. As often as you can!

First time back since the remodeling. It still has that out of touch feel to it. There's nothing hanging on the walls.  Put up some art to fill in all the blank spaces.   Enough if that.  The food was blah!  Come on, $38 for Chilean sea bass! The cut was thin, the taste bland.  The sauce was runny and just didn't do it.  They gave me lime that looked like it was sitting out for days.  I couldn't even squeeze a drop of lime juice put of it.  This will be my last time to ever visit this resteraunt. Dob your self a favor and go somewhere else it's just not worth it!  I'll buy my Chilean sea bass at giant eagle  and have a better meal on my back porch

Fabulous food.  Best salmon I ever had.  The seafood sampler appetizer was wonderful.  You can't go wrong with anything on this menu.  They say that fish is flown in on a daily basis with I can believe!

Beautiful view, quality service and delicious food!!!! My husband had salmon and I had stripped bass. The dessert was amazing...angel cake with cream cheese filling,caramelized almonds,fruit compote and vanilla ice cream on top.

I ventured here craving some fine dining fare. The elevator up offers very nice views of the city. The restaurant has a very chic ambiance and again offers beautiful views of the city. Since seating was booked I sat at the sushi bar, which offered full service. I ordered the Lobster Tail. I am probably going to come off as being very particular here but given the class of restaurant I suppose it's warranted. When I received my plate, it was placed by the edge of the counter very close to my lap, and the Madeira sauce was on the side of the plate towards the edge making it possible for the sauce to spill onto my lap. Also, the crab stuffing fell off the lobster slightly ruining the presentation. In any case, the dish was delicious and hit the spot. 

Looking at all the sushi forced me to cave in and order the Unagi Nigiri (eel sushi), which was also very good. For dessert I ordered the the mini chocolate guava roulades which was splendid. I loved how the mint leaves went with it. The service was very good and the manager came down to check on me and see how I was doing.

All in all, I very much enjoyed my meal and although I did not get to enjoy the view from my seat I'd say it was worth the price. When you do pay that price however, I do feel the criticisms are warranted, but this really did not detract much from the overall satisfaction of the meal and experience and thus stand as opportunities for improvement. That said, I'm glad I got to come here and enjoy this fine dining experience.

So my little brother graduated from Carnegie Melon this year and we booked a reservation here for afterwards.  Being my first time in Pittsburgh I was pretty excited to eat what my brother had chosen for his graduation dinner.  He later told me it was mostly for the view, he had never actually been there.  When we get to the place we start to park in the lot and the valet guy comes up to the car and tells us we have to check in at the valet in front of the restaurant.  We tried giving him our keys there but he told us to turn around and go back up front so as we did we see him running behind us to meet us at the front of the restaurant where he proceeded to then take our keys.  I guess he just wanted a quick sprint? lol.  

Pittsburgh is DAMN COLD.  It was supposed to be sunny out, but it starts snowing during the graduation in May! For this reason, after we took the elevator "All the way up" (cue music), we opted to keep our coats instead of checking them in.  That lasted about 5 minutes, as the restaurant was nice and cozy, and we quickly got warm....What a view!!!! We were seated right away and pretty close to the window.  It had stopped raining and a rainbow had come out over the water.  Very beautiful.  

I'm not big on cooked fish, I prefer my fish raw, but I opted for the Barramundi, which the waitress said was one of their specials that day.  It came with soup or salad so I asked for Lobster Bisque.  That Lobster Bisque and the angel food grilled cheese for dessert (more on that later) really stole the show for me.  All of the food was delicious, I had a little bit of fish off everyone's plate just to try out the flavors, but I don't think I'd be willing to pay that much money to eat those dishes again.  The crab cakes were definitely another highlight, and that's saying something because I don't usually enjoy crab cake, but again I'm not sure I would dish out the money to eat it again.  The flavor of the dessert, on the other hand, was completely unexpected, in a good way.  I would come back here just for the dessert and some coffee.  Not wine though, because each bottle of wine is ridiculously expensive.  My aunt said we were paying about $70 for a bottle of wine she had seen on a shelf at Albertsons in California for about $15 (not sure if she's right though).  But what the heck, we were celebrating my brothers graduation! So bring on 2 more bottles of wine!

All in all the food is good and the view is great.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  This restaurant is extremely expensive, but you are paying for the atmosphere and it doesn't hurt to try it at least once.

Absolutely love this place. Delicious food and the best views of Pittsburgh. Exceptional and friendly service. Upscale and relaxing atmosphere. Great venue for an intimate wedding or special event. Also a perfect place for a romantic dinner.

Food's decent. The view is spectacular of Pittsburgh's downtown. They have a nice bar, in case there's a wait. For some reason, it seems to attract a 70+ year old crowd. But it's still a great dining experience.

If you're looking for a big night out or a celebration this is the place you need to go.  Took a date here that was her first time in Pittsburgh and was blown away! Chad our server was excellent and the food was phenomenal...there's plenty of fine dining around Pittsburgh but Monterey is hands down the best.  Also a great spot to stop for a drink/appetizer before or after a night out in the lounge.  Can't wait for the sushi bar after the renovation!!!
Outstanding View, Great Food, Great Service !  MBFG did not disappoint.  Yes, it is pricey.  For special occasions or just a great night out with a fancy dinner it's worth it.

We decided on this restaurant for dinner for our family which included 4 young kids. We were able to get reservations at the last minute for 6:00 on a Friday night since we didn't think we were going to be in the city for dinner time. We were just coming from the Duquesne incline, and it's only a quick 5 minute walk from there. We noticed a lot of people were dressed up for dinner, while we had on casual clothes which was completely fine as we noticed later on as more people came in. They gave us a corner table right by the window, which completely surprised us since we didn't even think to ask and it gave us an amazing view of the city! The staff was very welcoming and helpful during our entire dinner! The food is delicious and they had a good kids menu to select from! We don't take our kids out to dinner often, but when we do they know it's a treat and they know how to behave! It is more of a fancy type of restaurant, so I would say if you have younger kids, only take them if they are well behaved. I highly recommend this restaurant when in the city!

This restaurant has an UNBELIEVABLE view of Pittsburgh. The service is professional, courteous and friendly. However, the food is just average and detracts from this being an incredible experience. I had the Lemon Sole and it was dry and definitely not fresh. My companion had the Chilean Sea Bass and it was just OK--nothing special for a "capstone" evening. If you do go--make your reservations well ahead of time.

This review is from Dennis.  My wife will have to review when I make a special trip to take her to this restaurant (no small feat considering we live in Wisconsin!)

The view, service and food were all exceptional.  My waiter, Mark, was friendly and helpful.  I was dressed in jeans and work boots, but that didn't seem to matter (maybe to the other patrons who were dressed in suits it did).  I was told to expect high prices by a business associate, so I was prepared for the sticker shock. I had an appetizer sampler platter of a crab cake, sword fish, seared tuna, and salmon, cooked to perfection and just the right balance of a glazed sauce.  The crab cake was not like a traditional crab cake, with more "cake" (filling) than crab. Hard to find ANY filling as it was mainly crab.  Best that I have had.  The presentation of the appetizers and main meal (scallops) was also perfect. 

You should figure spending close to $100 per person for an appetizer, meal, drink and tip.  If it comes in less than that, consider yourself lucky.  Personally, I thought it was worth every penny.
Very fancy and the dining room makes it have a very nice atmosphere. The view of Pittsburgh is beautiful and the steak I got for dinner was one of the best I've had in a long time!!

Our large party got a great table with views but I think all the tables have views!
Service was dead on as we were offered drinks immediately upon seating. Perusing the menu I thought to myself that I had not seen a menu with that many fish options in a long time. It was hard to decide!!
I had the oysters as an appetizer and then the ahi tuna from Hawaii prepared sashimi style as my main. Wow. Everything was so fresh. I would get it again! The desserts are a blur now in my memory but you can't go wrong. They were all good and disappeared quickly .

We booked our reservation seamlessly through OpenTable same day.  When we arrived on a Monday night, there were plenty of window seats available to take advantage of the awesome city view!  Our waitress greeted us immediately with a kind and courteous demeanor.  Since it was my hubs birthday, I ordered him Oysters on the half shell, which he devoured. He also chased them with a Mojito. For our entrees, we ordered the Swordfish, which was tender, moist and devine. We also ordered the Jumbo Sea Scallops, which were okay, but we prefer them grilled. We ordered the Jumbo Shrimp that was stuffed with the signature crab cake, along with the shareable Lobster and Crab Mac & Cheese. Of all the entrees, we both really enjoyed the Swordfish the most.  The Lobster and Crab Mac & Cheese was decadent, full of cream and not enough cheese in my opinion, but good nonetheless.  Overall, the dinner was good, the view was spectacular, and the price is high as usual! I thought that I heard they didn't have the angel food grilled cheese sandwich dessert and I really wanted to try it, but other than that we really enjoyed the evening.

Monterrey bay is delicious! One of my absolute favorite restaurants. It is a little on the expensive side, but the view and food are absolutely worth it. Monterrey bay is the real deal and certainly a 5 star restaurant. The crab bisque is the best I've ever had. All the seafood is fresh, and the staff is incredible and very attentive. They will even allow you to bring your own bottle of wine for a small cork fee rather than ordering one from the menu. One of my favorite things is riding the elevator up to the top because it is glass and you get a great view of the city! If you haven't checked out Monterrey bay yet, it's a MUST!

On a recent trip to I Pittsburgh happened to pick this particular restaurant because it was rated as one of the 5 best in the city for views. Otherwise, I'm pretty sure I wouldn't be looking for seafood in Pitts burg. Anyway, parked at the bottom of the Incline and rode that to the the top which was very nice. The walk to the restaurant was then maybe 3-4 minutes. Valet parking at the door was a reasonable 5 bucks but I was glad we rode the incline. After an unassuming elevator ride to the top of the building, I was amazed at what an absolutely awesome view this establishment had of the city! Almost every seat had a nice view as well. Since window seats could not be reserved we chose to be seated rather than wait it out and ended up in some descent seats that allowed an excellent view. The menu was quite extensive, the waitress extremely pleasant and efficient. Shortly after we sat down the manager stopped by for some glad handing as well. (nice touch). OK for the meal: First of all the wine list was excellent albeit pricey. We chose wine by the glass that was expensive (but very good) and quite honestly the pour was disappointing. They used the old trick of a small glass. This ended up setting the tone for a pretty much lackluster culinary night. We had the ahi tuna sashimi for an appetizer and french onion soup. The tuna was above average and the soup was excellent with just the right amount of cognac. Main course was Salmon and Halibut. Both portions were really small, very expensive, and just average in flavor, consistency, freshness and preparation. I asked for the Halibut to be a little on the dry side and it was no where near that. A side of asparagus was fresh and tasty. Finished the meal off with an incredible chocolate mousse cake and in the middle of desert there was an amazing fireworks display on the river just next to PNC park. Very cool! All in all this was just average food and below average portions at an above average price with a killer view. I loved the ambiance of the place. I guess I'd reserve this place for that occasional special event. I don't mind one bit paying for an expensive meal if it comes through. This didn't.  Again, not bad, but just between Meh average and OK, so I upped it to 3 stars because of the fireworks display! Looking at the other ratings, I honestly feel a 5 star rating is insanity! Go for the view!

Ohhh what's happened here? Stopped in for a bite and a cocktail. Saw the restaurant was dead, so I said why not! Service was great but the food not good. Cocktail was tiny and bland! I am so disappointed. I won't be stopping here anymore :(

My friend did a little research on the city before we headed out to find grub. Grandview had several highly rated restaurants so we headed that way. First, the view on Grandview is beautiful! Regardless of the place you chose to eat at you will be blessed with a postcard worthy shot of the city. FYI - Directly across from the restaurant there's a little place with a historic write up and place to just sit and survey the city.
Honestly I wasn't sure what to expect from the outside. It looked simply like an generic restaurant on an older hotel but we opted to go inside. The restaurant is at the top of the hotel. At street level there is a gorgeous view, so needless to say going up several more floors you are provided with an even more amazing view of the city. The main dining room was booked up so we ended up eating at the bar which was below the main dining room. The bar isn't as pretty as the dining room but we had a table right next to the window (something you can't generally get in the main dining room). The atmosphere was rather intimate - it was quiet and dimly lit - which was really nice. We were able to just relax, talk and take in that beautiful view. The service was excellent - our waitress left us alone but the minute I even thought I might want something she seemed to sense it and magically appeared. I ordered the salmon with the strawberry preparation. Again, I didn't know what to expect but the idea of strawberries paired with salmon intrigued me....... It was phenomenal!!!  I'm not sure how to describe it - the sauce was not sweet, nor did it taste especially like strawberries but it was incredibly yummy. My friend got this scallop and shrimp Alfredo pasta dish - the flavor was incredibly light. Most Alfredo dishes are so heavy and rich but this dish had a delicate flavor - not overwhelming - and the pasta was also this ruffled ribbon-like pasta instead of the traditional fettuccine. The prices are a little hefty ($30 for my salmon which just a fish and sauce) but the view, service and intriguing preparations really elevate this restaurant to that higher standard where I felt okay paying that much. I will be sure to come back during my future visits - even if it's just for a cocktail in the bar.

Can I move in here?

Bobby surprised me last weekend and took me out to dinner on Saturday night. We made reservations and we got right in and seated. The service was lovely and the dinner was wonderful.

Unlike so many other places on Mount Washington where you just climb a set of stairs to have a second floor view of the city, at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto you actually get in an elevator and go WAY up. The views are beautiful!

Once inside the restaurant, you are greeted by a very friendly person who has the waitstaff escort you immediately to your table.

FI and I split the calamari. FI isn't a big seafood fan (I know, I know) but he took me here because he knows that I love seafood! I couldn't believe it but he actually really enjoyed the calamari!

After that, I ordered one of the specials of the night -- Chilean sea bass that came with butternut squash and some kind of tomato risotto. It was AMAZING! Seriously so so good.

As if things couldn't get any better, I ordered the angel food grilled cheese for dessert. It sounds weird, but believe me when I tell you this was seriously up there with the best desserts I've ever eaten (and I've consumed many, many desserts). Honestly, if I were to choose my last dessert on earth, it might be this.

Can't wait to return!

What a joke. My boyfriend made our reservations for us on Valentines Day because it's one of my favorite restaurants. Today I get a call asking about my confirmation for our reservation tomorrow. TOMORROW?? No I don't need reservations for tomorrow I needed it for Valentine's Day. This is why we purposely reserved a month in advance so we wouldn't be in this situation. When I called all they could say is we can't help you there's no more redactions for that day. Well obviously because we're a week before Valentine's Day and every other place I had in mind is booked too. So I just want to say thank you for screwing me over and make sure you check the dates when you book!!

This restaurant is a must for all looking for a great meal in Pittsburgh. As a tourist, it is the perfect experience: exceptional view (you can go up the Dusquene Incline and being on Mount Washington you can see the three rivers of Pittsburgh), excellent food (fresh fish flown in daily), romantic atmosphere, and great service (attentive and friendly). Of course, this comes with a premium price, but worth the splurge on a special night out.

It is difficult to get a table during peak hours (especially on weekends), so I definitely recommend booking a reservation through OpenTable - which was hassle free. Ask for a table near the window upon arrival for a better view.

Although pricy, I found that the entree was filling enough to skip out on the appetizers. We tried the lobster bisque, it was quite good but a tad saltier than I would of liked, but have a strong lobster flavor to it.

What you MUST order: the dish that was the biggest hit was the MARYLAND CRAB CAKES. Probably the best I have eaten. Absolutely delicious. Second place goes to the grilled scallops - not the most flavorful I have eaten but you get 5 large pieces so it seems worth it. 

By popular demand, I got the Chilean Sea Bass in Caribbean - it was good/buttery/prepared well but didn't really wow me for some reason. Personally thought the sauce was really good and does 'wet' my appetite, but overwhelmed the 'natural' taste of the fish. Yellow fin tuna was also ordered - unfortunately not my favourite as it had a steak-y taste and texture to it.

If you haven't been to Pittsburgh, I suggest this on your bucketlist.

Make sure you sit downstairs. Upstairs is fine, but ambiance downstairs is 100 % better. Preferably a seat on the far left, view overlooks the lovely Pittsburgh downtown skyline. Service was great. I did enjoy the swordfish. Shrimp appetizer was not bad. Food a little cookie cutter boring.

In Pitts for the first time and had an overall amazing experience here.The staff was awesome and the server was extremely knowledgeable (had dinner there with my dad who has alot of food allergies). There were so many good items to choose from that I found it hard to decide. Started off with the wedge salad which had pickled red onions, smoked blue cheese and sriracha red peppers which was perfect combination of flavors. Ended up getting the lobster tail for dinner and it came with a generous amount of crab cake stuffing. It was extremely delicious. Had a seat by the window and the view was out of this world. Vanilla spice creme br√ªl√©e was phenomenal! Would definitely come here again next time I'm in town

As anyone who reads my reviews knows, I do not care for seafood.  But, on occasion, I find myself at a seafood restaurant and am usually OK with that because a lot of seafood places, at least the good ones, have alternatives to seafood for those diners who don't love it.  Like me.

We came here as part of a party, celebrating my sister-in-law's birthday- she and her fiancee (and most of the party-goers) hail from Morgantown, WV but apparently this place is so good as to warrant a 1.5 hour (one-way) road trip to experience.  In retrospect, it was worth it.

At first look, I got the impression that this wasn't going to be some ordinary restaurant.  It sits high above Three Rivers with a gorgeous view of downtown Pittsburgh- which was the first I'd ever seen of it, having never been to Pittsburgh before.  At night, it is positively beautiful, all lit up like cities usually are.  The restaurant itself is on the top floor(s) of a building sitting above the riverfront, access is past a guard's desk and onto the elevator.

Once the doors opened, you are treated to a frontal view of the restaurant, the hostess is right there.  The restaurant is multi-level; the upper level is the main dining area, with floor-to-ceiling windows offering a marvelous view of the waterfront.  There were tables of all sizes, we were sat at a long table close to those front windows.  The lower area appear to be private dining rooms, the rest room is also located down a flight of stairs just behind the hostess area.

Everyone working there was very polite, friendly and professional.  Wait staff were eager- from recommendations on food to the intricacies of the special cocktails offered from the bar, all requests were handled good-naturedly and with aplomb.

We started off with a round of drinks and a few appetizers, none of which I ate as they were all of the sea-variety.  Or cheesy.  The knight doesn't like cheese, either.  But I digress...

As luck would have it, they had a couple of steaks on the menu, so I opted for the filet.  As far as I'm concerned, every steak I eat is considered against the fine cuts at Stoney River in Annapolis, and with that in mind I will say this- it was a good steak.  Really good; tender, juicy - some places don't believe in seasoning meat and this is one of those places.  I like my steaks seasoned and seared, but that's just personal preference.  It was better than some I've had in other so-called steakhouses and that's saying quite a bit for a place that specializes in fresh seafood.  I ordered fried potatoes and a salad with my entree and I know I should've paid more attention to what the other diners had but, well, it was a party so I may not have been at my most...observant.  Everything that came out was attractive, plated to please the eye, not just the stomach and everyone raved about their food so I assume it was quite good.  Few if any doggie bags to return with us.  

We pretty much closed the place as we were a little late arriving to begin with; the staff remained courteous and friendly and saw us onto the elevator.  The security guards looked ready to go but wished us a good evening nonetheless.  The party bus pulled up and we were on our way back to WV, sated and satisfied.

While I don't see me traveling to Pittsburgh for any reason on my own, if I did- I'd probably look to dine here again.  It isn't a cheap, or budget-friendly restaurant by any stretch of the imagination but you do get what you pay for.  For seafood lovers, it is worth at least one visit!

My girlfriend and I have never been here before but this is perennially one of Pittsburgh's best and brightest spots for a romantic evening. We were certainly not disappointed! (Valentine's Date) 

Valet: Quick and easy, high quality finishes in the lobby, well dressed staff (matching winter attire at the time). Nice backlit accents on the walls/elevator. 

Entrance: Beautiful introduction into the venue, vast views into the dining space, high quality finishes throughout. Coat check is quick and easy. Table was immediately ready at the allotted time. I was treated like a VIP, with respect and professionalism. 

Waiter: Professional with a touch of over-enthusiasm which is okay, talked extensively about specials and preferred choices. Again obviously rehearsed but still appreciated. Consistently checked on refills and if we needed anything. Wasn't obtrusive, perfectly balanced. 

Food: 5-star all the way, Crab bisque that I still can't stop talking about, beautiful sea scallops. Everything was top quality and tasted incredible. Ambiance: The pi√®ce de r√©sistance, the famed few of the city of Pittsburgh. Beautiful unobstructed views of the city at night through crystal clear floor-to-ceiling windows. We were seated one table away from the windows which was highly appreciated. 

An absolute must in the city of Pittsburgh, we eagerly await our second visit!
Food is amazing and service is personal--received free desert for Valentine's Day :D will definitely come back!

Came here for the first time back in November while staying in town with a friend. First let me just say this place doesn't look like it was gonna have the ambiance it had. You first pull up looks like your going into a hotel but it's just a lil lobby where they come out to valet your car. Then you get on an elevator to go up that is windowed so u can see the view outside,(was so not expecting that),  you walk in and give your reservation and then are seated. The restaurant is surround by windows. What a view. We wanted to be seat near the windows, however, there was no opening,  but it was fine we had a great lil booth and still had a good view of the city. 
The food there  was amazing. I had sea bass and we also had a couple of appetizers. Which I was so caught up in my food and company and atmosphere I forgot to take pictures.. First date I didn't want to send back!.. Lol (you'd understand if you have read some of my other reviews.. Lol) Everything here was so good.  And the staff were nice and informative.
If I am ever in Pittsburgh again I would definitely come back! But make sure you have $$$ cause it ain't cheap!

My sweet loving partner took me here for my graduation day celebrating 5 long agonizingly splendid years of college. I thought the elevator up was so very cool mind you I was scared of heights. We arrived mid-afternoon it was a pretty muggy day, the VIEW was still astounding and the interior was fancy looking at first. There were large awkward shaped pillars in the centers on the room holding everything up most likely. They didn't fool anyone by painting them like "trees" lol it looked silly and didn't fit well with their up-scale approach. The view is simply breathtaking and I can only imagine what it looked like at night. Its definitely romantic and fancy yet the servers are lacking skill. They aren't keen on refilling water I had to keep stealing my dates lol. They did bring out a glass of champagne because of circumstance I reminded them. They didn't have a good draft selection which baffled me, I would have thought they would have a nice selection of seasonal light beer to pair with their "fish grotto" dishes, MILLER LITE it is! Anyways, lets get down to business. We order fried calamari which was frigging awesome if I do remember correctly. I was expecting my thrill to follow suit on through with the dinner, I was thoroughly disappointed however. So both my other half and I order and filet with mash and baby whole potatoes. The meat for lack of better words was a "chode" LOL, it was the smallest steak ever, no bigger then a meat ball maybe 2 bites max. The meat size I could have gotten past if it were a delicious savory hunk of tender goodness, BUT Hell no it was like watching DORA the explorer trying to navigate around chunks of fatty tissue and Grissel. I guess this is what i get for ordering a steak at a "fish grotto." Well you ask how are the sides? What goes better with a chode than a piping bag full of garbage pureed mash, eh. They were aiming for new york up-scale and hit mediocre home made at best. There was no flare, no taste nothing but disappointment. I really loved the ambiance of this place the only thing its missing is the food that FITS THE PART. Everything is upscale but my palette was yearning for MORE THAN they could offer us. Don't be fooled that sky-high atmosphere and encapsulating glass 360 view comes with a skyrocketing check. We paid a whooping 170.00-180.00 for the bill our ending balance for my special graduation escapade 600.00 but would have been much less if we ate elsewhere....Thanks for the read try le-mont same price bigger steaks :)

This place could be good if they were not so cheap on delivery. The food had good flavor, but there was not enough for the price. When you spend $35 on Chilean sea bass, you expect a large portion if there are no sides. If everything is to be √† la carte, the entree has to be a reasonable size for the price. My sea bass should have been $15 for the quality and portion. Oysters Rockefeller was basically spinach dip with oyster flavor because the oysters were no bigger than an M&M. The drinks were good, though their bar is a little short, being that this is supposed to be upscale. I asked for a Hendricks gin martini and they didn't have anything but the basics.

Don't get me wrong, the food tasted good, but $150 dinner for 2, we should not walk away hungry and unwilling to take a risk on dessert being disappointing as well. For the price, I'd rather go to Sonoma Grill downtown.

As a disclaimer:  I never, ever, ever write reviews.  However, this place gave me the inclination  to make a Yelp account so I could do so. 

My boyfriend and I were in Pittsburgh just for fun, as we live a few hours away and just wanted to explore.   I looked at restaurants that would give us a nice view of Pittsburgh, and this place came up.  I believe when I made the reservation it said to ask for a view when I got there.
