But I didn't need to. The hostess took us to a corner table with an incredible view of the city.  It was then I knew this dinner was going to kick ass.  The smell of seafood on the way to our table was more intoxicating than we had planned on getting that evening.  We started off with a succulent bottle of Amarone.  Most of their wine list are wines from the U.S., but I personally like to get down with the Italians.  Our appetizers were oysters on the half shell and seared Kobe; which the only complaint that I have is that they didn't just keep bringing to the table until we told them to stop.  Then we split the crab soup, which my boyfriend and I harassed our server about getting us the recipe because it was- The. Best. Soup. Ever.  For our entrees he had rockfish prepared the Thai peanut way and I had Caribbean Sea Bass. Both of us took the first bite and our legs went numb.  It was that weird erotic satisfaction only perfectly prepared delicious food can give you - that almost sexual satisfaction where nothing in the world matters except for the next bite, which you are almost afraid to have because you don't want the food to go away.  Both of us were fat and happy by the end of this, but we couldn't stop there. Dessert?  When in Rome... Or something.  Why can't they have a sampler of all of the desserts?  Sighhhhhh... Oh well.  We decided on sharing the Banana Foster cheesecake. Holy Moses was it delicious.  It made you forget about all the other food you just stuffed in your belly and focus on the magical piece of cheesecake in front of you. Neither of us could remember a more satisfying meal.  Maybe we both have the same taste in food, but it ruined the rest of our night because although the night had just begun, nothing was going to top this meal.

As for the service, I believe our server's name was Jane.  She was incredibly appropriate and wonderful.  She was knowledgeable not just about the menu, but about Pittsburgh itself, and really just was perfectly pleasant in every way. The entire staff seemed happy and like they wanted to be there.  

Thanks Monterey Bay!

I came here for a pre-interview dinner, so I didn't pay for it. The food was really underwhelming, the view in the private room was very nice though. I had the house salad and ~50% of the lettuce was either frozen or obviously just thawed. I've never had this situation at a restaurant before and hope to never again. My entree was the yellow fin tuna which was supposed to be "sushi grade". The fish was under-seasoned and had the mushy texture of sashimi that's past its prime. The other sides on the plate could've come out of a home kitchen (in the sense that they were ordinary, not homey or comforting). I would eat there again for free but would never pay for it. This caliber of food would never fly at a "fine-dining" restaurant in any other metropolitan city I've lived in.

I would give this place 5 stars for the view and ambiance, 4 stars for the food which was absolutely fantastic.  I came here for my birthday and was absolutely "wowed" by the expansive views of the city and the chic environment.  I had only been in Pittsburgh for a couple of weeks by this point, so it was a perfect way to introduce me to the city.  The food was great and high quality, but the real highlight of this place is the location.  Definitely come here with someone you'd like to impress, its a scene to be seen.

This is one of the few places that has a great view of Pittsburgh AND great food.  We had drinks in the bar downstairs before dinner and I was shocked at how affordable the cocktails were.  A Manhattan was only $6.50!  And with that view...that's a bargain.  The smoked salmon appetizer was outstanding.  I ordered Parmesan crusted mahi mahi and asked the server if the chef would add capers to it.  They gladly accommodated my request, and I appreciated that!  My Dad had the lobster.  He said it was great.  I rarely order rice pilaf but much to my surprise it was delicious.  Service was great.  I will go back.  Our total tab before tip (for 2) was $132.

Somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. 

This is one of the best locations, if not simply the best, for a restaurant in Pittsburgh, and if you are lucky to be close enough from a window (as we were), you will impress your dinner guests! Now, not all tables are close to the windows, and some tables don't benefit from the view at all. I wonder how people are assigned to tables.

The food is based on fish, and the menu is impressive, with a beautiful list of fish. We had various fish dishes, but the clear winner was the sea bass (with pineapple - usually I am not a fan of pineapple in my food, but this dish was very successful). The other fish were good, but not nearly as tasty. Some were a bit bland. The risotto was good, the lobster mac and cheese not impressive.

The desserts are decadent - in a good and bad way. They are really very sweet and heavy, too much for the taste of our table. I'd recommend to share a few (we had 3 for 5, and this was too much, including angel food grilled cheese sandwich and macadamia mousse). 

Overall, the food was decent, but the prices - very high for Pittsburgh - call for something better and more interesting. Too many fish dishes were good, but a bit bland.

Finally, our waiter was terrible. She pushed to consumption, insisting that we take some appetizers; she lost track of our bottle, and pretended it was empty, while we had only drank half of it; she put water on one of us...

I just went here for the first time in about 5 years for NYE and I was very impressed.  The food was delicious.  We had the crab cake appetizer, french onion soup, the salmon with strawberry sauce, macadamia encrusted halibut, and the white chocolate macadamia mousse.  Everything we ordered was perfection...there wasn't a single thing that we didn't like!  On top of the delicious food, the service was top-notch.  Even on a busy holiday evening, we were seated on-time and the server was very attentive and friendly.  I think this place is well worth what you pay for and I will definitely be back soon!

This was a very cool place to go. First To get to the restaurant we took a cab to the bottom of the Duquesne Incline and rode It to the top the views were incredible!! It's then a very short 2 min walk up a hill to the restaurant. We had reservations so we were seated immediately! The views were just as amazing in the restaurant. My gf and I wanted to buy a bottle of wine but we weren't  sure what kind we wanted and did not want to waste money on something we did not like considering most of the bottles are some what expensive. So we asked are waiter and he sent his manager right over. the manager was very nice he let us sample 3 different wines before we made up are minds up. We then ordered our food which was excellent!! We were very happy with choosing this restaurant. You won't regret going here if you choose to

Very upscale treatment.  Fresh, Well Executed  food. 

Steaks that are so tender and juicy and well seasoned. Seafood that tastes so fresh and decadent. Side dishes that were made to perfection.

Classic favorites with all the fixings you would expect or want.

We were on a business trip and they even accommodated separate checks.....

The view is incomparable!! Definitely will be returning here when I come back to Pittsburgh.
Loved it all the food was fantastic the view magical the service outstanding the cocktails perfect

We had a party of five dine there last evening.  Although very expensive and most entrees are ala carte, everything was delicious!  The wait staff was attentive and with an outstanding Mt. Washington view it was amazing!  We will certainly return to dine again, but probably with a smaller party.  I would also set a reservation for around 7:30pm so as to be able to enjoy the evening city view lights.

Traveled via cab to this new restaurant for all of us. Our reservation was for four, but six of us arrived. The restaurant quickly and politely seated us at a lovely large round table, allowing for excellent conversation. Service was excellent all night. The menu is a great mix of meals. All six of us ordered different meals and everyone was very pleased. My meal was large, stuffed scallops and spinach salad. The salad was excellent. The scallops were very good. The wine list is broad and with a nice mix of wines from OK to excellent wines. The pricing is aggressive. Wines are over priced, by any comparison. The foods were expensive, but this becomes more subjective. My meal was very good. It was very expensive. 

In addition to my meal, I sampled some corn side dish. It was excellent. 

This is a place that I would return to, but only for very special occasions. 

I am giving only four stars because the prices seemed too high, especially for the wines.

Came here with a couple of my colleagues while we were on business travel and this place was highly recommended. We all had the most amazing crab cakes chock full of real crabmeat and not a lot of filler. The Chilean Sea Bass was perfectly cooked and delicious! The 360 degree view was also amazing! The restaurant is on a hill overlooking the 3 rivers that intersect. Can't wait to go back one day !!

Went here with a group of folks for dinner, and we all enjoyed it.  I had the Copper River Salmon since it was in season, and it was cooked very well (medium rare).  It was served with the sweet potato polenta which I enjoyed as well.

I can't wait to try it out again, they had a great selection of seafood - definitely recommend trying this place out!

And in case you care, the bread served was delicious!  Jalepeno biscuits and some other types of bread...  Our carb conscious diners ended up eating some as well because it was just that good.  ;)

Holy smokes, what a great view of the city! The selection of seafood is exceptional, and my swordfish dish was delicious. The food prices are expensive, but in line with what you would expect to pay for high end seafood. The prices for wine are another story. It's a nice wine list for sure, but the wine prices are just over the top. The majority of bottles on the list are over $100 per bottle. Most seem to be priced at 3-4x retail. For example, we paid $75 for a (nice) bottle of California Chardonnay that you can find in a liquor store for $20-24.

One other complaint. Having a glass elevator with a view of the city is a nice touch. But you might want to consider washing the glass...it's pretty dirty.

If you are looking for fresh seafood and great service, look no further. 

Appetizer: combo platter... ask for it.  It will set the stage for a wonderful meal. Comes with crab cake, several small tastes of grilled varied fish, and a couple of Cajun grilled shrimp. Superb. 

Main meal: I had scrod, Monterey topping. Very fresh, light fish and the combination of olives, artichokes, tomato, mushrooms was a great addition to the mild fish. Husband had crab cakes and swears they are the best he's ever had. Big chunks of flavorful crab meat with remoulade.  Yummy, yummy. Side dishes are served family style and one is enough for two people. 

Extensive wine and drinks menu. Very enjoyable evening, killer views, and delicious seafood worth every penny. Don't pass it up if you get the chance to go here

Food, 2 stars, let's be honest, one can't break the good food with a great view paradox.

5 stars for the view.

Round the average for the view.

Just go for the view people.

Note:  One star is for the view (at the location overlooking the city).  Thus the food only gets one star.

My husband and I dined at Monterey Bay on a recent trip to Pittsburgh to see family.  Though I wouldn't have chosen Monterey Bay myself after reading online reviews, I was happy to be at the restaurant to enjoy the view.  The welcome by the staff and the ambiance at the restaurant are a great way to start a meal.  Unfortunately, it was all down hill from there.  Our meals lacked creativity and balance, but they were abundant in salt.   Even the butter for the bread was salted almost too much!   I had a special soup- it was way too mushroom-y and almost inedible because of the salt content. Another person had shrimp scampi; it was a pound of pasta and about 6-8 shrimp.  It was tasty, but totally unbalanced.   As a meal I had an appetizer- the Tuna Sashimi.  Though I'm sure the fish was fresh, it was too "chewy" and unappealing.  I was not impressed.  My husband's meal- also an appetizer- was also too salty and totally uninteresting.  The prices are outlandish given the quality of the food.  I would never go back here!!

Go for the view, not the food!

Highly recommend! The food is delicious, service is outstanding, and the view is gorgeous. The Jumbo Shrimp and Ichiban appetizer were delicious! We went for my boyfriend's birthday and it was a wonderful experience.

Review is for dessert only! We were contemplating dinner here, but chose another restaurant down the street. We heard about the fabulous desserts & view at Monterey Bay so decided to check it out. We ended up here about 30 minutes before close & knew we had to try the angel food grilled cheese (we didn't even look at the menu so not sure if that's what it is truly called, but our server knew).
The dessert was fantastic! Light, but sweet, with a little bit of tartness from the berries! Perfect!

The only reason I am not giving this five stars is that my scallops were really gritty!  This is an amazing restaurant for the total experience. The service, food, and view are all fantastic. This is our "go to" place for special occasions. Everything else we ordered was wonderful. The total evening was wonderful. I didn't complain about the scallops while there because I didn't want to take away from the night. I didn't eat most of the scallops and brought them home. Just ate them for lunch and remembered why I didn't eat them last night. My advice is go with the crab cakes and skip the scallops.

Fantastic views, Great food, and Great service. I'd say it was one of the top 3 restaurant experiences in my life.
I had the Chilean Sea Bass and my wife had the Parmesan Crusted Halibut. We had Lobster Rangoon's as an appetizer. Food was hot and cooked perfectly, just delicious.
Holly was our server, and she was great: friendly, helpful with the menu and casino directions :)    She also took a few pictures and brought us a free dessert for our Anniversary. Never had better service.
And the view from Grandview Ave is great, but the restaurant is 10 floors above that, just awesome.

The food is very good. I wasn't particularity thrilled with my fish, because I like a little lighter fish, but the mixture it was cooked in, Monterey style, was delicious. And my friend's fish was quite good, along with the Caribbean style. The appetizer platter was fabulous, and I now understand why they are known for their crab cakes. The service was fabulous! April, our waitress, along with another gentleman that serviced our table, were very patient and kind with all of our needs. 
And the view.... Wow.

Wow. They have so many options (if you like seafood which i do!) 

The menu of specials was overwhelming as well. The server rattled on for like 15 minutes about the specials which was impressive. 

I am a scallop fan so I went with the crab stuffed scallops.  I was so overwhelmed by all of the fish options that I couldn't make up my mind.  The entree was delicious my only gripe is with the soup I ordered.  The server described the soup as a lobster butternut squash....sounds interesting and delicious. Unfortunately the soup was a overly sweet pumpkin puree.  I love soup but neither my sister or I could stomach it. 


Obviously, the views are incredible but the interior seemed a little cheesy for a $30+ entree place.  Fake palm trees? hmm... 

Pros: huge seafood menu, full bar, tasty bread, gorgeous views, actually kid friendly (for my nephew) 

Cons: poor soup description, cheesy interior, a la carte vegetables, pricey but you are paying for the view. 

Overall: I will be back for another special occasion!

(11/11/2014)  Stopped in for dessert (amazing pastry chef) and the view.  Sat in the lounge by the windows and enjoyed the views from dizzying height with addition of some dizzying cocktails.  Drink specialties are desserts in themselves, but got the Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich.  Bruleed slices of angel food (torched for sure) with a schmear of sweetened cream cheese and served with vanilla ice cream fresh berries in a puddle of berry coulis, so, so, good.  

Place has a little bit of a leftover 80s hangover vibe to it (Bladerunner-style ambient music, vibrant "underwater" graphic decor, zigzag martini glasses, Cyndi Lauper called and she wants her sweater back, she bop) even though the Pittsburgh location has only been open since 1996.  It's a lovely date night for first Match dates and dinner before the prom.  Service was very friendly and attentive.  It was a great way to end the night.
Our Valentine's Day dinner was wonderful. Great service, atmosphere and we were surprised we got a great window side table . Perfect romantic date spot.

We were visiting Pittsburgh and this restaurant was next to Duquesne Incline. We wanted to eat somewhere near the incline and there are a lot of options and Monterey Bay Fish Grotto seem like the perfect choice. We made reservations. When we arrived we had to take the elevator to the top floor. The elevator was a little slow. We were seated by the window that offered an amazing view of the city. The menu offered so many different types of fish. Finally we narrow it down and decided with the hawaii opah blackened Cajun and hawaii walu Caribbean. The blacken Cajun opah had a smoky taste and the texture of the fish was more rough. The Caribbean walu had a fruity taste and a much softer texture. Both fish were good but if I had to choose one, I would go with the Caribbean walu. I really enjoyed my meal here and it makes a great place for pictures as well.

Incredibly flavorful seafood where you can get real anchovies on your Caesar salad!!  Professional service you'd expect from the best restaurants is so refreshing from what your accustomed to. A beautiful dining room with a fantastic view of Pittsburgh. I'd definitely go back.

This place is awesome. Yes its pricey but the food is amazing and so is the view. My family ordered the seafood platter as an appetizer, for our entrees we had the crab cakes (which they are known for), the stuffed shrimp and the strawberry salmon. We also had the risotto as a side. Everyone loved their meals. Out waiter was very attentive and the manager came to our table on 2 separate occasions to make sure everything was going well. He explained they are renovating in January and was very adamant about us giving our suggestions for things they need to work on or change. If you're are willing to splurge for a meal or are celebrating a special occasion, this place is great, probably the best seafood in Pittsburgh.

We came to Monterey for our anniversary. We had a great time. The on street parking was not great because we came at a busy time but we found a spot. I think you can valet as well. 
We took the elevator up to the restaurant. We had to make a reservation so we got a table right away.  We were not right by the window, which are the best seats because of the view. We were super so honestly we could see the view fine. 

We had the crab cake appetizer and the shrimp as well. Both amazing and the crab was so soft. We ordered sea scallops and the tuna ! The meal was amazing and just so fresh . We were so happy.  
Keep in mind they did not come with sides so we ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it was enough for two of us.

I thought it wouldn't get better but I ordered the  angel food grilled cheese ! I should have ordered this for my meal. It was the best dessert I have ever had honestly and I would come back just for that !

Absolute four stars! With spectacular views overlooking the water from all around floor to ceiling windows, perfectly seasoned and fresh seafood selection, wonderful list of wines and drinks, uber modern and upscale ambiance with chill and relaxing low lighting in the lounge area, along with entertaining and friendly service, this place is a sure winner! Keep in mind, parking may be a bit dicey. But, they do offer valet options. I had the wedge salad, scallops and my boyfriend went with the artisan and the risotto. Portions are reasonable. Every bite exploded with the freshness of each dish. Applause for the chef! Perfect place for a classy and modern dining experience. Btw, kudos to management for hiring James, our waiter. He was an absolute sweetheart to my boyfriend and I.

Wow, this place is outstanding! We felt a little under dressed, seeing as though it was a Saturday evening and everyone was fairly dressed up, but no one made us feel like we should have dressed more formally. Our waiter was great, he knew EVERYTHING about the dishes on the menu, and recited a specials menu that was so long, I lost track of the many mouthwatering specials that he described in detail. Our drinks were fantastic, and the seafood was heavenly. My party finished off the meal with Irish coffees, and they were so strong (whiskey wise) that he had to warn us as he set them down. My Irish nuts and berries ( a cream chamboard drink) was so strong it made my head spin (in a good way). Very expensive, but very much worth it.

Wow! Wow! 

Beautiful views on top of a ridge overlooking the city.  In order to get to the dining room you have to ride a exterior glass elevator climbing the building! Cannot get any better.!!
Beautifully prepared fish, great wine selection, desserts, the views.  Rank this place high on my scale of ten.  
Excellent service, excellent food, you have to go here.

Was just on date night w my husband. Food great but after my husband ate his oysters  on the way home he got ill. He blamed the oysters not being served over ice! Bummer! But besides that let down my lobster n steak were cooked to my liking.

The renovations looks impeccable and were LONG overdue. Nearly every seat has an almost panoramic view of the city. The service is exceptional and the food is even better. Must try the crab cakes (almost NO filler, just enough to hold together the crab, the seafood trio appetizer and the angel food grilled cheese dessert -- flavor explosion!

This is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to, and I have eaten here three times. First of all, the service is great. The food is excellent; Chilean sea bass and sea scallops have been some of the highlights. Of course the view is great, try to get a table by the front window. 

However, the best part is the phenomenal desserts - the Steaming Chocolate Latte is possibly the best dessert I've ever had. This is a warm chocolate souffle in a big coffee mug topped with Chantilly cream and "chocolate steam" (wavy pieces of chocolate for decoration), and the execution is perfect. I've also tasted a number of the other desserts which were all great. It's worth it just for the dessert.

The only downside I can think of is the cheesy decor (especially the columns).

I was dissapointed . I have been wanting to go here for several years and finally made it last saturday night . The plusses were the view and great service . The negatives were small portions and hefty prices . I know , u pay for the view and I understand that . A nice place but for the money I would go somewhere else .

Sadly going downhill.  As the Pittsburgh food scene grows and gets more interesting, places like this need to step their game up.  Instead, I think this place has sort of let itself go a bit.  The last few times I went, I had mistakes made with my order and a piece of ill cooked Chilean sea bass which was disappointing.  They have quality fish but lack consistency and creativity.

Yet another business dinner and yet another night of eating WAY too much food!  It's a rough life, I know.  Pity me...

One of THE most spectacular views of the city, bar none.  Most of the dining room has great/good views through the enormous windows, but I would even recommend the little bar downstairs for a drink and some great views.  Seemed to be not so well known, and a cheaper night than spending on the whole meal.

What can I say, the food was fantastic.  The Seared Ahi tuna was delicious with just the right amount of wasabi flavoring.  I ordered the salmon special on a cedar plank that was cooked and flavored absolutely right.  Even the steak was delicious according to some of my table-mates.

Wine list was generous (a bit pricey) but well complimenting the meals.  The serving staff was a touch slow, but it was nice not to feel rushed.

TIP:  Try their pretzel bread rolls.  They're delicious!

BIGGER TIP:  Not really sure about parking here, (I think there was valet service) but if you take a taxi there like we did, be prepared.  On a cold, snowy night we were waiting a good 45 minutes for a return taxi to the city.  Make sure to get your cab driver's number on the way over.  Give him an estimated time that you'll be done, and call him before dessert.  You'll save yourself a load of trouble. 

Absolutely a place to take clients/business dinners.  A little pricey, but the food and atmosphere will definitely impress.  It's a little out of the way, but still only a 10 minute cab ride from the Convention Center

A romantic and fancy place to go for couples in celebration of special occasions. Get your money ready, it's pricey but worth it for the food and the view!

Appetizers are awesome! The ahi tuna was a very enjoyable experience as it was crispy/warm on the outside and raw on the inside.

Do NOT get the lobster! It's overpriced and overcooked!! 
Since it's called Fish Grotto, their fish are good. You can pick you favorite fish and have it cooked in any style you want (not limited to the menu).

MUST GET DESSERT! MUST GET the one with the white chocolate mousse!! BEST EVER

If you sit on the right side of the restaurant you will get an awesome view at night! Totally pretty

So, we knew they finished the remodel but just hadn't had the chance to take a look until last night.  Gone are all the 1980's Miami Vice retro themed palm trees and the Sunset Boulevard themed colors.  This place is cool & hip with a friendly vibe and even their own sushi counter.  We were here with a local Happy Hour group that had arranged, ala Yelp style, for a cocktail & appetizer sampling and we were IMPRESSED!  

I'll spare you the 'intro' & 'outro' comps and get straight to their appetizer samplings.  The first and the biggest hit of the night were the Ichiban skewers.  They were a combo of marinated & chargrilled tuna, salmon & swordfish with an ancho-chili aioli drizzle.  There was a delicious Ceviche Roll which consisted of Oro King Salmon, apple, jalapeno peppers, red onion, red,yellow & green peppers with a topping of spicy mayo.  Then there was the Beef Tartar made up of Kobe beef, truffle oil, scallions and hard boiled egg over a fresh crostini.  last offering was a veggie roll for those in the group that were vegetarian.  There was a nice write-up of what was in those, but I'm not vegetarian so I didn't copy it down.  ;)

They had the bartenders create 3 specialty drinks for our group with a $5 price tag that made it feel like we were practically stealing them.  The first one was the Pittsburgh Aviator made up of Beefeater Gin, Luxardo Maraschino and cr√®me Yvette.  The second was a Three Rivers Smash made up of Woodford Rye whiskey, fresh mint and fresh lemon.  The last was a Strawberry Basil Pepino consisting of Hornitos Tequila, fresh lime, fresh strawberries and a jalapeno twist.  The last was MY favorite.  My adventurous wife prefers her cocktails served in a chilled long neck.  ;) 

This is not someplace I could afford to come to on a regular basis and that's ok.  But sometimes you gotta treat yourself and the next time I want to do that, I'm coming back...!

Came to an event summit and dinner was hosted at this place. Great views which everyone talks about and could see that it is. Ordered their sea bass which was alright and that to me not as seasoned as it supposed to taste. Maybe because this was an event and had a catered menu i might have just ordered a dish that was not strong that night. I should have ordered their crab cakes which looked a bit more promising.
we have received good service and enjoy the food? It located in MonroevillePenna Mall  top service.

Pricey but worth it. Great views, great service, great food. The bread and butter with lemon vanilla honey alone is worth it. I had the salmon with lime honey butter and it was amazing. I was celebrating 2 year anniversary with my wife...definitely one of the best places to go to celebrate big occasions and splurge a little.

Disclaimer:  I like shellfish, but not fish.  I went rogue and ordered the special which was a rib eye with garlic fries.  The steak was a little fatty, but still very flavorful and tender.  Good drink selection.  The ambiance, service, and view make it a 4 star.

This place was unbelievable, beginning with the lobster nachos, the whole way through to the creme brule and steaming chocolate latte desserts. The fish selection was also incredible--the parmesan-crusted swordfish may have been the best fish I've eaten and the cape cod style mahi mahi was also great. My only gripe was the filet mignon, which was kind of plain and done automatically medium-well, without another temperature option.

Went to dinner for a birthday celebration.
Ordered a sampler of apps and all where extremely good,steamed mussols,tuna,fresh oysters,all great!
Fo my main corse they was out of the Opah and was very disappointed but ordered another Hawaii fish monchong was extremely good.
Only thing that was a PITA was waiting for the very slow elevator.

Amazing seafood! Absolutely love the romantic vibe and new renovations too. Had the best service from start to finish...I highly recommend this place to anyone. Living in Pgh or visiting from out of town. Reserve a window seat as the view of the city is great!! Parmesan crusted halibut literally melts in your mouth. The creamed corn is to die for...Spicy yet sweet and large enough for two people! The "grilled cheese" inspired dessert is absolutely delicious and big enough for two. Can't say enough about this place! 5 *****'s

This restaurant is one of my favorites! The food, atmosphere, and service is awesome.  There is a spectacular view overlooking the city.  Reservations can be made on Open Table or by calling in.

Drinks: the cocktails were delicious, my only complaint was there was a TON of ice and very little alcohol in the glass.  The wine selections were wonderful as well.

Appetizers: the appetizers to order are the crab cake. The crab cake is all crab and very little filler, such a wonderful and the most perfect crab cake there ever was. I loved the calamari, so crispy and served with pickled jalape√±os on top, ohhh so good. The ichiba fish sampler blew my mind with the sauce seasoning. Caesar salad was served with real anchovies and perfect with the fresh cracked pepper.

Dinner: the special, the lobster ravioli was okay, pretty good but nothing memorable in my mind. Prepare to be blown away by the most tender flavorful stuffed scallops you will ever have.  Probably one of my favorite meals of the year.

Dessert: don't go home without having the best dessert in Pittsburgh (or your life). The grilled cheese angel food cake. Mind boggling and jaw dropping, not too sweet but the greatest array of flavors you will devour. The chocolate latte cake was pretty incredible as well. Heads up that it is really really hard to share these, don't underestimate these desserts.

The most amazing view... if you're lucky enough to get a table by the window. 

Unfortunately, I can't rate this place more than 3 stars because when we made a reservation we were told to come early to try to get a seat near the window, and when we arrived an hour before our reservation we were told they didn't even have a table large enough to accommodate us near the window. They even suggested we might not be seated on the lower floor a few tables away from the window. After a lot of anxiety and some moderately unpleasant interactions with the hostesses we sat in the lounge for an hour before getting a table on the floor a table back from the window. The lounge was great, with perfect views and perfect service.

The disappointment and stress we experienced at the hostess stand definitely dampened the mood of the night. The manager and server were very nice, but I suspect that they secretly hated us. 

We were eventually able to enjoy multiple appetizers, entrees, bottles of wine, and cocktails. 
Overall, food and view were awesome. If you make a reservation you need to be clear about what you're asking for/what you can expect to get. I'm going to assume this place would offer a 4/5 star experience if you didn't start your night in the same manner we did.

I can't explain how many times I have been to this restaurant and been disappointed. As a native Pittsburgher, I have been here many times throughout my life. 

The decor is just cheesy and lame. Fake painted palm trees? 

Service? Not what I would expect for a restaurant that runs at minimum $50+ per person. You have to pay for valet parking. When I arrived at the restaurant the valets did not even walk up to my car and open the door, or my passenger door. I had a reservation and still had to wait 10 minutes to be seated at an empty restaurant. (lets not forget about the elevator ride). 

Food? I have had better seafood from Costco. They serve FARMED salmon. What kind of seafood restaurant does that? The crabcakes are the only thing that is good on the menu. Everything else is just terrible. I ordered a special earlier this year that included three items: Filet, Duck, and Yellow-fin tuna. I ordered the meat and duck medium rare and tuna rare. When the server brought out my meal, the duck and meat were barely cooked to "rare" temperatures. They were could throughout. I will happily eat rare meat, but rare duck is awful. I asked the server if she could have them cook the duck and meat a little longer (to medium rare temps). She argued with me that I was wrong and shouldn't be doing that. She took my food and brought it back. The meat and duck were even colder than they were the first time. 

$150 later, I left the restaurant frustrated and disappointed.
Monterey Bay has very good food and service. The restrooms are very fancy and clean. Try to sit by the window'; it's a beautiful view. Everyone go to Monterey Bay.

Terrific view atop Mt. Washington. Terrible decor. Fake plastic trees, maybe wannabe art decor design. Disappointing decor given the view and high quality of food. 

Love the appetizers, including the crab cakes and seared tuna. My sea bass with pineapple and cajun seasoning was superb. Great drinks menu. Very, very extensive fish menu. All the fish is flown in fresh each day. I would without a doubt return.

Came here for a celebratory dinner last Friday night and it was so nice! The place has the best view (you take an elevator from the lobby to get to the actual restaurant/eating area).  We had our coats checked and were taken to a table right next to the window - the whole environment was very romantic and classy.  

We had the combo appetizer (wasn't on the menu, but our waiter informed us about it).  It had one of the "famous" crab cakes (incredible), two ichiban skewers (salmon, yellow fin tuna, and swordfish), and two of their jumbo shrimp (sauce was delicious). 

I had the salmon done the honey lime style and it was the best salmon I have ever had. It was so smooth and the honey was amazing.  My boyfriend ordered the yellow-fin tuna done port style.  The sauce was great but he found it to be a little too rare (but he is not too much of a tuna fan -- it would have been perfect for any other tuna lover).  We had the tri-color potatoes for a shareable side, the sweet potatoes were great, but found that we could have done without ordering the side.  

We finished off with the chocolate cheesecake which was amazing.  I was worried that it would be too rich or sweet, but it was just the right amount and the texture was great.  The pretzel and pistachios were a great complement.  

Overall, service, food, and environment made it a really memorable experience.  One thing that was a little hard to not mention was the constant refilling of our water glasses - I wouldn't even get 2 sips in until someone came over again to "refill" my glass!

Here is another example of a review that I wish could receive a half a star.   I would give 3 stars for the view and a 1/2 a star for the food.  Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't terrible but it wasn't over the top either, and I expect to be wow'd after throwing down hat much money.   

I went to Monterey Bay for a friend's birthday last night, and ultimately is was a great dinner because of the occasion.  However, I don't think that I will be making a repeat appearance.  Everything was ridiculously over priced but I paid it without complaint.   We ordered the appetizer platter and shared a bottle of wine while waiting for our other dining partners arrived.  The crab cakes were all that they were advertised to be and the sauce was creamy and delicious. 

I had the Basil Garlic Yellow Snapper with rice pilaf for my entree and it was ok.  Nothing too inspiring.  Overall, I felt their menu was a bit old school, which works for a specific sect of dinners.  A lot of people don't want to try anything too fancy or challenging.  I am just not one of those people.

I'd probably really give this 2.5 stars.   Fabulous view- definitely ask for a window seat.  I love Chilean sea bass, it's my favorite - but for some reason it wasn't great - it tasted a little overdone. Lobster Mac n cheese was good. Asparagus was forgettable as was the grilled wedge- I was hoping for a little more char to it - the dressing was good though.  Can't beat the view just wish the food matched how great the view was.  Service was good- a little stuffy but ok and the wine was great.  For it being a fish place I expected to be blown away with the sea bass but was sadly disappointed.

We went here for our first anniversary. I could not imagine having a better night than what we experienced. Everything from the hostess to the bartenders while we waited for our table by the window was absolutely perfect.  Our server Anita was fantastic and the general manager, John, made us feel like they were open that day just for us. I had the Tuna which was amazing, and my wife couldn't give higher praises to the Lobster Bisque. I highly recommend it.

This restaurant relies totally on it fabulous location and not at all on its kitchen which is badly lacking,.  Our waitress was arrogant. The food was soso. Special requests were dismissed. Prices were way too high for the quality provided. Enjoy the view from the bar, order sushi or an appetizer and take the rest of your business elsewhere.

We had dinner with a business associate.  This was a fantastic suggestion.  First, the view is AMAZING.  It speaks for itself and I couldn't possibly do it justice.  I was extremely happy that we went to a seafood restaurant instead of the usual steak house.  We had drinks in the lounge first.  AMAZING VIEWS as well.  After a few glasses of wine, we moved to the dining room.  It is very classically vegas meets 50's dinner club.  Over the top yet classy.  We tried the shrimp cocktail (which is served with dry ice smoking underneath) and the tuna tartar.  For dinner we had the crab cake (which was served in a deconstructed manner) and sea bass macadamia.  For sides we tried the creamed spinach, potatoes, and lobster mac and cheese.  The place has a great energy and while large, is not too noisy.  I would recommend this for a business dinner any night of the week.  It is a bit pricey. With drinks the bill was closer too $100 a head.

The view of downtown is great; the food? not so much -- very limited ingredients on the plate, we both ordered fish and neither dish was good enough to match the view. The fish was too tight and overcooked, and the source didn't work that well with the fish. Overall it's just fine
One of the best views you'll have eating. The food itself is above average. Still completely worth it.

Stopped here with my mama for a shopping break/late lunch before we headed over to Ross Park. I ordered the lobster nachos and she got the crab cake. My mom thought her crab cake was decent, but nothing to rave about, especially since it was one modestly-sized crab cake for $20-something. We both thought the lobster nachos were delicious - you could actually taste the lobster unlike everywhere else, and the portion was enormous (looks like it's not on the menu anymore, sad). Overall, I thought it was good, but it was pretty slow. I would stop in again, but definitely not when I want a quick lunch.
Food was good, view of the city was great. Many options on the menu for whatever you might be in the mood for. Even a Gluten free menu.

This place never disappoints!

The food is excellent. Absolutely order the angel food grilled cheese for desert you won't be sorry.

The view is amazing on the city side. The other side is fine but there isn't nearly as much to look at.

The waitstaff and management have always been very friendly to myself

Awesome! I've never been here before. It is quite a few floors up, you take an elevator to the actually restaurant. I took my boyfriends mother. We were sat by a window with an amazing view of the city. To start, we had shrimp cocktail and oysters. Best shrimp cocktail ever. For dinner, she had halibut that was in a sort of orange basil sauce and a colorful potato mix. I had tuna that was stuffed with spinach and goat cheese with a marsala sauce, and crab Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious, and our server, Jeff, who was PERFECT, even helped me pick a great drink. It was a martini with makers mark, and I believe peach liquor, simple syrup, and lemon juice? I can't wait to go back!

I had heard mixed things about monterey bay so when there was a family gathering at this venue I was excited to see for my own how this place is like.  Entering the restaurant you get a feeling of elegance and nice, upscale atmosphere.  It sets your mood for a great culinary experience.  However, personally, I think that the my expectations were met only at the space itself rather than the most important thing which is the  food.  Not that the food was not good, but it was overpriced for what it was.  I got a chicken-dish (I know this place is a fish restaurant) but still you would have expected a fantastic dish.  Nonetheless, the food was a bit dry and definitely not of the high-standards one expects from these type of venues.  The rest of my party - that actually tried fish - were underwhelmed as well.  Having said that, the service was great and fast but I think I will not choose to go back again (expect if there is some sort of gathering/meeting again).

Quite honestly the best restaurant experience I've had in a looong time. EVERYTHING about our night was absolutely perfect! I'll start by saying that Pittsburgh's food scene has been exploding as of late with lots of new trendy spots popping up in hipster neighborhoods around town. But Monterey Bay has been a standard in the Burgh for a long time, and I feel like it's only gotten better. Some of the restaurants on Mt. Washington coast by on the views, but that's not the case here!

The views are excellent of course, and the decor is contemporary but still inviting. I think the last time I was here they had a tropical theme going on, but the remodeled interior is beautiful.

We had the ceviche appetizer - I didn't expect to love it as much as I did. It was light and refreshing, and we could tell that the kanpachi was fresh. I had the crab cake and scallops as my entree. The scallops were simply prepared but SO good. If you come here you need to experience a crab cake! They use practically no filler at all. Just enough to keep it together. They are also broiled instead of fried. I honestly don't know if i would ever order anything else here! 

My fianc√© went with the shrimp tagliatelle which was also fabulous. The sauce was delicious and the tagliatelle noodles were cooked perfectly. We were surprised that the pasta dish was so delicious! For dessert we went with the angel food grilled cheese and the hype is real - it's amazing. The portion size was quite large so I think this is perfect to share. I love dessert and this is one of my favorites.

The service was just excellent. Jane our server was so friendly and knowledgeable and the manager stopped by to check on us as well. I can't wait to come back!!

Amazing views, but high prices considering the food quality; you're really paying for the view here, not the food. Food wise, I've had better fish at Umi and Penn Ave, Fish Company.

Service was prompt and friendly, although the decor was surprisingly tacky - palm tree pillars? Really? Probably won't go back again unless someone is visiting from out of town who really wants to see the view.

My husband and I went last evening for a big celebration and it was fantastic. The waiter was attentive and kind, and immediately noted that I had a gluten allergy indicated on my reservation. He brought me gluten-free bread with a separate dish of butter to start (gluten-free bread is essentially never offered at a restaurant). Our seafood trio appetizer was spectacular: a gluten-free crab cake with marinated fish pieces and two jumbo shrimp. Our lobster bisque was great. They pour the soup in with the cream at your table. The flavor was not salty (as some lobster bisques are). Did I mention their lobster bisque is gluten-free?
By the time I got to my main course - lobster risotto - I was too full to heave more than a few bites, so I took most of it home. It was equally good, if not better, re-heated in the oven! 


Our experience was fantastic. It was the most expensive meal we've had in years, but it was well worth it for a big celebration.

This place is a must if you're living in or visiting Pittsburgh. Or if you want to have an outstanding meal! The tables by the Windows go early, but we sat on the second tier and I think that was actually a better view. Everything here was perfect from start to finish. We tried sushi as an appetizer and it was great! For our entree, we had salmon and sea bass. This is the best meal we have had in Pittsburgh!

So far, Monterey Bay Fish Grotto has been the best restaurant we've been to in Pittsburgh. I visited with my wife and three other couples, all new to the area. 7 of the 8 of us are from Miami, Florida and most of us fish and lobster dive, so we are used to excellent and fresh seafood. This place was a hit for all of us. I would like to give it 5 stars, but a couple of things knocked it down to a 4 for me. I'll start with the good, though. 

#1: The view. Obviously, among the best views from any restaurant every where. Everyone at our table had something beautiful to look at (besides their lovely partners, of course), from the Sunset on one side to the city sky line on the other. It was the kind of place where every table had a great view. The decor was also classy, and created a very nice ambience. 

#2: Most of the food was phenomenal. We had calamari, crab cakes, and a sampler appetizer which was delicious. It combined Ahi tempura and Ichiban served on a skewer, each with wonderful texture and flavor. The dessert was a lavender creme brulee which was as delicate, aromatic, and delicious as it sounds. All of my dining companions enjoyed their entrees. My friend to my right had the crab-stuffed giant scallops and couldn't finish them. Thank goodness for me! I got to share some of her left-overs, and it was one of the most perfect bites of food I have ever tasted. the scallop had been seasoned and cooked perfectly, so it had the perfect texture; smooth, not tough or rubbery as it can be when over-cooked. The crab inside was perfection - large chunks of moist delicious crab without any hint of fishiness. It was clearly fresh off of the plane, just as the waitress promised when it was introduced. 

The bad:

#1: The grouper. Again, I am from Miami, and most of the grouper I have eaten in my life went from my own fish hook to my plate, (or maybe my uncle's fish hook if I was having one of my more typical bad luck fishing days). When I've eaten grouper in restaurants, it's always been fresh off of the boat in places like the Florida Keys. Perhaps that's why I found this particular grouper very disappointing. It's hard to explain what was wrong with it, but it just wasn't nearly as good as other grouper I've had. It didn't taste quite as fresh, delicate, or mild. It may have been the way it was prepared. I had it, "Monterey style". This meant it was prepared with artichoke hearts, black olives, tomato, garlic, green onion and mushrooms, saut√©ed in a Marsala wine sauce. This was a definite fail. The flavors were good, but completely over-powered the fish and brought out all of the wrong flavors in it. It seemed like a better seasoning for something like chicken, not grouper. I probably should have gone with Mango pepper style.

#2: The cost. I might have been less dissapointed if I hadn't paid 50-75% more then I ever had for much better grouper in Florida. Well, I guess the flight from MIA to PITT isn't cheap. While I think most of the other dishes were well worth the cost, my entree was less then outstanding. 

I'd still go back, but I won't be ordering grouper, or "Monterey style". I'll probably have more of those incredible scallops all to myself this time. Also, it will probably be for a special occasion, given the price.

Best seafood restaurant in Pittsburgh. Always an amazing experience and a wonderful treat. The city view is incredible and very romantic atmosphere. My absolute favorite place to go to dinner. Love it.
Amazing food to go along with incredible view. creative desserts and cocktails. The seafood is the star. Well worth the trip. Highly recommend!

We come here eat and drink quite often. If you are looking for a sea food dinner, this is the place! All the sea food here is freshly made, I can taste the freshness! Once you go fresh, never want go back to frozen fish. Angle cake is my fav desert here! Grilled cheese sandwich with sweet almond, yum! Writing this review is making me want go back there right now! In the summer. They have my favorite watermelon mojido. I understand people think that this is a standard/common drink, however, it is hard to make a easy drink prefect. A lot of place either have too much syrup or too much alcohol.  Too bad it is a seasonal drink.

I am somewhat conflicted by Monteray Bay. I want to absolutely love this place, but i honestly can't. 
  My wife and i went there recently celebrating our anniversary. It was a pretty big deal to us. When i made the reservation i noted this and hoped to get a window table. I purposely made the reservation slightly off peak. When we arrived, on time, we had to wait almost 15 minutes to be seated. I was disappointed in the seats we were given. I asked politely if there was a chance we could be seated by a window, and was told that would require at least an hour wait. We sat in such a way that my wife had a decent view. I had virtually no view unless a turned almost sideways.
   Oh well, this happens, and i wasn't going to allow it to taint our celebration. Our server greeted us and reviewed some of their specials, bit dinner and appetizer.  They suggested a combo appetizer that had a small crab cake, 2 shrimp, and a skewer with several small pieces of Tuna and Salmon on it. That sounded like a nice light appetizer to share, so we ordered it. We got our drinks and perused the menu. 
   Obviously their focus is on seafood, and they offered a nice selection on their menu. While we were trying to decide, one of the managers came to our table and greeted us. He wished us a happy anniversary(nice touch), and when my wife asked for some input on her choice, he suggested a particular fish. She decided to order what he suggested.
   We received our appetizer, and it was indeed small. Just enough to take the edge off, and very very tasty. My wife wanted to taste their lobster bisque, but didn't want too much food before the entree, so we agreed to share a bowl. The server actually brought it to us already divided into two separate portions(another nice touch). Awesome. It wasn;t quite as good as a local restaurant that we visit, but it was certainly good. 
   The server had taken our order and we were relaxing and talking and enjoying the night.  Then, the server came to our table and informed my wife that her fish choice was not available. Seriously? The recommendation of the manager was not available? Not cool. SHe made another choice and kept her fingers crossed.
   The entrees actually came out pretty quickly. We had ordered a few side dishes since everything there is ala carte.  The food was delicious. The vegetables were cooked perfectly, and everything was very flavorful. We enjoyed our dinners.
   We had a second round of drinks and finished our dinners. The server informed us that since it was our anniversary, if we wished to share a dessert it would be com0plimentary (yet another nice touch). We have the angelfood cake cheese sandwich which was unique and quite good.
   All in all, it was a very nice dining experience and we enjoyed it. So why not 5 stars? Nothing huge, just some small things that added up.
   First of all, i am no stranger to fine dining, and to the cost of fine dining. That said, Monteray bay crosses the line into slightly overpriced. That little appetizer was $27 (had no idea when we ordered it) The Lobster bisque(which had a few small langostinos) was $15. They charged us $7 for water. 
  With all of the competition for fine dining dollars in the area, i think they may be in trouble down the road if they are not careful. From everything i have read and heard, Altius offers a superior dining experience for around the same money. There are other choices too. certainly MB offers a great dining experience, but I am not it is quite worth the check at the end of the night.

This was the one fancy restaurant I had planned for our trip to Pittsburgh and my buddy made all the arrangements for everyone. Pros first.. cons later.

Reservations are highly recommended! FYI, we were seated immediately upon our arrival.

So here goes with the pros:

If I could make a comparison, I'd say this is the Pittsburgh version of Atlanta's Sun Dial in the sense that you get an AMAZING view of downtown (minus the nauseating rotation). Luck was on our side and we got the best table in the house. Often times, a corner table wouldn't be considered ideal, but it is when you've got floor to ceiling windows that open up to two phenomenally beautiful (and almost completely different) views right as the sun was setting, the sky began to darken, and the buildings were beginning to light up.

To start, the gentlemen all ordered stiff drinks while we waited for our complimentary bread basket. One of my friends went ahead and ordered a wine for his entree and asked the waitress for a good pairing. She then brought out a couple of tastings for him until he found one he liked.

We ordered the combination appetizer (not available on the menu - ask for it!) with jumbo Cajun shrimp, crab cake, and Ichiban (tuna, salmon, and swordfish grilled on a skewer). It was unanimous that the crab cake was the star, for it was almost completely jumbo lump crab and no filler. A hint of lemon would be my only suggestion for it.

As for entrees, we had a TOUGH time choosing. All their fish are caught fresh and flown in the same day and the menu offerings are slightly different depending on what is caught. If there's a fish they don't have that day, their menu will reflect so with an "NA" but they like to leave it on in case you want to come back to try it in the future. The preparation options below each fish choice are their recommendations, but you can actually choose any preparation with any fish at no additional cost except for the "oscar" option.
-Enter.. my strawberry prep Chilean Sea Bass -- Chargrilled, finished with fresh peppered strawberries in a red wine sauce. The men were jealous, yes.. jealous of my fruity concoction and voted it best dish at the table. 
-Beau ordered the Swordfish Oscar and it was perfect for him. Swordfish is very dense and it was nicely grilled, so it had a very woody / manly taste to it hahaha. 
-You can never go wrong with surf and turf (also not on the menu, so you should ask for it): filet mignon, a large lobster tail, and cheddar whipped potatoes. My friend said all the food was great but the filet mignon was best of all and cooked to the perfect medium rare.
-Parmesan Chilean Sea Bass was the last of 'em. My friend enjoyed it, but all the cheese is very filling and he couldn't finish his meal, especially with the sides we chose.
-Sides are meant to share here, so we went with the lobster mac and cheese and the seasonal vegetables.

We shared two desserts - a lavender cr√®me brulee and a white chocolate macadamia mousse. I'd skip on the cr√®me brulee unless they have a different flavor. The lavender seriously made it feel like we were eating an air freshener. The mousse looked unappealing because it looked like two mounds of mashed potatoes. But looks can be deceiving, as I learned through the entire dessert round. Heaven.. in.. your.. mouth. Seriously! You must order it.

The presentation for everything was very appealing and well thought out. Portion sizes were very generous, with our fish entrees taking up most of our dinner plates.  You will not leave here hungry, folks.

Service was wonderful. Our waitress was incredibly patient, explained the menu, offered her personal suggestions, and answered all the questions we had. Our drinks were refilled quickly, under the watchful eyes of the water guys. The manager even came over personally to ask how our dinner was and if there was anything they could do to make our dining experience even better (to which we said no). 

They offer valet service for a fee. I'm not sure what it was because we opted to park one street over for free.

After all that's said and done.. what could I possibly have to say that is less than radiant?

- My buddy told me he got a LOT of grief for changing the reservation from 3 people to 4. I understand how it might be a hassle to change a reservation from 4 to 5 since all the tables sat 2 and were pushed together to accommodate more.
-We were promised our complimentary bread basket but it took a very long time for it to arrive; even the waitress thought so, too. We were starving and drinking on empty stomachs.
-You ride an elevator up to the restaurant and there's a bit of a wait, since there's a small limit as to how many people can be inside at one time. Going down was much quicker.

Perfect for a romantic evening or when you're in your fancy schmancy mood and want to get dressed up to eat something delicious. Hey, anywhere they use a comb brush to clean the table is entitled to using the term "fancy schmancy" okay?

5/5 for view (Get a window seat!), absolutely stunning views. 

5/5 for waitstaff, friendly and professional. We ordered a plate of oysters that my mother deemed not fresh enough, and they they immediately took it off our check

3/5 for food. What do you expect from seafood this far inland? The sauce on my halibut was a little too sweet for my liking, and the oysters weren't fresh, but otherwise it was fine, not amazing

The food here was delicious and well-prepared, but be prepared to pay a bit more for the lovely views overlooking Pittsburgh.  The service was attentive and not overbearing, fairly knowledgeable, friendly, and it's a white cloth sort of place, albeit not stuck up.  I give it a four star simply because I think it's rather overpriced.  

Onto the food:  
- Beef carpaccio with a dash of truffle oil:  Solid but nothing to write home about.  Truffle oil isn't too overwhelming.  
- Lobster bisque:  Beautifully done classic.  No complaints here. 
- Whole fish with olives and other veggies:  Mine was black bass and it was delicious, just barely cooked, lightly seasoned.  
- Redfish curry:  Pretty light on the curry and not really a Thai or Indian or Japanese or any traditional curry, but tasty. 
- Angel food cake grilled cheese:  Yes, it sounds bizarre, but my dining companions said it was the star of the desserts.  
- Chocolate cheesecake and chocolate mousse dessert:  My dining companions said these were quite good.  

For drinks, the smoke Manhattan was more like a decent traditional Manhattan.

We go to MB for special occasions!  Saturday night we sat down and it was about 10-15 minutes before anyone even came by with water.  Drinks and appetizers were fine. Our fish preparation was delicious as usual. We had the tri color potatoes and corn for the sides. They were not hot upon arrival.  They were cafeteria quality. We each tasted the potatoes and left them. Our waiter swung by a time or two. Our water glasses were never refilled.  MB is an expensive restaurant and the service was always fantastic. The service wasn't even close to fantastic on our most recent experience.  It's time to find a new restaurant to celebrate our special occasions.

Excellent view & service, somewhat 'dated' interior (still acceptable) - 4 stars 
Appetizer: jumbo shrimp cocktail(5), ahi tempura, crab cake - all pretty good, 4 stars
Entr√©e: hawaiian ahi tuna sesame style, Chilean sea bass, and another fish whose name I cannot recall. They were somehow all so salty. Wish they put less salt in it. 3 stars.
Got chocolate cake for dessert-Okay.
It is a pricey place. 3 adults paid $300 for dinner including a bottle of wine.

One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh! If you love fresh fish you must try this place! There are fish from several seas from all over the globe. All of the sides are a la carte and somewhat shareable for maybe 2-3 people. The date salad is to die for! I've never had the same thing twice and I've never had a bad experience!!

I've been lucky enough to eat here twice in my life. It truly is a wonderful experience
 from start to finish. I agree that the decor could use a little refresh, but it's not bad enough to turn me away. 

On my most recent trip there (2/24/12) my bf and I both walked away feeling like the money spent there was well worth it. Our waiter, Glen, was outstanding, the manager came to our table twice to make sure we were having a good time, and the food was out of this world. Considering the variety on their menu, I already can't wait to go back! I have 3 things lined up in my head.  

P.S. The Gentlemen's Cocktail is the best drink on the menu!

I've been to Monterey Bay multiple times.  Four years ago we had terrible service and haven't been back.  Fast forward to now.  We have decided to have a small wedding ceremony and reception with just family (10 people).  We wanted to come into Monterey Bay for our small reception dinner.  We didn't need a private room, just a nice table that we were hoping would be near the windows for the best view and a little more private.  

I called and spoke with the hostess. We explained that it would be our wedding reception dinner and that we were just interested in ordering from the menu.  We asked about seating and if they would accommodate a window seat, or what they would suggest since it is a special night out.  The hostess bluntly informed me that they do not reserve window seats and it is first come first serve.  If someone before our 6:30 reservation requested that table, they would receive it instead of us.  Ok... I can understand that. I can appreciate that policy.  But, this is a small wedding dinner. This is a special day for us, even if we aren't planning on spending over 25K for a full blown private reception, we feel that we should get to have a special night.  We made the reservation and I continued to search for other options.  

Yesterday, we found another restaurant on Mt. Washington that would accommodate us, gave us the information for their pastry chef so that we could have a special dessert created, and was excited to have us as patrons at their restaurant.  I called to cancel our Monterey Bay reservations and I explained why we were canceling.  The hostess replied with, "OK - we'll cancel your reservation" and hung up.  Guess they don't really care that we will never be back, or that they have zero customer service to patrons that were planning on spending up to or more than $2,000 on dinner, drinks, and desserts...
simple .menu choices good fresh sea food, good service worth the money. ..great city view to dine at night

We had dinner here for my wife's birthday on Friday August 26. She was greeted with Happy Birthday's from everyone which was nice. Our server was Jane who did a very nice job of pacing our dinner, we take our time. Also good with pacing our wine pours. She helped to make our dinner very comfortable. Our dinners were delicious. A sampler platter with shrimp, tuna and crab cake, salads, the crab stuffed scallops and parmesan halibut were all excellent. My wife received a birthday dessert and was the angel food grilled cheese sandwich and that was wonderful. They go all out to make your occasion special. The manager came over to introduce himself. Not an everyday restaurant because prices are not low but for special occasions great to go. $6 parking with nice attendants. Great views.

I want to give this place 5 stars for the crab cakes!!! Unfortunately, my review has to be comprehensive. Hands down, best crab cakes I've ever had! I had them as an appetizer and a main! Anyone who goes here must try the crab cakes! 

Overall, all their seafood is well done, but nothing you would crave for. The only two things I crave - the crab cakes and the butter served with the bread basket! And believe it or not, these are enough to keep me going back!

Service was good, as it should be for a fine dining restaurant.

A romantic spot for special occasions. Spent almost exactly 200 for myself and my fiance but it was worth every penny! We had crab cakes, swordfish, asparagus, Au gratin potatoes, bottle of wine, and split a peach cobbler cheesecake. Everything was amazing!

I haven't been here since their remodel and revamp, so I was interested in seeing how the restaurant had changed. The aesthetic here now is much more modern and reflective of the high end dining experience you get here. As I'm sure you already know, don't dine here unless you're prepared to pay at least $50 per person. Entrees here vary in cost, but average probably around $35. There are also a variety of appetizers, soups, salads and side dishes, as well as alcohol and dessert. It adds up very quickly. I had the Lobster Bisque soup as a starter. The server brought the bowl to me, with the lump lobster inside and then poured the soup overtop into the bowl in front of me. It was a really nice and flavorful soup with a considerable amount of lobster meat. For dinner, I had the Crab Cakes. The cakes were very generous in size and had more meat than filler. I would definitely recommend them just like many other Yelpers here have. I also got to try the lobster mac and cheese. This was also delicious. It is on the sides menu, but was big enough to have as an Entree.

One cannot review Monterey Bay without first mentioning the incredible view of the city. We took the trolley up Mt. Washington and walked to the restaurant during the evening and were fortunate it was a clear night with an incredible view of Pittsburgh while it was lit up with lights and a Pirates game in the background. The restaurant offers great views with an abundance of windows. I can't think there's a better view in all of Pittsburgh. The food also was delicious. The rockfish was fresh with excellent seasoning and I would also recommend trying the dessert menu, which offers some unique and delicious twists on traditional desserts. There are two negatives of note: first, where we sat they had tables for two that were arranged length-wise so you sit very far apart from each other--I think this was done to cram more tables into that particular area of the restaurant; second, once the waiter saw that we were only ordering less expensive entrees with no sides (which are priced individually), he was dismissive and perturbed and not interested in serving us. Otherwise, I would highly recommend as a required stop in Pittsburgh.

Amazing views and a decent menu no sushi. It was the whole reason we went because of the pictures of sushi we saw when we looked it up. Rating not reflecting that our stupidity of google. I'm not a seafood lover but they do have a couple very expensive steaks. My filet was good not great $45 worth but good. And our calamari was awesome, I do like calamari. And cocktails weren't as expensive as I thought which is good but our waiter was not on top of our drinks at all. I was finding myself with an empty glass too often and had to flag him down every time to get one. In all we had a good anniversary dinner.

Maybe it was an off day but 3 out of 3 things we tried just weren't that great. The view is AMAZING but the food was pretty mediocre unfortunately (Three strikes you're out!). It's probably better to just come here for drinks to be honest. At least the service was very friendly.

Chilean seabass with korean bbq preparation. It sounded great... but.. it didnt taste very impressive. When I think seabass I think flaky, buttery tasting fish. This was kinda dry and mostly tasteless. Maybe they cooked it too long, I dunno? But it didnt taste like anything special, ESPECIALLY for $39. Probably the worst seabass I've had to be honest.

Lobster mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was runny and just not that good. Usually mac and cheese is rich, gooey and tasty but not this one. It ended up with a bunch of watery sauce in the plate and while it wasn't terrible, it def was not good.

Fettucini with salmon. Of all the things this was probably the best... of the worst. It was ok. If it was 12 bucks id probably be like "you know that wasnt so bad" but it was nothing to write home about. My pasta ended up stuck together in a huge mass that practically needed to be cut to separate. The salmon chunks that came with it were ok. Nothing special.

Basically I would NEVER eat dinner here again. They've won awards so maybe I just had an off night. Regardless, I just can't recommend you eat here. Come here and go downstairs and get some drinks and enjoy the view, skip the food.
Great service please eat the red snapped Cajun style. It was great!! First time in Steeler Country.

Monterrey Bay is easy to praise, mostly for the extraordinary view and attractive dining room. The praise is well deserved. However, I can't get to 5* because the food is only good, not great. Last night we had two different preparations of sole as mains, the gratin potato side, and the signature desert, 'Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich' to finish. Everything was fine, but nothing was remarkably good. Service was just right and the wine list offered a couple of fairly priced California Chardonnays, a must for me, although they were well hidden. This is obviously a special occasion restaurant, with a very memorable view and prices to match.
I had the crab cakes as usual. My wife had the halibut.  Everything was awesome as usual!

Went here recently with my boyfriend for my birthday. We both loved everything! We had a beautiful view of the sunset and our food was delicious! Definitely pricey but worth it for a special occasion and nothing we didn't expect. Can't wait to return

Spectacular view. average food ran out of mahi didn't discount halibut. No way a halibut filet ought to cost $33.  shrimp scampi more like soup grab the lounge corner table closest to the city!
50% premium on food for the view
Supercrabcakes

We just had or 19th anniversary dinner at Monterey and it was outstanding
The service is top notch
I made the reservation through open table and asked for a window seat and noted it was our anniversary. From the second we checked in every one that greeted us congratulated us!
We were taken to our beautiful seat right at the window
The waitress was the best I ever had Cindy! Cindy was with the company as long as we've been married and was knowledgable and friendly
She was funny and even took or picture without asking.
We had the trio appetizer which was the famous crab cake, ichoban and a few Cajun shrimp! 
For the entree We both had the fresh halibut, mine was prepared with apples and chorizo sausage and crusted with a finely ground granola. It tasted like fall!
My wife had hers prepared with the parmesan sauce and it was also outstanding  
Then as a great surprise we were given a complimentary dessert for our celebration !
Although you do pay for the view, the food is excellent
Fresh and perfectly prepared

Not bad.. high quality steak asked for medium came out medium rare.. had the Brussels sprouts not bad.. the view and the ambience are a 10/10.. It is the highest point in Pittsburgh I would have to say.. you can see far back to homestead... Def pricey

I love this restaurant. I had my rehearsal dinner in the private room here and they were amazing. All of the food came out incredible, the service was terrific, and everyone had only good things to say. It also has the greatest view of downtown Pittsburgh and I like to come here for special occasions. The fresh fish can't be beat!

The first time I came here for a date night.  The service was great, the entrees (Swordfish chop was somewhat bland and salmon was very flavorful) where decent and the desserts amazing (Angel food Grilled Cheese and the Chocolate Guava Roll).  My first experience was 4 out of 5 stars; however, the second time was a 2 out of 5 stars.

So my second time here was for a birthday party (8 guests total).  Upon arrival, for a 7:30 reservation, we had to wait in the lounge as they didn't have s table (there were a great deal that said reserved) which makes no sense if we had a confirmed reservation.  So we had a few drinks and then they sat us.  Our server was great; however, lack of communication from the kitchen made the night frustrating.  Several of us ordered a Chilean Sea Bass; however, 30-45 minutes after ordering we are told that they were out.  They were also out of the lobster mac and cheese that had been ordered.  We decide on another entree, but guess what, they were out.  We finally found something that they had (I got the yellow fin tuna) and then continued on with our conversations.  So some members of our group decided to order more wine, but guess what, they were out of the wine they wanted.  I wanted dessert as did my girlfriend; however, they were out of the chocolate guava roll (the only dessert my girlfriend could eat).  It is a good thing that we had brought an ice cream cake!  Oh but they managed to botch that up slightly because the hostess staff member who originally took it back to the kitchen had placed it in the dairy cooler!  So instead we had something between a piece of cake and a milkshake for dessert.  They even ran out of bags to put leftovers in!  Long story short, they were unable to provide 16 items that we requested.  I understand that they could be running low on items by Sunday night, but they could have informed us in a reasonable and timely fashion (improve the communication between the wait staff and the kitchen).  The wait staff was great and we actually were able to joke with them about being out of everything.  My biggest issue is that we didn't get anything comped, and with all the issues from the kitchen, I would have expected the chief to come out and personally apologize.

I am actually going back this Saturday to try their Sakari portion of the restaurant.  I hope it is smooth sailing or it may be the last time I dine here.

Average at best.... We came for a birthday celebration based on the wishes of the birthday'er, but I found the food to be overpriced and generally not so good. The view of the city is great and the service is generally pleasant.

So what missed the mark? Lobster bisque was an epic fail. I'm a fan of seafood bisque and this worried me. The texture, consistency, and look reminded me of butternut squash soup. It was chunks of what was supposed to be lobster and soup poured over. It was quite tasteless.

For the entree, I ordered the red snapper with lemon and brown sugar sauce. Hubs got swordfish with chimichurri sauce. Our companions had a lemon sole with strawberry sauce and another halibut with parmesan crust, who enjoyed their fish. Unfortunately, hubs and I found ours undercooked. Not good for swordfish when the texture is suppose to be meater. The chimichurri sauce was minimal as plating decoration. The fish covered with jalape√±o and cilantro and parsley.... The red snapper was a bit worrisome, too soft a texture. The skin still on and the sauce way too overpowering by the butter.

We also ordered sides: brussels sprouts with bacon (oily, but good), potatoes (fine, as expected), and asparagus (bad! Hubs thought the bottom could be trimmed, I think they were pass their prime).

We had steaming mocha latte, Angel food grill cheese, and strudel for desserts. The Angel food grill cheese was the winner.

Service was attentive, but incredibly slow. We waited a long time for our entrees. Very long. No one came to check on us during that time, but they comped one dessert for the wait. Unfortunately, dessert was another wait.

Not sure I get it. Definitely doesn't live up to the hype.

Amazing view and excellent service . I had a Rosemary Greentea cocktail and it was delicious ! The food is really good . My husband and I tried the cevich ( i have had better) and I got Chilean sea bass and Ahi Tina 

Must Try the Brussels Sprouts 
My waitress her name was Christina -she was so sweet.

Excellent crab cakes, service staff.  Valentines dinner was a great experience. 

Shrimp cocktail and asparagus were good.  Really nice portion sizes on the side dishes.

My fianc√© surprised me with dinner at the Monterey Bay last night. Our server Jeffery was absolutely amazing. He was friendly, prompt and very knowledgable of the specials and menu. We had a seat right next to the window so we were able to watch the sun set as we enjoyed dinner. Food was delicious you could tell the fish was fresh. Only downside is that I wish the dinners came with a side or even a salad for the price that you're paying. Definitely would go back again though.

Went here for a business dinner. We were seated in a corner table with amazing views of Pittsburgh, best seat in the house. Service very attentive throughout the meal, really top notch. Food, however, not quite up to par at this price point. Appetizers were not plated such that they could be easily shared and entrees were, by most accounts, on the bland side.
The food was amazing, the views were spectacular, and our waitress was really knowledgeable of the menu and bartenders' specialties. This was by far the best dining experience I've had to date.

This place is awesome. I recently went here with my girlfriend. It was the first time I was here since after their renovation. We each had a few cocktails and dinner.
