The view is second to none, being it is overlooking the city on a high floor in Mt Washington connected to and apartment complex. The server was very knowledgeable about the food and was good to answer any questions we had about the menu. My girlfriend got some sushi. It looked and tasted amazing. She has lived in Florida and Baltimore and she said it was some of the best she's had. Both presentation and taste wise. I got some crab stuffed shrimp which was also amazing. There fresh fish selection is so good. It is always tough for me to pick something because I want it all. If you are having some drinks and dinner, expect to pay at least $150.00. It is well worth it though for a nice dinner out. We live in Mt Washington now, so we will be back.

As a born and raised Pittsburgher, it's astonishing that this was only my 2nd time visiting Monterey Bay. Monterey Bay is an old staple, and has been around for a long time, and it sometimes gets overlooked with all of the new and trendy restaurants in Pittsburgh now. It did not disappoint. Even though I live on Mt. Washington, there's something special about taking the elevator up to the restaurant while observing the city. 

Dinner starts with a delicious selection of bread and a homemade butter. We started with the Kanpachi Seviche. I was shocked at how tasty it was, especially for someone who is a pretty picky seafood eater. One thing to note, this starter has a little kick to it with the jalapenos, but you can easily eat around those if you don't like them.

For my entree, I ordered the Brandied Shrimp Tagliatelle. Delicious sauce, pasta cooked perfectly, and more than enough shrimp. If this is your first visit, you must try their crab cakes as that's their specialty. I was lucky enough to have a taste of my fiance's. 

In addition to delicious food, restaurants that provide top notch service always stand out. Our server, Jane, was amazing. The GM stopped at our table to make sure everything was okay, and that is much appreciated. 

We shared the angel food grilled cheese dessert. Great way to end the meal. Must visit in Pittsburgh.

This is a must! For all you seafood lovers out there! The view is amazing, it could not get any better! The food was excellent, and an affordable price:) it was very classy, you will have to dress up~ no
jeans!

My boyfriend's parents took us here a few days before Christmas and it was just amazing. The ambiance is wonderful and the menu is mouthwatering. The views of the city are beautiful and it was nicely decorated for the holidays. 
There is a kabob fish appetizer that is killer- I believe it was called Ichiban. Amazing. I never saw the wine list as his dad ordered, but both bottles we got were great!

Everyone got a different fish prepared in a different manner. I got scallops with a lobster sauce. It was tasty but SO SALTY, which is why I cannot give 5 stars. Everyone else's meal was really good. The dessert was also amazing! I had the creme brulee which was fantastic, and my boyfriend's mom got a bailey's cookie cheesecake which I could've eaten 5 of! 

Our waiter was SUPER duper attentive- almost annoyingly so, but I know he had good intentions! lol. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and great Saturday night treat. It was pricey, but worth it for a special occasion!
One of the best, most memorable meals of my life.  We had a party of 10 and everyones dinner was outstanding.  I had the sea bass with red curry and jasmine rice.  I still dream about it.

Until last night,  it had been a while since my husband and I had eaten at Monterey Bay. We had always enjoyed the food. Unfortunately,  that was not the case this time. On a positive note, the server was professional and very attentive; and of course, the view is magnificent. To start, I ordered the Caesar salad which arrived with wilted lettuce that was drenched in a flavorless dressing. For the main course, I decided on the Coq au Vin which proved to be the wrong choice. When the dish came, all I could see was a miniscule piece of chicken drowning in a sea of a heavy dark brown sauce, accompanied by no garnish, nothing. My husband ordered the stuffed shrimp which included 4 petite overcooked shrimp. Needless to say, we were exceedingly disappointed. Again, the view is spectacular, but it's not worth the high price of the lackluster food.

My friend brought me here to celebrate earning my masters degree and a major birthday.  We had a reservation for 5:30 and got the last window table.  You cannot reserve a window table specifically, FYI.  The view here is definitely amazing.  You will be lucky to walk out of here for less than $100/person, but you are definitely paying for the atmosphere as well as good food.

We started out with the Seared Kobe ($25) and a sampler platter that had Ichiban, crab cake, and something else.  The platter was delicious, and we especially loved the crab cake and ichiban.  The seared Kobe was not really my thing.  It is a cold, tender, fatty beef, and while the quality was good, it was too salty for my taste.  The meal also starts with fresh bread and a delicious chive butter that was amazing.  I regret not eating more of the bread.

I ordered the stuffed shrimp ($32) for dinner.  It was four shrimp with plenty of crab and tasted really delicious.  It was one of the best stuffed shrimp meals I have ever eaten.

Sadly, our server was SO rude throughout dinner, and I have no idea what her problem was.  She tried to rush us through the entire meal.  Our appetizer came out 5 minutes after we ordered it, and the entrees about 10 minutes after the appetizer.  When the food came out, it wasn't hot, and we didn't have time to eat it before it got cold.  The server never came back to the table so we asked a manager to heat it up.  He ended up having it remade, which was above and beyond what I expected.  But after he did that, she was even ruder throughout our meal.  It was fairly off-putting.  Luckily, the guy refilling the waters was a gem.  The manager did a great job as well and was really nice, but the server was just inappropriate for this kind of place.

All in all, aside from our weird server, this is a nice place to come for a celebratory dinner.

Dinner was amazing I highly recommend the crab cakes for an appetizer with the house salad to follow. For your entree go with the Caribbean sea bass and a bottle of Jordan cab to go with it. Make sure you save room for dessert bc you ate going to want to try grandmas carrot cake as well as my favorite the Oreo lollipops.

Been here a total of 3 times, all for different occasions. Have been satisfied every time. Probably the best Jumbo Lump crab cakes you can find in Pittsburgh. Freshest of fish, one time I got the Halibut with a mandarin orange finish and it tasted really fresh and very well done. Most recently, I ordered the Mahi Mahi with cranberry sauce and it was also very well prepared and tasted awesome. Every time I stop by, the service is impeccable, i'm always surprised at how much the wait staff have memorized for the every changing menu. I definitely recommend ordering some side dishes, you can't go wrong with a few Oysters on a half shell to start and then some Lobster Mac & Cheese to compliment your meal. Finally, they have a great Dessert menu, twice now i've gotten the White Chocolate Macadamia Mousse, honestly there isn't much better you can do to finish off a wonderful meal. Big enough to share with 2 or 3 too.

One of our all time favorite restaurants. The seafood quality here is the best I have ever had. We usually do a few appetizers and then default to tuna for dinner. Desserts are also phenomenal. The wine menu is pretty broad, with most starting in the $50s. Both food and service are always very consistent. The restaurant overlooks the three rivers and is probably one of the best views in the city.

This place is definitely worth the higher price you pay.  The view is amazing and the salmon was the best cooked salmon I have ever had.  We started with the calamari, which was extremely tasty. The portions of the main course were great (huge piece of fish).  We also had a "shareable" side.. which is most definitely shareable!  Everything we ate was phenomenal.  To top it off, the view is stunning, and the atmosphere is wonderful.
I've been here twice for two special occasions and I've been highly satisfied each time. All the guests I brought with me were blown away by the view and the food. I highly recommend this place!

I haven't been in here in almost 10 years and it's just like I remember it.  The food is still excellent, the view is still gorgeous and the decor is exactly the same.  I would give the restaurant five stars on food and view alone but the place just feels so outdated and needs a face lift.  The giant bubbly fish tank when you walk in, the faux palm trees on the ceiling, the dark and dingy entrance way before you take the elevator up....

but on to the positives.  I went here for lunch and it wasn't crowded at all so we got a great window seat.  I ordered the rodi grille salmon with a side of green beans in a sweet chili sauce.  The salmon comes in a teriyaki sauce and was grilled to perfection.  I also ordered a glass of the Riesling and it was on the sweeter side but really good.  For dessert, I opted for the birthday cake cheesecake and it went beyond my expectations.  If you don't have a sweet tooth then this dessert isn't for you because I'm pretty sure I got a sugar high.  It was a cheesecake with birthday cake layers.  The icing was delicious and it looked a bit like a mini confetti birthday cake.  YUM!

I also sampled the crab cakes that my coworker ordered, which they are known for.  Fabulous.  All in all, good experience although I'll issue fair warning that it's a pricey meal even if you opt out of wine and dessert.  Good service, awesome food, I just can't get past that awful outdated 80s decor.....

Delicious food! Great service. The fish is really great, nicely cooked and very delicious.

Their iced tea is really great too.

We had mac and cheese with bacon and I think pumpkin in it which was amazing. 

The view is wonderful. Super happy overall with this restaurant.

The food was amazing - very fresh and well balanced. The service was even better! Shane took care of us and literally made us feel like we were the only ones in the restaurant. He is so pleasant & warm. So genuine in his delivery & recommendations. Ask for him when you're here!

My wife and I decided to go here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. First and foremost its killer views of Pittsburgh, we managed to get a window set, just amazing views. Now the service was very good, what I would expect for fine dining, the decor felt like a throwback to the 80s, the place needs a serious remodel, I notice these things being a contractor. The food is average and way way way overpriced! First I ordered oysters on the half shell, there where 6 oysters literally the size of a dime for $18, next came the lobster bisque, it was good, I've had much better for half the price, then came the scallops on a bed of gtits and some fried okra which was a signature dish of the chef, I could have swore the waiter said there was 6 that came with the meal, it came out with 4  for $38, are you kidding me? I assume because of the view of Pittsburgh it allows them to seriously overcharge for everything.    I love eating fine dining and I expect to pay for the experience, service and atmosphere that comes with fine dining, but I also expect outstanding food and reasonable portions, this was very average and terribly small portions for the price, oh and I forgot about the really bad and very small cup of coffee at the end of the meal that had obviously been sitting for awhile, $3 for 1 cup, folks there are much better fine dining restaurants around town than this one, although the view is still killer here.
Filet mignon was great and the night view was tooooooo awesome! The atmosphere in the restaurant was romantic!!

I had my husband take me to Monterey Bay Fish Grotto for our wedding anniversary. We rode the inclines up and down Mount Washington to get to and from the restaurant. We were lucky enough to get a seat in the restaurant near a window. We did not have much of a view of the downtown area, because those tables were already taken, but we still had a very good view of the stadium, rivers, etc. We had difficulty selecting our appetizers and entrees because the menu had such a vast selection of fish. Eventually we made up our minds. The food did taste good. I appreciated that the restaurant gave my husband and me a free dessert to share because of our anniversary.
Came here after going up the Duquesne Incline. Had drinks and appetizers at the bar. Drinks were excellent as well as the appetizers. The main thing about this place....the view. It is spectacular!

***This review is for the angel food grilled cheese sandwich--I enjoyed dessert but not a full meal here.***

During the five years that I lived in Pittsburgh, I rarely made it up to Mt. Washington.  Because of the stunning views, however, I made sure that my last meal in PGH was there.  I was able to try not one but *two* of the high-end restaurants on the Duquesne Heights side, and Monterey Bay Fish Grotto was one of them.

Having heard that the angel food grilled cheese was reputed to be the best restaurant dessert in PGH, and given that I have a serious sweet tooth (hence my Bakery Queen status), I knew I needed to try it before I flew the coop for good.  Although my dining partner and I were quite full from dinner, a hearty walk on the trail leading down--and subsequently up--the mountain freed up some precious stomach real estate.  I asked my dining partner if we could get dessert at Monterey Bay so I could try the angel food grilled cheese and he agreed, so we ascended the elevator and took a seat in the lounge by the bar.

When we asked for a dessert menu, our waitress explained that the angel food grilled cheese ($10) was their signature dessert, but I required no convincing because I'd already done my research, as usual.  When it came, it looked exactly as the photos of it I'd seen had led me to believe that it would look--beautifully plated and scrumptious!  The pound cake bread was bruleed (toasted?) using a blowtorch, just like a creme brulee, and its warmth and softness complemented the cooler, creamy sweetened cream cheese interior.  It was served with a flavorful berry compote that was well-balanced in its sweet-tartness, as well as a scoop of vanilla ice cream that provided a chilled, creamy foil.  The entire dish was sprinkled with toasted almond slivers, and was garnished by a sprig of fresh mint leaves.

The variety of flavors and textures was everything I'd hoped for--and more!  The variations in sweetness between the different components, as well as the textures ranging from soft and airy to smooth and creamy to light and crunchy, made every bite fascinating.  Without a doubt, I agree that it's easily the best restaurant dessert in PGH, and it rivals Prantl's burnt as PGH's most unique and delicious dessert.

My dining partner ordered the chocolate torte ($9), which also had a nice variety of flavors and textures, though it wasn't nearly as extensive.  It reminded me of a similar dessert I had at Bartram House Bakery near the South Side Works, but the ingredients and overall product were superior in quality.  If you're a diehard fan of dark chocolate and can't fathom the idea of a dessert without chocolate, it's worth a try.  If you're adventurous like me, however, get the angel food grilled cheese and don't look back!

As I'd expect at a restaurant of this caliber, service was knowledgeable and attentive yet unobtrusive, and had the class not to play hooky (no pun intended!) upon learning we were dessert only customers.  Aside from the food and service, the obvious selling point is the view, which was quite unique from our vantage point.  From where we were seated, we had an unobstructed view of both the front and back of the mountain, which was quite unique and special.  Looking out at the twinkling lights of the city skyline one last time from my comfortable chair while enjoying a unique and delicious dessert, for a few magical moments, I felt like a high roller rather than a lowly postdoctoral researcher, endowing me with a special lasting memory of my final evening as a resident of Pittsburgh.

A classic Pittsburgh dining experience with the most amazing views of the city. On the top of Mount Washington you have one of the best seafood restaurants in the city of Steele. Food is always fantastic, the atmosphere busy, loud and welcoming. This is an ideal place to take clients for dinner, or a business dinner. Also not a bad spot for date night. Do what you can to get a table with a view, or at least grab a drink in the bar enjoy the views of downtown Pittsburgh and the rivers. The food is outstanding. You will not be disappointed.

Always enjoy our dinners at Monterrey and the views are amazing.  

Here's the secret... Eat downstairs in the lounge area.  It's quaint, you have the same menu and amazing views! Oh and it's quieter too.

I've been gluten free for the past few years, and people are always asking what I miss the most. It's probably a good crab cake. Most crab cakes have bread crumbs or something to hold it all together. Monterey Bay knows how to do it right without the gluten. You do have to tell them when you order, but they are friendly to people with allergies or special diets. (I guess they should be very friendly at that price point).

Or course, the view is wonderful too, and there's not a bad seat in here. The restaurant is tiered so there's tons of great views of the city. Try to catch a sunset up here for dinner. It's certainly a site to see. I can't tell you too much about the food since we always order the crab cakes! So - I'd highly recommend getting them!

ask the server for a favorite...when I went I had a "blackened" fish entree and it was like eating charcoal. Others at the table all said there food was excellent so I must have made a poor choice. Don't order anything blackened and you'll probably be happy.

The seafood here is DELICIOUS and FRESH and FLAVORFUL. The portions are reasonable and we probably over ordered on the appetizers and side dishes, but our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. They were able to sit us close enough to the table, since we had a big party and see some of the views. We had friends from out of town and wanted to show off parts of Pittsburgh to them.

We started with the crab cakes, tuna sashimi and mussels HK style. The crab cakes were the BEST and LEGIT all crab. I could skip the mussels and tuna for next time. The wasabi on the tuna was really potent and the mussels weren't plump this time of the year. I had the black cod sable fish and it was perfectly cooked. Each bite was filled with happiness and the meat was just a perfect combination of tenderness, juiciness and joy. The waiter service was friendly and played along our jokes. All of the other dishes of fish were also delectable. We're big sharers at this table. For the sides, we got the pumpkin risotto, brussel sprouts, lobster mac n cheese and sauteed greens. The risotto was great with a little bit of sweetness. The mac and cheese was well done with a hint of lobster. I didn't enjoy the brussel sprouts as they were too soft for me. I would definitely come back for more.

Super overpriced food and wine, but wasn't terrible so it's ok. The Views were breathtaking and loved the romantic ambiance. We were lucky enough to get window seating and UGH it was amazing. My two favorite things in the world: views and wine. The food wasn't the best, but everything else made up for it.

Ordered:
x ROCKFISH (parmesan coated, lemon peppercorn cream sauce) - yummyyyy. I love fish and this was so different than what I'm used to eating. 
x GRILLED WEDGE (baby iceberg, smoked blue cheese, pickled red onions, pancetta, sriracha red peppers) - A little too much dressing for my liking, but wedge salads are my favorite! I always feels like its extra fresh.
x Brussel Sprouts - Too mushy, but the flavors were AMAZING!! Brussel sprouts are one of my favorite veggies :0)
x ANGEL FOOD GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH (caramelized angel food cake, cream cheese filling, seasonal berry compote, vanilla ice cream, toasted sweet and salty almonds) - I'm not the biggest fan of desserts, especially in restaurants as I prefer to devour a box of chocolates instead... but this was super yummy! I love angel food cake! We shared and still did finish it.

Cute date night spot. We took the trolly up and it made the experience that much better :0)

This restaurant has a great view of the city from pretty much every table.  We took the incline up, and the restaurant is only about a 5 minute walk from the top.  We were 30 minutes early, unsure of how long it would take to get to the incline and up to the top so they had us wait in the bar until our table was ready.  The bar has a great view of the city too, and it took only about 10 minutes for them to get our table ready. 

The service was very good, however, our table was in an awkward spot.  There were two tables with large parties behind us, so they had expanded those tables making the waiters and waitress' jobs difficult, often squeezing between my chair and the chair behind me.  It seemed like our table could have been moved to accommodate the large parties and the service lanes needed.  (the first chair I sat in also had a nail sticking out, but since there were 4 chairs and only 3 of us, i switched chairs and let our server know). 

We had the Ichiban, crab cakes and jumbo shrimp for a starter and all were delicious. We all had different kinds of fish ( salmon, rockfish, halibut) which were great.  The salmon was good, but I like it more well done and it was rare in the middle.  

For desert, we had the chocolate latte cake (which may be one of my favorite deserts ever) and the key lime tarte.

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone for a fancy dinner, with a beautiful view.

An incredible dining experience overall.  Great food, great service (thanks Kayla), and fantastic views.  I was disappointed in how the mgr dealt with a minor issue.  They served a dessert wo the listed ice cream.  I realized that a few bites into it.  I ment I need it and Kayla said their ice cream had melted and she just found out when she picked it up.  I would have expected a restaurant to ask if I still wanted it before serving it.  So I asked for a discount and they said their policy was they don't discount food. What?   Is it also their policy to occasionally not serve items as listed?  It was a minor issue but it really bugged me how they handled it.  They did offer me a free tree or cappuccino.  Bit that aside I would highly recommend the restaurant.

summary: the spectacular view will distract you from the food anyway.

The food is actually not bad. As long as the fish is fresh, it's hard to go really wrong (just forgo the over-priced desserts). The kitchen can be uneven when busy (e.g., overcooked tuna or lukewarm side dishes on separate visits). But the staff seem eager to help if you bring the problems to their attention.

The restaurant strives for an upscale dining ambiance, and their success is, in no small part, thanks to the lovely view. The service is attentive, if a bit overly scripted/rehearsed.

Good for business meals (especially when you're not sure what everyone likes, and when someone else is picking up the tabs).

3.5 stars

This restaurant is my absolute favorite restaurant on mt. washington.
They not only have amazing food, but they also have stunning view, exotic interior, and tasty cocktails. 

FOOD - I have tried many fish dishes and almost all appetizers and I was never disappointed. However, I didnt really like their steaks. Also, their cocktails are all great(flavorful and not so strong). Oh and one thing I hated that I had was their lobster bisque. It was too salty, so we asked them if they could make it less salty, but we still couldnt eat it because it was way too salty.

SERVICE - I went there for my friends' bdays and my anniversary, and every time, they gave us free desserts with special writings on them. Also, servers frequently ask us if we need anything, and they are pretty quick and very friendly.

AMBIANCE - its a great place for big groups, couples, and families in special events.

I had a wonderful evening, it was far more than I expected.  First I took the incline up from the Sheraton on Wednesday evening last week.  It was a short walk from the station.  I was pleasantly surprised to find upon entering I would be taking an elevator UP further to the restaurant the view from the elevator was even more spectacular than from the incline.  The place was busy but the hostess told me I could enjoy the same view and menu from the bar.  The view there did not disappoint, nor did the staff.  I found out about this place from the cab driver that drove me to the hotel from the airport, he raved about the crab cake being better than the ones in MD.  I did try the crab cake as an appetizer, it was very good, delicious, not as good as one from Faidleys but it was very good, quite tasty.  The bar staff was very receptive, very helpful in my wine selections.  I had a brut with my crab cake and a Murphy Goode sauvignon  blanc with a grilled salmon with their house remoulade and a side of broccollini.  It was perfect and the wine suited the meal.  Did I mention the view?  from my seat in the bar it was great.  I also want to comment that one of the staff, maybe a sommelier came down, popped open a bottle of wine and asked the bartender and wait staff to taste it, think about the flavors and he'd be back to discuss.  I really enjoyed listening to him and the staff interact and learn something they could share with a future customer about a bottle of wine.  Anyway, the staff was pleasant, view was magnificent and well worth the walk a mile down to the other incline to take me back to the Sheraton.  If I ever come back to downtown Pittsburgh, I will definitely stop and bring others up to this great place.

Holy fancy pants Batman! This dish cost as much as my last pair of pants! ...but it was delicious.

Like many others, we dined here for a special occasion meal. The view is spectacular. The prices are too. The menu is comprehensive (assuming you're here for fish). The decor is totally Miami 80s...complete with a large, lit water tank with bubbles and if memory serves me correctly, jungle leaf motifs all over the carpet. For the prices, you would think they would update the decor. Whatever...onto the food!

The crab cakes are all crab, no filler, and completely delicious. The oysters were totally disappointing. We had better oysters that afternoon at the shadyside market than we did at Monterey...and the shadyside ones cost $1 a pop. All the fish dishes were good. My macadamia encrusted halibut was delicious. The vegetable sides were totally disappointing and appeared to have little thought or effort put into them. I understand if they were going for simple and fresh, but even if that was their intent they missed the mark. They were bland and uninspired. The salads were good and the desserts were good, but not to die for. The fancier cocktails were good to meh.

Our waiter was wonderful. He was a great fine dining waiter with all the bells and whistles, yet he was not stuffy or condescending. He knew how to relax and help his table relax. He made our dining experience great.

Highest level dining experience, top 3 steak all-time

Travelled to Pittsburgh and wanted to try a fine dining establishment.  Monterey Bay fish grotto came up so made reservations.  Valet is a must in the dense Mt. Washington district, but not a big deal at all.  Because you are literally on a mountain overlooking downtown pittsburgh, the view from the restaurant is breathtaking.  There was a concert with all kinds of funky lights and after the baseball game fireworks!

  The food was absolutely delicious and the waiter did a great job.  The steak I had was among the top 3 best I have had all-time at a restaurant.  Their crabcake was delightful as well.  A great dining experience that I wouldn't hesitate to repeat.
The view of the city Pittsburgh, and the food are AMAZING! the best part is that the valet parking is only $7!

Great view, great food, and great service. Upon arriving, there is a $7 valet service, which was nice. And the view up on Mt. Washington is beautiful. Then we took the elevator ride up, with an open view. But there is only one small elevator, which is very slow. We were there to celebrate a graduation dinner, and we had a nice time. The food is very expensive, but delicious! The sides are large and serve 2-4 people. I highly recommend the lobster Mac n cheese and the Kanpavhi Seviche. I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with Chimichurri and it was really good. It didn't wow me, but it was definitely very good. I took a bite of the Brandied Tagliatelle with chicken instead of the shrimp, which was fantastic. However, there was too much fatty pieces of chicken in the dish. Also, I don't usually like crab cakes but my boyfriend ordered it and it was actually delicious! I think I ate too much bread and butter before my dinner because the butter was some of the best butter I have had... it was sweet and flavorful. Overall, we had a wonderful dinner and I highly recommend Monterrey Bay for any special occasion. Afterwards, the valet was super nice and willingly took a few photos for us outside.
The fish is OK, given the expectations. Their crabcake is their signature item, and is DELICIOUS; make sure to try it.

We went here to celebrate our anniversary from out of town and it was a fabulous experience. Not only did we get a great view, the food was spectacular. I had the Parmesan Rockfish and it was perfectly delicious. My husband got the Port Tuna and it was a heart fulfilling meal. We got the special Crab and Lobster Macaroni & Cheese and it was delicious as well. Our meal was very fulfilling but we made room for the should be famous Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich. Every bite was simply amazing!!! One MUST try if one dines here, simple must! 

Overall, a great experience from valet parking and wait services. Our waitress Caitlyn and manager Rob were great company with their expertise. Thank you for an amazing experience, we would definitely come back if were in town.

Come for the views, come back for the food.  Monterey Bay is hands down one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh and one of the best seafood places anywhere!

The crab cakes and stuffed scallops are phenomenal and the staff is very knowledgable and attentive.  If you're looking for an unforgettable experience, you can't go wrong here!

This is a great experience holistically.  Have your car valeted.  It's only $4.  Very affordable.  The elevator up to the Grotto gives you a great view of the city.  When you make your reservations, you need to ask for "view seating" but outside of that, getting a reservation is seamless.  You can reserve online through their website.

I went with a mentor/colleague to "celebrate" a job termination (don't ask) and we had the whole experience.  Our waitress was very nice and tentative.  One of the managers, who is a wine afficianto, helped us pick out a good wine on the moderately priced side.  The wine was fantastic.  

We ordered steamed clams as an appetizer and -oh so good- with their hot bread to dip in the sauce.  The manager learned I lost my job and brought us a "chocolate cake" drink, on the house, which was very nice.  

House salads were fresh and a nice size portyion.  I ordered the mahi mahi and it was fantastic.  Nice size portion, fresh.  Only complaint was that the lemon wedge was too small to put over the fish...

Finally, the dessert...  I had the white chocolate macadamia mousse.  To. die. for.

Certainly the restaurant is pricey, but the food quality was good, the atmosphere is nice, and the staff are very friendly.  This is a good special occasion restaurant.

Best view on Mt. W.   Let's be honest, this is on the top of Mt. W. AND on top of a 8 story building.  So yes, it has the best view among restaurants in that area.  
Sitting-arrangement-wise, if you have the downtown view window side, that's great.  The middle-of-the-room view is not as good.  So it's like 4 tables out of the entire restaurant get a perfect view, the rest are just "ok" view.  Overall, Altius has better table arrangement with like 75% getter a great view.

food-wise, we had their oysters before, it was great.  Ali-tuna comes in both starter size and dinner size.  We like their starter size better. (maybe a different chef the other day, maybe just a better fish(?))

They have some of the best fish in town, most of them are great.  Salmon, tuna, trout...  
Crab cake was better than average. (sorry, the best goes to Philly's XIX Nineteen.)
Scallops were great. recommended.

Sidenote, if you like sashimi fish and ok with them raw, get "rare" instead of "medium-rare" for their grilled fish.  A friend and I had a rare and medium-rare salmon side-by-side and we both agreed the "rare" one was better.

Their house special - Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich is a must try.  (5/5), go for it.
they were very accommodating for a vegan diet, all 3 course were wonderful with no trouble. they made me a special vegan risotto...one of the best dinners of my life

Gotta give it 5 stars.
Service was the best. Rae helped me to arrange a dinner for our CMU 50th reunion.
We arranged for separate checks for the various parties. They did it perfectly. Everything was smooth from the seating us in the cocktail lounge as guests arrived, to giving us a great location so that we had a beautiful view the entire dinner, to giving us an excellent server.
We all enjoyed our dinners. Side dishes were ample to allow sharing.
Valet was helpful.
Next time we're back in Pittsburgh, we'll be back.

My bf took me for my birthday this year, and I really enjoyed it. The views were ahhhmazing and the interior decor was fun and classy at the same time. There was a little mix-up when we first arrived, however - they gave us a buzzer to wait for our table and we went down to the bar (which also has amazing views). I guess they forgot about us because when we went upstairs to check on our table 45 minutes later, they looked surprised and apologized and seated us immediately.  

We ordered the crab cake appetizer (highly recommend the crab cakes, in fact, probably recommend just getting the crab cake entree). I got the seared ahi tuna stuffed with goat cheese, mushrooms, and spinach.  Honestly, cheese and ahi tuna dont belong together, but once i moved all the cheese to the side it was a really good entree. It was all expensive: for an appetizer, a (cheaper) bottle of wine, 2 entrees, 1 dessert, the bill came out to around $200, eek.  All in all, I would definitely return for another special occasion.

This place doesn't deserve five stars. Three is about right.

In short: the view is excellent but the food is merely good. If you want a view, come here, but if you want great fish, I'd recommend other places, such as Casbah, Park Bruges, or Umi.

At Monterey Bay, I had the trout almondine, which they promised to be lightly sauteed, but I found it to be overcooked and heavy with butter that left an oily aftertaste in my mouth. The caesar salad and dessert I shared were good but not great. When this place wins best seafood and similar awards, it's not for the food, but for the view.

Our meals were about $53 per person including tip, but without drinks.

This is a great place for the view, the romantic ambiance, and the service.  The food, unfortunately, is hit-or-miss - especially considering the price.

We had a reservation at 9:30 on a busy night.  Fortunately, the dining rush was dying down by then and we were quickly seated by a corner table (tables on the northeast side will get you a better view of the Pittsburgh skyline).  The waiters were friendly and courteous, and the manager came out to deliver our wine selection.  True to the restaurant's name, the menu featured a copious selection of fish.  (I'm pretty sure that being at the top of a tall building on top of a hill overlooking a city is the opposite of being a grotto, though.)

We started with a sampler of various appetizers that included shrimp, crab cakes, and a fish skewer.  These all had great flavor and texture and paired well with their respective sauces.

I had the whole bronzini classically prepared with tomatoes, onions, capers, and olives.  The kitchen delivered a solid performance on this one - crispy skin with tender flesh and a good balance of flavors.  I managed to sneak a few bites of my date's lemon sole, which was unfortunately overdone and in want of a sauce.  If you don't mind eating whole fish, that's what I would recommend - it's much harder to screw up the preparation.

We shared the chai tea cake for dessert, which was also perfectly acceptable.  There were many interesting choices available, though, and we had a hard time deciding.

Moral of the story - this is a great place for a fancier date or night out, but don't expect amazing food.  Oh, and the wine list is fairly extensive and expensive, even by fancy restaurant mark-up standards.

I read a lot of reviews and, yes, you do pay a premium for the view but the sashimi preparation of the ahi tuna was fantastic and I gladly paid for the view.  Ride the Duquesne Incline for the full experience!  The host and server both did a great job and I'd recommend the MBFG to anyone visiting the 'burgh!

Monterey Bay lives up to its reputation as an amazing restaurant that has a great view. Or is it a restaurant with a great view that has amazing food? Either way, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu (Butternut Squash Bisque over lobster, Crab stuffed jumbo scallops,etc). It's pricey but worth it.

This review is somewhat curt because Firefox crashed on me before it autosaved, and I'm too lazy to retype everything.
-----------------------------------------

Simply an amazing dining experience. 

Went for a dinner with my girlfriend, and we arrived around 30 minutes past our reservation time, but they were very courteous about it. Our server was knowledgeable and courteous and made the night a very enjoyable experience. 

All the food was amazing, but the crab cakes were ridiculous, so much so that I feel the need to comment. Usually I avoid crab cakes at restaurants, because you get some stringy crab meat mixed with bread mixed with generic mixed vegetables (read: defrosted peas, carrots, and corn), which has been the case even in fancy upscale restaurants. In fact, I only got the crab cake because it was part of the appetizer sampler. This turned out to be very fortunate for me, because the crab cake was huge chunks of tender, juicy lump crab meat, loosely held together, with nary a defrosted frozen vegetable in sight. Truly amazing.

The Irish coffee is a tad too strong for my liking; it was more like drinking shots with a bit of coffee rather than the other way around.

The view is the best in Pittsburgh. Make sure you get the side facing Heinz Field and downtown.

I would absolutely recommend it to everyone.

I just ate at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto for the first time this past weekend as part of a wedding party reheresal dinner.  Let me just mention that I hate seafood and seafood restaurants most of the time because I find them to be stinky!  This was place did not smell fishy at all!  The service was excellent!  I had the half chicken with rice and mixed veggies.  It was FANTASTIC!  Other people who did order fish raved about the crab cakes and the sword fish.  After dinner we sampled a few different types of desserts and I highly recommend the New York style cheesecake- it was the best cheese cake that I have ever had!  We were accomodated with a small private room for the rehersal dinner and had a fanstastic view of the city.  I will be back for sure!

Cajun snapper, stuffed tuna, she-crab bisque - awesome. Don't get the lobster mac (I know this sounds counterintuitive, trust me.)  It's the worst mac and cheese I've had, ever. A greasy mess.  Don't they know how to make a roux?

Located in Duquesne Heights, you must visit this restaurant.  If for nothing else, just the night time view of downtown Pittsburgh.  It was wonderful.  There is an upper and a lower level to this restaurant.  The upper-level is fairly pretentious and filled with lots of glitz and suits.  The lower-level is where the bar is located and it contains a small amount of window seating.  Many people go to sit upstairs.  Why?  I don't know.  It is so bright and contrived and you cannot get a very good view.  I prefer the darker lower level where people are more down to earth and real and the fact that you can actually see the city lit up at night. Don't let the coat check fool you.  If you feel uncomfortable, just head to the lower level.

We were greeted by our server and handed the menus.  We were able to look through and asked our server for her suggestions.  We placed our order for the recommended  appetizer that was not on the menu: 

Combo Platter: Ichiban (tuna, salmon, and swordfish grilled on a skewer), Crabcake, and Cajun shrimp

I was continually distracted by the view.  You can see the Duquesne Incline, the Southside, Downtown and the Northside and it is amazing how the night coupled with lit buildings can create such a sublime and dramatic image on the horizon -- Beautiful.   I had to focus, though, and was ready for our server when she returned with the appetizer:

French onion soup
Butternut squash soup
Mahi mahi with garlic- feta mashed potatoes
Yellow fin tuna with, garlic-feta mashed potatoes, and tomatoes with balsamic vinaigrette

The tri-partite appetizer combined three of the more popular appetizers on the written menu.  I was quite glad they had this option tonight since I would have been very disappointed to have ordered the Ichiban and the Cajun shrimp as their own dish.  Both were not great and were lacking in flavor.  The fish cubes on the Ichiban skewer were somewhat tough and overcooked with very little flavor.  The shrimp were slightly rubbery and did not taste Cajun.  The price of this appetizer was only $1 more than the crab cake appetizer.  The crab cake was quite good.  It is the best crab cake I have had in the Pittsburgh area.  It was well cooked, moist, tasted of lump crab and had minimal filler.

As we were finishing the appetizer the soups and tomatoes appeared.  My butternut squash soup came in a two-part series to preserve the scant heat in the soup itself and to protect the crab that came at the bottom of my bowl.  The soup was poured over the seeds and crab at the table.  It tasted very good, but unfortunately it cooled rather quickly -- this is on of the issues with Creme Fraiche, you cannot over heat or it will curdle.  I thoroughly enjoyed the flavor of the squash in the smooth soup coupled with the fresh crab, pumpkin seed, and creme fraiche.  The French Onion soup had a good flavor. Not over-seasoned, the onions were actually cooked, and a good consomme as its base.  

Our dinners arrived and I was surprised by the size.  The portions were quite large for both entrees and one could have easily been split between two people.  A bit apprehensive after the Ichiban, I tried the tuna to find that the flavor was much better for the entree.  The same held true for the mahi-mahi.  The tuna was cooked to a nice medium rare, had good texture and flavor and was not filled with gristle.  The mahi-mahi was tender, moist, and flavorful.  The blackening seasoning had a good flavor and was mildly piquant.  

I moved on to the mashed potatoes and my tomatoes.  There was just a hint of the feta and garlic in the potatoes that complimented the potatoes very well.  The tomatoes were good and the vinaigrette was also tasty.  I do wish that they would have used a better oil and vinegar, though.  The oil was a cheaper brand without much flavor and the balsamic was fairly weak, but with good flavor.  

Unable to finish our meals, we decided that we wouldn't bother with desserts.  Next time -- and there will be a next time -- the appetizer will be crab cake only and we will be splitting a meal.  With more than enough food for two, this will also cut the bill considerably.  I will continue to sit on the lower level and I hope that I get our server again.

OhEmGee... possibly the best meal ever. Where do I start? The view. Insane. Incredible. Cannot be beat. Overlooking one of the most beautiful cityscapes that I've ever seen. 

The service:  Cannot be beat. We started in the lounge for drinks and appetizer. (Did I mention the view?)  Very friendly, professional, courteous service. I had the Salted Caramel, my friends had wine, The Gentleman, and The French Kiss. All were delicious. 

We moved upstairs for window-side dinner reservations, where we enjoyed fantastic service. The manager stopped by several times to make sure all was going well. 

The food:  Holy shit, the best. I had the Chilean Sea Bass (macadamia), which was cooked to perfection. Perfection. Collectively we had Brussel sprouts, lobster mac & cheese, and crab mac & cheese. My friends ate stuffed scallops, surf and turf, and I cannot remember what else. All were delicious. 

Highly highly highly recommend. I will be back.

Fish, Fish, ch- and more Fish. This place has fish. if you like fish come here. The restaurant itself has an astounding view of Pittsburgh. It is definitely a fancier restaurant. Very few people come in with jeans on... The service was pretty good the server and manager did a lot of advising to navigate us through their tremendous menu. IT WAS HUGE- how am I supposed to know what to choose from?!?! 

Venue is a pristine and clean they do a tremendous job making it look good. Elevator takes you to the dining hall after you valet your vehicle. 

Food portions were small. but tasty we got the swordfish and yellowfin tuna in a Parmesan and mango curry sautees. They tasted very good, I would go with parmesean over mango in hindsight. we got a deliciously soup, that was also quite salty. And the rolls- they were astounding. we got a skewer appatizer with an array of different fish, which was good but entirely too small. 

This is a nice classy place to come to celebrate something with somebody special, has a killer view, and well cooked food. 

Still it is not the best fish I have had- i would give it 3.5 stars.

Next time i will try the lounge right below the upper level.

Excellent night out.  Met friends here to celebrate.  The renovations are beautiful.  The (tacky) palm tree decor is gone and now it's all clean, with modern accents.  The tables are now all carefully tiered so that the skyline is viewable from all seats (nice touch).

I had the ahi tuna, medium rare, done sashimi style, with a black sesame seed crust, wasabi and brown sauce, topped with pickled ginger.  It was carefully prepared, well portioned and elegantly plated.  Easily the best fish I ever had.

Ambiance was great (good place to impress) and the service was good.  Only complaint is that the tables are a bit too big for the booths, making them feel a bit cramped.

Took myself on a date here since I was in Pittsburgh for a night traveling solo. Had a nighttime reservation for dinner. Great service, was seated promptly upon arrival and got the perfect window seat and a table to myself. Beautiful view of the river and city skyline! Classy, romantic atmosphere- highly recommend this for a date or special occasion. Tried the crab cake which they're known for, per waiters recommendation and was not dissappointed- it was broiled, and made up of real juicy chunks of crab. The sauce complemented it well. For my cocktail I ordered the pepino diablo, jalape√±o infused tequila with cilantro cucumber and lime juice- slightly spicy and delicious! Also waiters recommendation (he has good taste). For dessert ordered the chocolate latte, chocolate flourless cake with cinnamon and chocolate steam. Would love to come back here!

I came here for a birthday of a friend of mine.  We ordered the mussels as an appetizer.  We sent them back as they were way too fishy tasting.  Yuck.  But we got the Lemon Sole and the Shrimp and Scallop Fettuccine.  The Orange Basil Halibut was just OK and lacked much flavor.  The Shrimp and Scallop Fettuccine was OK as well.  However, the scallops were a bit sandy (I hate sand in my seafood!) and the shrimp had an overpowering taste of iodine.  However, the pasta itself, was great!  Also, our server was phenomenal, I just wish the food was a little bit better. 

This place is great for the view though.  I suggest if it's a busy night reservation wise, try to get a table down at the bar, as the view is just as great down there and less unobstructed.

I had a salad with baked chevre, mixed greens, cranberries and balsamic vinegarette on the side.  It was very yummy!  Good portion size too~ 

Then for my main course I ordered the New England clam chowder special... mmm~ bad choice.  It was clam chowder poured table-side over pork belly and one whole shell-in clam.  First of all, the table-side presentation might sound like a good idea, but when you have gritty yellowish clam chowder coming out of a tiny tea kettle spout... it's not that appetizing.  I decided to be open minded and try it~ and i get blech grits in my mouth.  Where's the creamy white clam chowder I expected?!  ugh~~ not cool.  

I couldn't lie when the waitress asked me if I liked my meal, so she took it back and instead I got a steamed latte dessert!  Oh it made up for the nasty clam chowder~  It was a chocolate souffle topped with fresh whipped cream and a cute chocolate piece that looked like steam coming from the ginormous coffee cup.

The dessert and the amazing view from the restaurant saved me experience.  If it weren't for the clam chowder, I would've given it 4 stars.

Went here for a business dinner tonight.  The location is great - top of an apartment building at the top of Mt. Washington.  View was fabulous, but would have been better if they washed the windows.  My companion and I split an appetizer, each had a salad and entree with no wine and the tab came to $125.  I very much enjoyed the meal, and it was way more than I could eat, even though I didn't have lunch today.  I had the stuffed tuna which was very good but a bit over cooked and swimming in a heavy brown sauce and mushrooms.  The fresh string beans also came with their own heavy cream sauce.  

I would have given this 3-stars, but when I returned to my hotel I had to rush to the restroom several times....

Me and a friend arrived early for dinner so hostess seated us at the window. Wonderful view!!!! We ordered fried calamari, crab cake and scallops, lobster mac and cheese and coconut rice! The coconut rice, lobster mac and cheese, and fried calamari come in portions that can be shared comfortably with 2-3 people. The service was good. Didn't have to ask for refills as they have wait staff always looking out for that kind of stuff

This was our 3rd time visiting Pittsburgh, and our 3rd time at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto.  Just like the prior 2 times, it was excellent.  Great food, very good service, and spectacular views of the city.  You can't go wrong with this place.

I made NYE reservations to celebrate my fiance's birthday, 12/31.  We arrived at about 4:30pm and our reservation was for 5pm.  We had a drink downstairs, which was very nice and warm, I must say.  

When our buzzer went off, we headed upstairs and were seated at a 4-top table by the window.  Beautiful view of our city!!!  Diante (sp?) was our server and he was fantastic the whole night!  

We started off with the appetizer trio, which included 1 lump crabmeat, a skewer of tuna, salmon and swordfish and a couple shrimp.  Everything was so succulant and delicious!

For our 2nd course, we both had a salad with fresh bread and a specially made whipped butter.  He had a caesar and I had a house salad, both very good!!

For our main course, we both ordered the Surf n Turf, which consisted of 6oz filet and 6oz lobster tail stuffed with a lobster cake.  Let me just say that the filet and lobster were the best I have ever had.  Filet was cooked perfectly as was the lobster.  Also, there was broccolini with hollandaise sauce.  The only thing I would have change would be for the broccolini to be cooked more.  It was a little hard, even to cut with a steak knife.  

For his "free" birthday dessert, he got the carrot cake and I ordered the Meyer Lemon Ice Box Pie, which was outstanding.

I came here last night with my rents to celebrate my mom's birthday, and it was a disappointing experience overall! The view and service both get 5 stars, but the food was mediocre at best.  

We started with two apps:  the Calamari & the Mussels (Limoncello style).  Both were "eh".  The Calamari was soggy and greasy, BUT the dipping sauces that accompanied the dish were tasty.  The mussels were ok - the flavor itself was actually unique and interesting, but the portion size was weak.  Huge shells with tiny morsels of meat inside *sad face*

Although our apps were weak, we had high hopes for our entrees.  I was stoked to get my Monterey style Cod (with artichoke hearts, tomato, garlic, green onion and muschrooms, sauteed in a Marsale wine sauce).  

My dish was a serious mess.  There was absolutely no flavor, and my fish was severely overcooked.  I was pretty unhappy (understatement of the day).  I had to douse my food in tabasco to fork it down.  Sad times all around.

My parents ordered stuffed Scallops and crabcakes, and although their dishes were much better than mine, they weren't particularly impressed either.  

Monterey Bay's supposed to be a legit seafood restaurant, but the only good food I had was the French Onion Soup and bread (which were both awesome).  I wish I could give this place a better rating because the waitstaff was amazing and the view was spectacular, but the food just wasn't up to par.

My wife and I dined here for our anniversary. We had Not been back to the restaurant in a few years since we had a few kids but time has only made the place better. We both had a fantastic meal. She had a grilled Seabass and I had a barbeque mahi-mahi. Both pieces of fish were cooked to perfection. Our server was timely and never made us feel we had to hurry up. Our drinks were expertly prepared and served to perfection. We had a great night. Someday they should update the elevator, sooner the better.

We went for my birthday best restaurant I've been to in Pittsburgh. Service, staff, hospitality and food were outstanding. Stuffed jumbo shrimp so good and the calamari was great. Good swordfish if you want something filling and meaty. Great desserts. Would recommend for any occasion.

Never had bad seafood here. However. The service is sometimes not very good. The bar is subpar. I would give 3 stars for bar and service except the seafood never disappoints. Lastly - either valet or park on one of the very crowded side streets
Good view by the window and good service in this restaurant. Especially the desserts! The crab cakes are yummy and served in a perfect size!

This is our favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. Always immaculate service, drinks, and food. Plus the view is outstanding. Best crab cakes I have ever eaten. Definitely will be returning in the future.

Awesome place for a date with great views.  This is near the Duquesne Incline.  The restaurant is on the very top of a building.  You can get great views of the entire downtown Pittsburgh, you can see Heinz Field, and the bridges to the left and right of Point State Park.  The night view is amazing.  You can get up here by driving or taking an incline and walking over. 

We had the Opah (Blacked cajun cooked) and Walu (carribean cooked).  These are 2 types of Haiwaiian fish.  The opah tasted a little dry and the Walu was very juicy.  This place is not cheap and the portions are small.  Service is good and you need to make a reservation because it does get packed.  One option is to sit in the lounge (no reservation needed) and have your food there.  They have a dress code but they are lenient on this.  

Try to request for a window seat if possible.

Tonight was the 3rd time we've been here. Both times before I definitely would have given a 5. For the price you pay, our particular server was not great at all. Barely smiled. Took at least 10 mins for my second drink. The temperature of the food could have been hotter. The lobster Mac and cheese was good. (Would have been better hotter) I got the crab crakes, wasn't impressed. I will say the grilled cheese dessert was wonderful. The view is beautiful if you can get a seat by the window. My husband and I have celebrated our birthdays and anniversary here for the past year and won't be back for the next celebration, seems like it definitely went down hill.

Nice ambiance and view, but their cooking fell short. Our red Snapper and Swordfish were both over cooked and dry. Very disappointing considering the price charged. I will say the Lobster Mac and cheese way a surprise and delightful. The corn was also a surprise presenting many flavors.
Brought the in laws here for dinner. Very pretty set up with a beautiful view. If available, you could ask the waitress to give you a table by the window. Food was pretty good. In laws loved it.
The food was amazing.....very friendly and inviting staff. A most that I visit again in my next trip.
One of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. The view is incredible. We normally hang out in the bar area. The service and food are the best!

The views are to die forrrrr. Well not to die but to instagram af for. Amazing panoramic views of Pittsburgh from across the "three" rivers. You can see it all from here!

Definitely go with a crab cake add on if you can, get some Brussels to share (), and any of the fish dinners are incredible.

Dessert is a must! Get their version of a grilled cheese! WOW 10/10

Service was super friendly and professional. Look cute for the gram with those entrees!

The view is worth the hype! But I was really surprised how dated this restaurant was. The sides were an additional cost- my dining companions raved about the lobster mac n cheese. Overall I don't think the value matches the price. I like Eleven better for special occasions.

This place is a must if you are coming to Pittsburgh! The views the food and the cocktails are all phenomenal. Previous yelp reviews recommended the crab cakes so that is what I choose. They blew me away! Very comparable to Maryland crab cakes, no filler and just piled on for a great crab cake patty. For dessert I ordered the grilled cheesecake. His again was another yelp recommendation! It is a crispy cheesecake glazed with ice cream and a raspberry sauce. You can also just come here for this dessert and be impressed. I saved the best for last with the view. The view at night is amazing. You get to see all the buildings and all the bridges which Pitt is famous for!

It's very pricey but the food and view are worth it. So if you are looking to treat yourself give this a try.
Perfect for special occasions. Always ordered something difference at each visit and always great.

We were a large group so we had a separate section to ourselves.  The restaurant was more empty than I expected for such a terrific spot.  Even though the group was large, we were served well and despite lapses in service (slow to bring drinks etc.) it was an overall positive experience.  

The set menu was very nicely laid out and he salad was fresh and crisp with a lemon dressing.  We were served exceptional bruschetta which I must say was very refreshing and had little or no onion (my preference) so it was a big hit for me - and a great way to cleanse the palate...  The crab cakes were exceptional.  They were mostly crab and very little other stuff, so they tasted more of the sea and the crab itself rather than the stuffing.  Recommended highly!

The choice for me was Chilean sea bass and I must say it was cooked perfectly.  The meat was flaky and moist and the greens and vegetables surrounding it were crunchy - just how I like them.  Overall a delightful dish and highly recommended

I would love to go back.  The service speed and somewhat dryer ambiance make it a 4 for me.  Or maybe a 4.5.  I need to go back to check it out again.  

I recommend this spot!
Simply Amazing! Try the swordfish parmesan...you won't be let down.

An unimpressive experience. My date made reservations for 8:30 PM on a Friday night. Now you would have thought they'd have their best servers. Wrong! The food was very good, except for the bisque. Very little crab meat and not a tasty broth to spoon into after all the meat was gone, which only took two spoonfuls. They brought me more crab to add to the broth, again another two spoonfuls before that was gone too. The bisque itself was okay, not something I wanted to spend time sopping up.
All the rest of the dinner was very tasty. 
Now, the service...... They seated us at a table in a far corner. We waited 10 minutes for anyone to come over to our table. No one to even fill our water glasses. When I asked someone if I could get water, we were then asked if we wanted it by our waitress, who finally showed up, she then had to go get it. 
She said she was going to bring bread for the table. Another 10 minutes and my date asked for more butter, which never came.
We waited constantly for our waitress. I had to wave at her to come over so we could order appetizers and then had to wave down the floor manager to ask him to send our waitress over so we could order our main entrees . 
I complained to the floor manager after we completed our meals he asked if there was anything he could get us, then offered dessert. Really? I didn't want dessert! I wanted an exceptional evening with a great guy at, what I thought was an exceptional restaurant.  They complimented the meals which was ok, but we can't get the evening back. We went there to relax, talk,  have some great food and not have to worry about such things. 

I do have to say, that the valet were awesome and the bartenders were exceptional. My date ordered a drink he concocted himself and I ordered a dirty martini. Both were perfect!!!

Don't think I'd take a chance going again.

One of the best meals ever! My fiance and I ate at the Monterey Bay Fish Grotto for a late Valentine's Day dinner tonight. We had a reservation and wereseated promptly. Our server, Holly, was pleasant as can be and very efficient. I ordered the swordfish with cajun seasoning and orange marmalade sauce and my fiance had caribbean halibut. We both agreed that while both were delicious the swordfish was the better meal. It was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. We shared a side of lobster mac and cheese. It was good, probably could have cut back on the cheese a tiny bit as it was super rich. Now, we opted against dessert because I was pretty full, but when she brought us our check, Holly also brought a piece of the angel food grilled cheese to go because we were celebrating. Very sweet gesture and we tore into it as soon as we got home! Such an innovative and delicious dessert!

My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday dinner last year when we were in Pittsburgh for the weekend. We chose it based on the glowing recommendation we received from the Maitre D' at our hotel. 

It's in a pretty cool location atop Mount Washington which overlooks all of Pittsburgh. We took the incline plane most of the way up and then a cab from there which was nice. Once you arrive at the restaurant it kind of feels like being in an apartment building. You take an elevator up to the very top to enter the dining room. 

My first impression of the dining room was that it is huge, crowded, and very early-90's in decor. I felt like I should have teased and sprayed my hair and given my bangs a nice blowout before I put on my shoulder-padded jean jacket to come to this restaurant. The lighting is cheesy, it's a mix of tables and booths, and I am almost positive there was a paper placemat on the table. Needless to say, Monterey Bay sort of felt like what my 6-year-old self always thought "fancy restaurants" were like until I actually was old enough to go to one. 

Other reviewers don't lie, the view is amazing, but I have to admit it felt like the windows needed washing that night. It was a little hazy. 

As for the food, it was priced like any fish restaurant--in the mid-$20's-$35 per plate. This is perhaps a personal chip on my shoulder, but I am never impressed by places that offer to butter-sautee or broil fish when that's not the ideal way for it to be prepared. It feels like a way to cater to not-so-savvy diners who don't really appreciate what good fish is. Our portions were ENORMOUS for everything which is annoying because I hate leaving fish uneaten, but it was just too much. It was prepared well, but our sides were pretty unrefined. 

All in all, not a terrible dining experience, but I was not in love with it either. If you could do half-stars, this would get a 2.5 from me.

Fantastic view and awesome seafood!  I had the combo platter appertizer which consisted of 2 shrimp (I subbed cocktail for the spicey ones),1 large crabcake and a skewer of tuna,salmon,and a 3rd fish. I highly recommend it; even for the $22.  

The caesar salad was giant and awesome.  Ask for Anchovies.  I packaged most of it up or I wouldn't be able to eat my Mahi Mahi Cape Cod style (highly recommend it).  No room for dessert.  

Great for special occasions or for travelers.  It is not in-expensive but in-line with Mitchell's and McCormick and Schmick.  This beats the others.

Been here a few times in the past with great friends and a beautiful view of the city. More recently, visited with my boyfriend for our 2 year anniversary. Since they knew it was a special day, the service was spectacular. The hostess was the sweetest woman and they accommodated our every need. We even had free dessert! The Chocolate Steaming Latte is the best dessert I've ever eaten. It's warm chocolate-y goodness will bring me back again!!!!!

Being completely honest, I was not all that impressed - mainly with the food. The service and actual restaurant were very nice, but I didn't enjoy my main entree or the sides which really was disappointing. The view from the restaurant is pretty awesome though, so that does make up for a the not great food. 

For dinner I had the crab bisque (which was the best), the halibut cooked parmesan style, crab mac and cheese, and brussel sprouts (very good too).  The crab mac and cheese was really dry, and not cheesy/creamy, it was all just stuck together and hard to scoop out of the dish. And perhaps I ordered the wrong style fish/way it was cooked but just didn't really think it was worth the price and didn't taste that great.

Overall we had excellent service and again, the location was really nice.
5 Stars!  Found this place on a whim, dined solo for a late lunch and it blew my mind. View = amazing. Table = amazing Service = AMAZING Food = also amazing!

We have never been disappointed here. Food and service was always exceptional. A bit high so tend to use for special occasions, birthdays, anniversaries, etc. Our joint birthday's are coming up shortly and anticipate celebrating here, assuming no unforeseen issues.

I could talk about the view, the tuna, the atmosphere, any of the obvious things that made this place great.  But the brussel sprouts...wow.  I'm a meat and potatoes guy, but even the brussel sprouts were perfect.  Pricey?  Yes.  But I felt I got every penny's worth.  It's a real gem.

After our last experience that was less than 5 stars the manager invited us in to have dinner again.  This time everything was fantastic.  

We tried the She-Crab bisque and really liked it.  Hopefully this special will be available again in the future.  My sea bass was perfect and my husband's crab cakes were excellent as usual.  

He had the grilled cheese for dessert and I had the chocolate latte.  Both were great.  I am so happy to see the chocolate latte back on the menu.

Went for an anniversary dinner this evening.... Our waiter, John, was fantastic! He was so helpful, polite, and welcoming...We got the lobster Rangoon appetizer which was fabulous. Each of us got the crab cake entree and they were the best I've ever had! The fresh fish menu looked great, but I'm just super picky! Definitely would recommend the crab cakes, though.

Very happy with dinner experience at Monterey Bay tonight. The atmosphere is elegant and romantic with an awesome view from Mount Washington. The service was superb and our fish cooked to perfection. Valet parking only, cost $7. Coat check service. Menu a la carte. 

We started with their special appetizer and holiday cocktails. The snowstorm mojito had a delicious coconut and mint flavor and was like starting dinner with a dessert! The appetizer special was perfect for sharing. My favorite part was hands down the crab cake and next time I'll definitely be getting that as an appetizer or an entree! For entrees we chose the barramundi and red snapper. Both cooked to perfection with the coconut macadamia crusted option and pina colada sauce. If you like a sweet dish, this style of cook is for you! For a side, we had the fried brussel sprouts. After cocktails, appetizer, salad and entrees, we unfortunately had no room for dessert! 

I highly recommend Monterey Bay Fish Grotto for any seafood lover! Portions were large and we were not disappointed! It is a pricier place but well worth it. Our bill with tip was $200 which included 1 appetizer, soup, salad, 2 cocktails, 2 entrees and 1 side.

On my reservation I requested window seating because it was my birthday and because I just moved to Pitt. You usually can't request window seating because it's first come first serve, but when we arrived they said they heard my request and sat us at a window table and told me happy birthday. The waitress took our picture with the skyline in the background and was very polite about answering our questions about the city. We ordered oysters and the crab cakes as an appetizer. For the main dishes we ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with the Chimichurri prep, the Salmon with the honey lime prep, and the Rock Fish with the Parmesan prep. We ordered the Asparagus, Lobster Mac and Cheese, and Roasted Potatoes as sharable sides.  I tasted all of it and it was all so delicious! As a birthday gift they gave us a free dessert of my choice. I selected their award winning Angel Food Grilled Cheese Sandwich. Easily one of the best desserts I ever had! Definitely a great choice for a birthday/ welcome to Pitt dinner with loved ones!

Chose this restaurant strictly based on the fact I love seafood and the view of the city.  Our waitress was cold and didn't engage much.  We were celebrating my birthday and engagement, I read all these great reviews for celebrating but our experience just fell flat.  (She didn't even bother to ask.) She also seemed annoyed we didn't want mediocre looking $12 asparagus to share with our meals.  Another waitress brought out calamari and dropped half our plate & promised to have more made but it never came.  Entrees were small and just ok, not very hot served.  Food 4/10.  I regret leaving and above avg. tip.  However the views (10/10) are to die for, but we won't be back. We frequent nice restaurants and weren't afraid of the price tag either.  There are so many other great restaurants and experiences that we still rave about, this isn't one of them.

This is the place to go for the best fish in Pittsburgh. The melt in your mouth kind. Love the unique chimichurri option on the Sea Bass. Brussels sprouts are the best side. They serve the freshest bread to get started. Dessert wise the angel food sandwich was great. I would not get the chocolate cake in the cup. Was cooked a little too much. Tasted a bit burned. But everything else was delicious. Can't be the perfect view of Pittsburgh as well. Valet parking available for $7.

This is an upscale fish place, and it's worth it when you want a really nice dining experience.  We've gone here 4 times and have loved it every time.  Food has always tasted awesome, and the view is one of the best of the city.

My boyfriend and I had dinner at Monterey Bay to celebrate his birthday during a recent visit to Pittsburgh.  First, the view is truly outstanding.  The place is quite pricey, and it's clear that the view is a big part of what you're paying for and arguably worth it.  The service was very good, and the food that we ordered ranged from so-so to excellent.  The appetizer of lobster rangoons was our most disappointing dish.  The portion was very small; the presence of lobster inside was barely discernible; and it simply wasn't especially tasty or memorable for the price.  We also shared a caesar salad to start, which was fine, typical of any caesar salad.  It was nice that they pre-divided the salad onto two plates to make it easier for us to share.  For our entrees, my boyfriend chose the coq au vin, and I ordered the parmesan rockfish.  All of the entrees are served a la carte, so we also ordered a side of the gratin potatoes to share.  My rockfish was excellent, with a simple, flavorful, and unfussy preparation to showcase the fish nicely.  The potato gratin side dish was also very tasty.  My boyfriend was disappointed in the coq au vin, though.  Although the portion of chicken was generous, he ultimately found the preparation to be a bit too minimalist.  Traditional coq au vin is typically a hearty, rustic, comforting dish with a lot of richly flavored broth and vegetables -- the kind of dish that you want to dip your bread in to soak up all the extra goodness.  The preparation here, though, had almost no broth and, in turn, minimal flavor.  We also found the wine list a little disappointing.  There were a number of wines that were priced quite high yet are pretty common and easy to find elsewhere -- and thus we know how inexpensive they typically are when purchased at a store versus in an expensive restaurant.  If you're going to charge a high mark-up on wine (as all restaurants do, so that's to be expected), it would be nice to focus on providing interesting and special offerings that one might not be as familiar with and which aren't easily found at many other stores and restaurants.  Having said that, we eventually settled on one of the few white wine options that was both interesting and reasonably-priced, the Pine Ridge Chenin Blanc-Viognier blend, which turned out to be pretty enjoyable -- offer more wines like this, please!  At the end of our meal, the restaurant very generously brought my boyfriend a complimentary dessert of his choice in honor of his birthday.  He opted for the angel food cake grilled cheese sandwich, which was unique and decadent and quite delicious.  Overall, we had a very nice experience here.  It would be nice to see a little more variety on the wine list, and it would be even better if all of the dishes were equally satisfying and flavorful.  However, the view is outstanding, as are the service and the atmosphere.  It's definitely a nice place to celebrate a special occasion.
Went for the first time for my birthday & it won't be the last! Excellent service & phenomenal food!!!

This is an extraordinary restaurant. The ambience, the view, the service, and the food are all tremendous. 
Beer, wine, and drink list are all solid.
We started with the calamari appetizer. It was perfectly made and the accompanying sauce paired perfectly.  For dinner, I had the Bronzino and it was amazing. It's served as a whole fish which may sound challenging to eat...it was simple. 
My wife had the salmon, which she said was very good. We ordered the scalloped potatoes and chipotle creamed corn as our sides, again, both were very good. My wife also had the she crab soup as a starter and she stated it was as good as what she's had in South Carolina. We really love Monterey Bay, it's a top notch establishment!

Wow, to start, you have to take an elevator up to the restaurant! SO COOL! Once we arrived at our floor, we were greeted with friendly staff and an amazing view!  I made a reservation online for my boyfriend's birthday. Window seats at this restaurant are a hot commodity (and you can't reserve with your reservation), so if you want one I would get there early, because they have a first come first serve waiting list for anyone wanting a window seat.  We were able to sit by one of the side windows which was still pretty cool if you ask me! The service was awesome! Our waiter was really nice and was able to give us great descriptions of the menu items we asked about.  

We ended up ordering:
Scallops and Crab Cakes - Everything cooked to perfection! The crab cakes had huge lumps of crab in them and the scallops were buttery deliciousness!
Caribbean Halibut - I honestly didn't care for this meal much at all.  It was pretty bland and I was expecting a lot more of the fruit salsa.  

When I booked the reservation online I added a note saying that it was for a birthday.  After our meal was finished our waiter told us to pick 2 desserts on the house!!! SO NICE!

We ordered:
Angel Food Grilled Cheese - The hype is totally real! Grilled angel food cake with a cream cheese center...soooo gooood!
Pot de Creme - Sweet and salty and oh so delicious! It came with some fruit that was so yummy when dipped in the pot de creme. 

Overall, this was a wonderful experience! The view, the food, and the staff made this a great place to celebrate!

"Monterey Bay Fish Sky Tower"

This was an awesome way to continue our journey after riding the Duquesne Incline.  Just a short walk up the hill, take an elevator to the top and step off into a dining room with stunning panoramic views and vaulted ceilings.  The decor was slightly reminiscent of a Vegas hotel lobby.  It wasn't very busy when we got there but it was in between lunch and dinner hours.

We decided to go to the lounge area half a flight down.  We were the only ones sitting at the bar and got A+ service from our bartender.  He might have been one of the most engaging and entertaining bartenders I've ever met ( I feel terrible I cannot remember his name)  He truly appreciated the joys of being a mixologist and made some killer drinks.  The drink menu is extensive and we got their just in time for their 'Executive Hour".  Okay, I giggled at first too and thought how pretentious, but it actually is quite clever since their clientele during this time was a lot of suits.

We must have tried 3 different drinks each, my favourite being the Jalepeno Martini.  Talk about a kick in the mouth!  The other drinks were incredibly tasty too and all used a variety of booze so their is something for anyone. 

As the night progressed not only did the view become even more beautiful as Pittsburgh lit up we decided on a lil nosh.  So we tried the recommended Cajun Shrimp.  They were great and not too oily like other  places.  The rest of the menu looked like a "To-Do list" of fish.  Trust me you'll want to go back and check them off.

When we left the dining room was packed and a wait queued in the lobby.
