What a treat this place is for an out of towner.  Such an experience that I will definitely remember of my trip to Pittsburgh.  This is one of those places you go for a special occasion or if you have money oozing out of your pockets.

Situated on a hill overlooking downtown you won't find better views of the city.  While dining looking out the window it almost feels as if what you are looking at is a post card of a night time scene of Pittsburgh.  I included a picture that shows exactly what I was enjoying.

The service I experienced was impeccable.  Server knew everything about the menu and helped with the meal selection as well as the wine.  The maitre de also made sure that I was having a great time as well.  That's always a plus in my book when someone in charge performs table touching helping patrons enjoy their time.

The food was very good, but not the greatest.  I didn't fall in love with what I had and this is the reason I can't give this restaurant five stars.  While dining at this type of fine dining place the food should be near the top of what you have had before.  I'm not saying the food is bad at all, just could be a little better.

Overall I have to say the prices aren't that bad and the view is absolutely spectacular.  I think this is a great choice for anyone looking for that dinner that will "wow" them while visiting Pittsburgh!  And if you live here, it's one of those places you go every so many years.

The entire evening made for a wonderful date night. The location is scenic. It was a beautiful summer evening, so we actually parked at the bottom, rode the cable car up and then walked up the hill to the restaurant. 

This place gets a five for the seafood entrees, view (we had a window table), and the service. As far as menu items, everything else gets a two. I don't know what I was thinking ordering a chicken dish at a seafood restaurant but ewww -- it was completely flavorless. However, my date (who grew up on the east coast and has had fabulous seafood offerings his entire life) said his dish here was the best he's ever had. He had a yellow-fin tuna, stuffed with feta. Two years later he still talks about it.

Way over priced for the food. Additionally, couple of people from or group got sick eating the salmon here.I My food was excellent but the cocktails were all way to sweet. Ithink you're really paying for the location, the view and the classiness, in spite of those three, I still think it's over priced and overrated.

Just enjoyed my graduation dinner at Monterey Bay and had a truly wonderful experience. The view, ambience, service, food-- all amazing. Holly was our waitress, and she was incredible. She was friendly, attentive and thoughtful. I love it here because it's fine dining without it being pretentious like some other restaurants. The grilled oysters, crab cake with shrimp, lobster Mac n cheese, saut√©ed spinach-- all absolutely delicious. I will definitely be back!

4.5/5 if I could

I chose this as the "big night out" dinner for during a recent trip to Pittsburgh. I ordered the wahoo with Caribbean jerk seasoning. The seasoning provided a nice tangy sweet citrusy kick to the fish. The atmosphere and preparation of the fish made me feel like I was on a tropical island somewhere. The peanut butter chocolate cheese cake was excellent. The cheesecake had pieces of pretzel baked inside which provided for an extra crunch. 

I loved the view of the stadium and the city too. From our seat you could see the scoreboard at PNC park. The staff knows that the window seats are prime real estate and will work with you to get you a good seat if you have a reservation. 

For people not familiar with the city, getting to the restaurant itself could be a bit of a challenge. We took the incline but there may have been a more efficient way. I would say it was worth the trip though!

We dined at Montery Bay Fish Grotto while as a treat for our freshman daughter who attends Pitt. My college student felt very pampered by the elegant atmosphere and the fabulous view, The food was impressive- we especially enjoyed the appetizers- the ahi tempura and the crabcakes were both standouts. The fresh fish choices were a bit overwhelming- too many choices! The salmon strawbery style came recommended by our server and was very good for an unexpected combination. We also tried the orange basil halibut which was very tasty (though my husband swore the fish was cod); the swordfish oscar was amazing; and the grouper monterey style with black olives and artichokes pleased my husband very much. Also enjoyed a side of lobster mac n cheese. We don't usually get desserts but they were all so tempting and made for a sweet conclusion to the meal. The service was attentive and overall it was a memorable if somewhat overindulgent dining experience!

Definitely recommend for a special occasion!

This has been our go to spot for celebrations.  We haven't been here since the remodel.  Last night was to celebrate our daughter's/niece's graduation.  The positives:  we had a great table which wasn't technically the " windowseat" but once the sun started to go down we had the best sunset!  Our server was wonderful as well.  She was attentive and made us feel welcome to stay to socialize.  The not so positives:  No specials.  Just the menu. In the past there were chef specials that included sides and extras.  We ordered side dishes of potatoes and asparagus...potatoes were over cooked and the asparagus was average. Our entrees were good. Crabcakes were great...scallops were dry, sea bass was good but was lonely on a big plate. Swordfish Parmesan is what drew our grad.  They changed the recipe and now it has a breading and fried. Still good but not what we remember. No more complementary salad. Good food but for the price?...  We live closer to Off the Hook and find the chef there ( who was at MBFG) has it down. The desserts were good but the Steaming Chocolate late  was smaller and not as good as Off the Hook.

Still enjoyed the ambience and the view. But not surprised that they were half full.  Next occasion will be at Off the Hook. May be back for college graduation with a cocktail. Sad that the food didn't stay or improve with the remodel. I'd take 1980's palm trees for the old chef.

THE GOOD:
The view and the service. Specifically request a view by the window, and you'll be awestruck the whole meal by the amazing view of Pittsburgh - the restaurant's main redeeming characteristic. Our waiter was also very pleasant and attentive. 

THE BAD:
The food, yo. And the prices. I am continually disappointed by the food at upscale, pricey restaurants. The food just doesn't live up to the hype, and the Fish Grotto was no exception. I didn't like the meal I got at all (one of their more expensive fish), and enjoyed my salad appetizer and the free bread significantly more, in fact. 

THE UGLY:
The atmosphere. It's themed like the tropics, I guess? With huge fake palm trees everywhere? It sort of reminded me of the cheesy casino in the 1990s movie The Mask. Not really the upscale atmosphere I look for in an expensive meal out. 

IN SUMMATION:
If you want to cruise up the duquesne incline and end at a restaurant, I wouldn't really pick this one, especially since you can see the view of the city for free outside. The food isn't worth it, especially for these prices.

Wow, 5-star experience for my first dining experience at Monterey Bay! We had a private room for our dinner program. Lovely decor, excellent service, and delicious food! Cannot wait to return for a special occasion! The view from the main dining area is spectacular!

This place is amazing...the view, the service, the food was all on point! I had the wedge salad, it was phenomenal!! I could have ordered 2 more and just ate it. The flavors were incredible. Our party all got different fish and everyone loved their entrees.

Seriously?! 
Is it your best restaurant in Pittsburgh?!! 

Yeah, the view is super nice.
But neither foods nor service were not enough for the price!!!!!! 
I think I can make better foods than here. 
And the server had no idea with wines at all......

Yeah.....if I am an owner of that restaurant with that spectacular view, I would make everything better. Oh please!!

Ate there last night with my wife for our anniversary.  The staff was excellent and treated us like royalty.  The appetizer was very good and the special soup (crab creole bisque) was very spicy and excellent!  The food was very good and it's really hard to complain about a $10 corkage fee.  They also gave us a free dessert for our anniversary.  The carrot cake was incredible and my wife enjoyed her chocolate latte cake thing.

My only complaint is that the shrimp appetizer and my chilean sea bass were not really hot.  They were not cold, but not hot either.  

We'll go back again for another event.

I had a wonderful time at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto. Obviously I expected amazing food, a spectacular view, and exquisite service. They exceeded my expectations in every regard. My date inquired about a substitution and the server was very accommodating. Not only that but a manager also followed up and made an additional recommendation. The brandied shrimp with tagliatelle and cream sauce is the best pasta dish I have ever had. The cream is light, well-balanced and vey flavorful. The shrimp is prepared butterflied and there is a generous portion. The pasta is served al dente (of course) but is also clearly freshly prepared. My date enjoyed the halibut with a jerk seasoned preparation. Also was very good. There is zero reservation about dining here and I look forward to my next visit.
Ordered a $15 old fashioned. Bartender emptied a sugar packet and topped it with a cherry & orange wedge.

Came here to celebrate with my family and had a genuinely wonderful experience.  The views and service are spectacular and what you expect from a fine dining restaurant like this. Over all the food was very good, though some dishes were better than others. My family had all different cuts of fish and they were all prepared expertly. My scallops stuffed with crab were the only minor disappointment, and they were fine, just not exceptional, nor worth 38$! The prices are seriously up there, but within the realm of reason for most things. Definitely only a special occasion restaurant but still very good. Only thing I'd change today would be their music! Odd pan flute selections made me think I was in a yoga studio, not a restaurant. So strange!

Let me preface this post by saying that it has been awhile since I have dined at Monterey Bay but I am new to Yelp and just had to write a review.  I have been here quite a few times (at least 5 without really going back and counting).  Each time I have gone to the Monroeville location (first in the old office building and then at the mall).  My first time was there was in high school and my idea of seafood was lobster and crab, so I was disappointed that those dishes aren't on the menu, but that did not take away from a wonderful first meal and every meal since.  My staple go to dish is their peppercorn yellow fin tuna.  I have always been more of a meat and potatoes kind of guy and love a good steak.  The tuna is as good if not better than any filet that you would order at a premier steak house.  The decor and the wait staff are also compliment the experience.  Since I live in Rochester, NY now, Monterey Bay is a must go to when I go home to visit.

Wow wow wow! We had reservations at le mont but we went there the last time we were in Pittsburgh..so I requested something different. We had a 5:30 reservation and decided to go a little early to ensure we'd have a window seat. Luckily we did because we got the last one! And I honestly think it was the best table in the house!

Our server Kerri was super friendly and helpful all of her suggestions were on point! She helped us through the wine list as well as the menu. My only complaint is the wine took quite a while to arrive but we were really soaking in the wonderful views so we hardly noticed!

First up we ordered the calamari..seems generic but it's definitely a step above..the dipping sauce was great..the breading actually stuck to it and it was nice and tender with very little chew. We then shared a Caesar salad..she actually brought it out split up for us..I couldn't believe it was only 1 salad as both of our portions were huge and it was only a $10 salad!

For my entree I landed on the crab cake with jumbo scallops and lobster sauce..perfect! Crab cakes have so little filling just all lump crab..they come with an awesome homemade remoulade..just perfect..dining partner landed on sea bass with the chimichuri preparation. It was good..but mine was better! 

The atmosphere was absolutely perfect..breath taking views and a modern sleek space. The hidden gem is really in the lounge on the mid level. They have an expansive bar with and amazing view plus a few tables along the windows..if you can't score a window seat upstairs..or if you just want a little more relaxed atmosphere with the same view..hit the lounge!

Can't wait to go back! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Lovely views of the city with impeccable service. We had reservations at 7:00 and enjoyed watching the sunset during our dinner. Slow paced with upscale ambience. 

Food was delicious and the desserts were perfecto!

When I lived in Pittsburgh, this was my absolute favorite place to dine for a special occasion. Apparently there's been a remodel and a change in ownership? Whatever the case, it just wasn't the experience we had in years past. Disappointing. Service not bad, but not great. View still excellent. Calamari delicious. Grilled angel food sandwich dessert delicious. Butter they serve with bread was the favorite item of some in our party (in a seafood restaurant...should be the seafood, no?) Ahi tuna dish apparently not as good as it has always been. Even the famed crab cakes weren't getting rave reviews at our table. Everything else was good - but not great like we'd come to expect from this place. Not even sure if we'll go back.

Excellent Restaurant with great customer service.
Here is what I thought was excellent....

Drinks:  All American Old Fashioned
Appetizers:  Calamari
Soup:  Lobster Bisque is some of the best I ever had.
Dinner:  Chef Special - Jumbo Scallop over Grits (Cajun style) - Amazing
Dessert:  All were good but the Angel food grilled cheese won the prize.

Portions are small but typical for an upscale restaurant.
Bring your wallet cause it can get pricey!

With spectacular views of Pittsburgh, stellar service, and incredible food, Monterey Bay Fish Grotto is definitely a "go to" for that special occasion dinner (an anniversary, milestone birthday, graduation, etc...).  After coming here with the family to celebrate my brother's college graduation, I came away extremely pleased with the quality of the food, the service, and the overall experience.  Really terrific all around.

Everything I had that night tasted terrific and was presented beautifully.  My spicy tomato soup with crab had just the right amount of heat, complemented by a good amount of tender crab.  The seafood sampler allowed us to taste their savory crabcake, jumbo shrimp, and ichiban.   I also very much enjoyed my Chilean Sea Bass carribean style (with pineapple, jamaican jerk spices, and peppers), and the white chocolate mousse dessert was terrific.

My only complaint is that despite the exceptional flavor the food, the menu does not seem to be terribly inventive or original.  Yes, there are good dishes and drinks and everything looks and tastes amazing, but the fare here is by no means unique.  It doesn't seem terribly out of place at any other upscale restaurant, banquet hall, or steakhouse.  Otherwise, it's definitely a great place to go for that special occasion, and also when you want dinner with a view.

My boyfriend and I celebrated our anniversary at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto, as a lover of seafood, I was quite skeptical that a seafood restaurant in Pittsburgh would have fish that tasted like butter, without an overwhelming fishy flavor. However, I was glad to find out that I was quite wrong, and I was more than pleased with the food that arrived at my table. The fish was phenomenal and tasted very, very fresh. For dessert, we split the angel food grilled cheese sandwich which was so beautifully presented, and it tasted just as good as it sounds!

Our reservations were at sunset so the view before, during, and after sunset were unlike any other in the city. It was such a fun spot to go to celebrate an anniversary or a special occasion!

The only drawback with this restaurant is the price tag, but you won't find a better seafood restaurant with such an incredible view in Pittsburgh!

I took my wife for our 6th wedding anniversary, and our experience was wonderful throughout the whole evening.
Starting with the valet, very courteous and welcoming!
The elevator ride up to the restaurant was nice, once you get a grand view of Pittsburgh downtown.
The French onion soup was okay.
We both had the Chilean sea bass, Caribbean style, well done - was lovely, very well prepared.
Finally, the Cr√®me br√ªl√©e arrived with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on a plate... very thoughtful.
Overall, a wonderful experience!

Many times I have thought to myself... if only I had more disposable income so I could come here more often. Not many restaurants have inspired this line of thinking in me, Monterey Bay being an obvious exception. 

The absolute freshest and best prepared fish/seafood in the Pittsburgh area hands down. Also, do yourself a favor and get the white chocolate, macadamia nut dessert thing. It's life changing. 
A few note-worthy observations...
1) Reservations strongly recommended, use the same name every time you come [reasons/explanation below in 2, 3]
2) I noticed a strong correlation between number of attendances and preferable seating. While it's simply a theory, I would venture to guess this hypothesis could be proven. The first time I came here we were placed in the most remote corner from the best views... with each time we came back we noticed that we got closer and closer to the best seating in the house (near the 3-rivers view). 
3) Client profile? During one return visit, we were discussing wine selection and couldn't remember what we had chosen last time. The bottle was so good, we wanted to indulge again but couldn't remember what it was. Much to my surprise, a profile had been created under our reservation name and every wine bottle selection we had previously made was documented and recorded in a 'client profile' so to speak. This kind of service is unprecedented. I was somewhat in shock.
4) After frequenting Monterey so much, the manager had somewhat come to know me and my husband a bit. He didn't remember our names necessarily, but remembered our faces and previous conversations we had. As a result, we were granted dessert on the house while dining in celebration of my engagement.

We were visiting from Cleveland for Memorial Day weekend. We had reserved online and requested a table by the window . When we arrived all tables by the window were taken and I must say the lady at the entrance was not very welcoming which put me off at first  . We were then shown to our table and were introduced to our server Andrew , who I must say by far is the best server I have ever had the unique experience of meeting. He rearranged our table so we face the windows and have a fabulous view of the city. He then helped us with our menu selections and made excellent suggestions and finally served us our dessert. The food was good very well prepared I had the honey lime salmon which might have been cooked a bit too rare for my taste but still was good. My fianc√© had the paramesan halibut which was phenomenal. We had Creme br√ªl√©e for dessert which was delicious and came with a very moist buttery sugar cookie on top. Our experience overall was great and made superb by this very nice man Andrew. It is the little things he did and the little details he tailored do that made the night so enjoyable. We enjoyed chatting with him between courses and he genuinely turned the night around. Should we visit Pittsburgh again we would definitely come back and ask for Andrew. Everyone should ask for Andrew !!!
Pretty amazing....I know people will complain about something.....but I'm not sure what!! Amazing view, good service, and good food. If you like sushi the sakari roll rocks!

I lived 1/2 a block from this restaurant, but I only ate here a couple of times when I lived in Pittsburgh. I always felt out of place here.

It always felt like I should have my grandparents with me to fit in. My grandfather in his Sunday suit and my grandmother with a purple orchid corsage on her dress. Maybe then I might have felt more comfortable.

I remember the food was very good and the view was spectacular. 

But it felt like a really good restaurant attached to a retirement community. Definitely NOT your hip joint, nor even just an upscale dining experience. 

If my grandparents ever come visit me again, and we just happen to be in Pittsburgh, I will probably take them to another restaurant that is a little more lively.  Even they would appreciate it.

So delicious! Im not usually a big seafood person, but I enjoyed every single dish here. My friends and I got a window table and were able to see the beautiful Pittsburgh skyline while eating dinner. We ordered the Brandied shrimp tagliatelle, Moroccan spiced eggplant, Monterey Bay signature crab cakes, Halibut with Parmesan crust, and the Lobster mac and cheese. The tagliatelle dish was amazing. The noodles were chewy and the sauce was perfectly balanced with the shrimp. I've honestly never seen shrimp that huge in my life, esp in a pasta dish! They are most famous for their crab cakes, and I can definitely see why. They were soft and flavorful. There was some sauce on the bottom of them, but definitely was not necessary. We also ordered two desserts- Angel food grilled cheese sandwich and the maple tiramisu. We had a hard time deciding which desserts to get and almost ordered every single one on the menu! To be honest, I think the prices are a little cheaper than other seafood restaurants I've been to, but the quality of food definitely surpassed the price.

I never thought I would say this, having lived in Boston for 8 years, but this is the best seafood restaurant I think have ever been to (not counting assorted clam shacks and places of that ilk). At my table we had tuna, grouper, and oysters, and all were amazing. The view is sensational, and the bar area is a cool little nook for a drink. The food is pricey, but the quality of the meal merited top dollar. I strongly recommend this place.

Great food. Great service. All around great experience.

My boyfriend and I were visiting Pittsburgh for the first time and we're dying to satisfy our seafood craving. We decided to try out Monterey Bay and I'm so glad we did. We arrived 45 minutes early hoping to just sit at the bar for a few cocktails before dinner. Our table was ready when we arrived so we were able to eat earlier than planned. Our waitress, Casey, was excellent. Very knowledgeable about the menu and assisted me in my dinner indecisiveness. She did not steer my wrong! We had the appetizer special, the seafood trio, and it was mouth watering. The lobster ravioli was to die for - not thick and creamy like you would expect. LEAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT! I promise you won't be disappointed. The angel food cake grilled cheese has been voted the best dessert in Pittsburgh twice now (fun fact by our waitress Casey) and now I know why. 

Definitely a must try with a breath taking view of the city.

One word. STUNNING. From the view to the Wine to the service to the food. We had a large group (about 15), adding difficulty to the staff already. They killed it. They kept the wine flowing and were very attentive. They boasted about the crab cakes and I was craving scallops. Luckily they had a pairing of 1 crab cake and 4 large scallops. The scallops were to die for(still thinking about them). 

We got several different sides, my favorites being the lobster Mac and cheese and the Brussels sprouts. 

Appetizer wise, the calamari was light and crispy and delicious. 

Like I said, they kept the wine coming and we never had to turn around constantly looking for a server. 

From our table was a gorgeous sunset view of the city. If you go downstairs to the bar, there's some lounge chairs with another spectacular view of the city. 

Yes, it is expensive but TOTALLY worth it. High class service, food and wine.

My girlfriend and I recently celebrated our one year anniversary at Monterey.  And I have to say we definitely chose the right place.  Our reservation was for 7:30 and we were sat as soon as we walked in.  

  The food was wonderful we started off with an appetizer sampler that included a crab cake, Skewered fish, along with Cajun Shrimp.  I ordered the Stuffed Yellow Fin Tuna and my girlfriend ordered the Shrimp and Scallop fettuccine both were excellent.  

  However there was one thing better than the food and the view.  And that was the service.  Our Waitress, April was great.  She was friendly as could be and very knowledgeable of the menu and made great recommendations.  
 
 Overall I was very satisfied with Monterey and will without a doubt return in the future.

3 star food, 5 star view, and 1 star value.  You'll pay a premium to be astounded by the view of downtown Pittsburgh while you dine at Monterey Bay.  The menu consists mainly of exotic or expensive fishes prepared a variety of ways.  The preparations are either boring ("blackened", "seared") or strange ("au poivre" w/ cognac sauce, "black and bleu" with gorgonzola).  The sides are also uninspired, with the mashed potatoes being my least favorite.

Of note, the prices are somewhat ridiculous.  A bottle of Yuengling for $6.50?  Give me a break!

I took my boyfriend for his birthday dinner & I'm pretty sure he will never forget it! We had an amazing time! We went on a very busy Sunday night but we were still able to get a table right next to the front glass window. The view is absolutely amazing. 

Our server was very knowledgable about the different types of wine we were interested in. The maitre de came over to help us select the bottle that would accompany our meals with the best flavors. He could not have been more correct. We selected a Pinot Noir from Oregon and it made the night completely worth it!

We started with a salad, of which I can't remember the name but it was good. For my entree I selected the Walu Escalar from Hawaii. It was prepared with a parmesan  cream based sauce and it was to die for! My boyfriend selected the Chilean Sea Bass prepared the Caribbean way. He was more than pleased. 

I had called ahead just to ask for the window table for his birthday dinner. Our hostess must have remembered and made a note of it because once we ordered the banana foster cheesecake, it came on a platter that said "Happy Birthday" in chocolate. It was the perfect touch to our amazing experience. We will be returning this summer for our anniversary & I cannot wait to see what the seasonal selections are.

Outstanding fish restaurant with amazing views.  Stellar service and comprehensive wine list.  I had the Virginia Striped Bass with mediterranean sauce.  Excellent on all levels and highly recommended.

One of my favorite restaurants. The food, service, view, and atmosphere are always on point. They remodeled since the last time I had been there after moving away from Pgh. The renovations are perfect for the atmosphere. I highly recommend crab cakes and shrimp or scallops. My only request would be that they bring back the chocolate cake. Other than that, this is perfection in a restaurant. It is worth the price.

Great Views.  
Good Service.
Really nice food presentation.  
Stopped in for a celebration.
Started with the Caesar Salad that was very good with some white anchovies.
I had the Crab Cakes that are perfectly cooked and oh so good.  
Everyone really enjoyed their meal.
We shared a couple of the sides.  Brussel sprouts and asparagus were good but not as good as mine.  The Lobster Mac was a big hit.  Some nice pieces of lobster were evident.
For desert we shared a couple including the Passion Fruit rose Icebox Pie and the Steaming Chocolate latte.  Really enjoyed the Passion Fruit.  The Steaming Chocolate is definitely a chocolate lovers dream.  
When we arrived the hostess made sure to congratulate the person who we were celebrating but was surprised they were not offered or given a small desert or something as does another restaurant just down the street always does.

The ambience is amazing. The lounge offers the best view of the city. The staff were very friendly and the food was amazing.  This is a high class experience so prepare to dress nice. It sits on top of a hill overlooking all of downtown Pittsburgh.  The lobster mac and cheese had to be my favorite although it's hard saying that because everything was the best.

Monterey Bay Fish Grotto seems a little off into the distance compared to the other restaurants on the street, giving it a slightly more unique view of Pittsburgh. We loved our view. It was gorgeous and definitely one of the best views I've seen of Pittsburgh, especially at night. This is the place to go to for an amazing view. 

The food, however, was just okay, from the calamari to the sushi rolls to the dessert. We tried the Cathedral roll, Carson St. roll, and 446 roll. The best was the 446, which came in 11 pieces and had shrimp tempura, spicy salmon, eel, and avocado. We thought the other two were eh, okay. Dessert was the apple tart--good, but didn't blow us away or anything. 

Service was very good! Our server seemed to really care about us, and the manager went around introducing himself to tables, chatted a bit, and came back to check up after we got our food. And--I have to say it again--the view is one of the best you'll get of Pittsburgh. Come here for the service and view, but there are definitely a few disappointments on the menu. I would say still worth the trip though!

OVERALL | 3.5

Overrated and expensive. 

They heavily promote the fact that they fly all this fresh in from around the world, but it is so over-prepared with sauces and spices that you cannot enjoy the actual freshness of the fish.

Portions are moderate, but the prices are high. Most wines are at least $10 a glass. They do go out of their way to work with people who are gluten intolerant, including having tapioca rolls, but everything adds up very quickly.

In my opinion, you are paying for the view. For quite a bit less money you can enjoy much better food at nearby La Tavola.

Let me start off by saying I am not a seafood eater.  The only seafood I like is shrimp.  With that being said, this is my new favorite restaurant.  We went here on Saturday night and everything from our drinks, our food, the service, and the view made for a really wonderful evening.  We arrived an hour prior to our reservation to have drinks.  I had the Dragonberry Mojito and this is my new fave drink.  It wasn't overly fruity, but just right.  We had the sampler as an appetizer which included Cajun sauteed shrimp, crab cake, and a hibachi skewer.  Since I only eat shrimp, I had the Cajun sauteed shrimp, and this was the best shrimp I have ever had.  I am also not a spicy person and the cajun seasoning was just right for me.  My boyfriend enjoyed the rest of the appetizer.  He also had the  butternut soup with crab meat and was ready for more.  I ordered the ribeye special and he had the blackened and cajun chargrilled salmon.  We also got shrimp fried rice as our side.  I can't even begin to describe how enjoyable and tasty all of my food was.  It was incredible.  Our waitress, Pam, was pleasant and funny.  The decor of the restaurant is a little strange, but with the view of the city and all the restaurant offers, that hardly matters.  (My mouth is watering just thinking about this.)

Everything at Monterey Bay is executed from high-quality ingredients and with near perfection. I've never had a bad waiter - even average - and service is always prompt. I recommend making a reservation in the attempt to get a coveted seat by the hug bay windows; however, check out the bar downstairs, as the views are also amazing, and there is normally no wait time to just eat there. Dinner at Monterey Bay is a sure thing: You're sure to have a delicious meal, excellent service, and amazing views.

This restaurant has the best  view of the city Pittsburgh!  Its been newly remodeled with a nice clean more modern design.  We got there a little early so we sat in the lounge its very nice , it also has great view of the city.   No matter where you sit in this restaurant you'll have a great view of the city, all thanks to the way its designed, with floor to ceiling windows.   I had the swordfish for dinner it was very good!   Are waitress was very nice and we had great service.

Monterey Bay is somewhere that I keeping come back to. My family has been coming here for years and their standard of food has not got down.

We always start with the appetizer trio. It is not listed on the menu, but is a great combination of blackened shrimp with a sweet chutney, an ichiban skewer of swordfish, salmon, tuna and a jumbo lump crab cake. Their crab cake is hands down probably the best in the burgh. There is jumbo lump crab in every bite and the aioli with it complements it so well. The skewer was also perfectly cooked and is in an ancho chili aioli. 

For dinner, I had the lobster stuffed with jumbo lump crab, spinach, and a Madeira sauce. The lobster was perfectly cooked and tastes great with the sauce. Probably did not need the crab. My dad got the Chilean sea bass prepared tropical curry style. The mango salsa was delicious with the fish. He also had the potato au gratin and loved it. A side dish definitely shareable for two. 

Finally, for dessert I had the peach cobbler cheesecake. The cheesecake was delicious but the topping was a little thick. Also, they lit a candle for my birthday and the desert was on the house which was nice. 

Overall, I give this place five stars because of the countless times we have come and had delicious food and service. Also you really can't beat the view!

Even though I didn't give this place 5 stars, it's still really good!!! The fish is so clearly fresh and the preparations are great. For fish lovers, the less you do is more. The chef really does seem to realize that. The chef uses earthy whole ingredients that work really well. I had the Chilean Sea Bass and my husband had the halibut. We both loved our dishes. For an appetizer we had the sampler that included crab cakes, fish skewer, and shrimp. All Sooooo good! The crab cake had so much crab! The sauces everything was paired with was perfect!
For dessert we had the steamed chocolate latte. It was so creative and cute and it tasted fantastic! We devoured the whole thing!!! 

Now onto why I to why I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5. At this price point, I think a stronger critique is more informative. In my opinion, the chef really knows what they are doing with the fish and the sauces, so I wish they would make full entrees. At steakhouses I understand doing sides family style, but I was hoping the chef would prepare a great side that would pair nicely with the fish and sauces. Perhaps other people might prefer a la carte sides, but I prefer the chef to pick it if they know what they are doing and this chef really does! We got tricolor potatoes which were really good. We also got flash fried Brussels sprouts, which were a little greasy. I thought they'd be nice and crunchy, but they were more soggy with grease.

All in all I will definitely go back next time we are in town, but they can stand to improve a few things to make this place perfect!! Oh and service was really good as well. They didn't bother us too much but they were attentive. Definitely the best seafood restaurant I've been to in Pittsburgh and possibly ever!

To me, this is more of a special occasions restaurant.  And everyone comments on the wonderful seafood, blah blah blah.  But you are going here for the incredible view of the city.  Admit it.  As for me, I really thought that I was going to get that big fat romantic proposal.  But if you've seen my finger, it's still bare naked.
Fabulous view, cozy atmosphere, delectable cuisine.  Seafood is amazing.  Service very good.  I drop in every time I come to Pittsburgh.

First off, the valet parking was only $6.  My gentlemen's cocktail (a modified Manhattan) was too sweet, and my wife's and sister in law's cocktails not cold enough.  The view is world-class, the service was excelent and the food may be Pittsburgh's best.

I'm not familiar with Pittsburgh at all, but me and my fianc√© were downtown and decided to google search seafood, and this is where we landed! 
After pulling up and dropping your car off with valet and taking a glass elevator up several floors, you arrive at Monterey Bay Fish Grotto, overlooking the heart of Pittsburgh while you eat the best seafood around. It's a very nice, presentable, classy atmosphere. We ate in the lounge, it was dimmer with candles lit on the table.

We just ordered a bunch of appetizers, our table was over full for just the two of us, but we managed to eat almost all of it! Our drinks were a sparkling ros√®, we liked them so much that we saved the name and when we got home ordered 6 bottles from a local wine dealer.
All the the food was fantastic, then we got to the part I wasn't expecting... dessert. There on the menu was something called angel food cake grilled cheese, I had to have it. After one bite, it became and still is the greatest tasting thing I've ever put in my mouth. Now, I live probably 80 miles from this place, and probably for a good reason, I would be eating angel food cake grilled cheese every day. 
This is a quality place with a quality price tag, we enjoyed an afternoon of fine dining and spent around $200 for the two of us. Given what we got, it's worth every penny.
Perfect view, great food, had the grouper and loved it!  I thought the sever in the downstairs bar was inexperience, but loved our sever for dinner, can't wait to go back.

One of the best meals I've had! Took a couple clients here - the views, service and quality of fish rivals that of any on the coast. Halibut with Thai Peanut, risotto, beet salad with the angel food grilled cheese (yeah, really) - absolutely amazing!

I've been here a few times and the experience is always top notch. The menu is always full of delicious options and the new sushi bar is serving up some of the best sushi in the city. I highly recommend this restaurant for a great meal or a special celebration.

Best scallops I've had in a long time!  Service was great and friendly and the atmosphere was a great balance of trendy, sophisticated and comfortable.

We got the calamari as an appetizer, which was just fried enough to have a good breading, but still enough of a calamari chew that you lost that flavor.

For our entrees, we got the Jumbo Scallops and the Swordfish (parmesan style).  I wasn't sure how you could stuff scallops, but they were just cut in the middle, and stuffed with Monterey Bay's famous crab cake.  Both were seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The parmesan crust on the swordfish was perfectly crispy and the fish was cooked to melt in your mouth, truly "the filet mignon of the sea."

After eating bread, the app, and our entrees, we both were very full and satisfied, when usually I'm left not feeling overly full after eating seafood.

Highly recommended for any special event or just a nice night out.  The price is worth way more than just the view, the entire experience was unforgettable!
Really nice place. The view... oh, the view is best in town! The food is amazing .  Try the fish - best selection I have seen! Try the dessert.  Very original! Reasonably price for a place like that!

Worth a visit just for the view! This is definitely the spot to bring visiting friends or relatives. 

The food was quite good. We ordered the filet mignon and the swordfish, which were both tasty. The saut√©ed zucchini and squash medley was a bit bland and disappointing. Angelfood grilled cheese for dessert is a must-try!

I actually liked the giant painted palm trees in the dining room (admittedly, they looked much better at night), but I do agree with other reviews that the decor needs updating. The rope lighting and blue neon lights around the bar have got to go. The place has an overall feeling of being outdated (and not in a classy, ironic way).

Food, service, and location was excellent. I feel like they may charge more on the food due to the beautiful view, but it was worth it. I had the crab cakes and my fiance had the filet. Everyone was friendly. We will definitely be back.

Went here while visiting Pittsburgh and boy were we wow'ed. We went without a reservation and they we able to get us in right away. The view is amazing!! Service by Holly was great. She was helpful with making our dinner choices. I had the parmesan crusted halibut and hubby had the caribean sea bass. Both were great. And since we were celebrating our anniversary, Holly brought us a dessert on the house. Rocky road cake! Amazing. If ever back in town, we will be back here.

I had the most positive and best birthday dinner I could ever imagine here. I was joined with a girlfriend who was treating me. Our waiter was very professional and gave us dining recommendations.

We started off with a glass of wine. I had the signature crab cakes with a side of asparagus and red peppers. My girlfriend ordered the surf and turf. Both meals were exceptionally delicious. We had bread with our meal as well. Please note that everything here is ala carte and there is no Wi Fi. Valet parking is $6.00. There is no self parking.

Before I ordered dessert the waiter told me it was on the house and I ordered a while chocolate mousse with praline cookies. It came with a candle and two plates for us to share. It was very good. We sat at a table that overlooked the city and had pictures taken.

Our waiter did everything to make my birthday special. This is one of the best seafood restaurants in Pittsburgh and will gladly come again.

I find very few places in Pittsburgh in regards to fish and seafood as good as Monterrey Bay. Mitchell's is good, buts lacks the ambiance. 

First, how fresh can it be having to be flown from all over the globe to get here? Which leads me to the Crab cakes. This has to be all crab, I see no filler whatsoever. And it tastes like it's right out of the ocean. Pricey, but let's be honest, how can you put a price on the delicate, flakey jumbo lump crab cakes? 

The view is second to none. The wine list is superb, the service is wonderful. I wouldn't hesitate to bring even the staunchest seafood snob to Monterrey Bay. 

Valet parking available at the entrance.

Best city view in the U.S. And best crab cakes ANYWHERE. And I've had crab cakes. Prices are decent, considering the quality of food. We sat in the bar and had a very knowledgeable bartender wait on us. Although I was tickled to be able to add to his drinkology database.  But back to the food: AWESOME!! So fresh, nicely seasoned and well prepared. The gulf shrimp in Cajun sauce is killer. And the mixed fish kabob challenges you to choose a favorite of the tasty morsels. (I have the names wrong, but you. Ant mess up) The ambiance and service are top notch. This is a must anytime I'm in Pittsburgh.

Way over priced for mediocre food at best. 

Our party of five found the skimpy Caesar salads wallowing in way too much dressing and so salty it was almost inedible. Of the sides, the best were the fingerling potatoes while the asparagus and beet/butternut squash dishes were flavorless. The oysters on the half shell were the smallest we've seen. Our salmon and crab cake entrees were acceptably good but the whole fish was laden with bones and the calamari was downright awful. We declined dessert and coffee because we feared another over long wait only to be, once again, disappointed with our choices.

We chose Monterey Bay to celebrate our daughters birthday and were expecting to be overwhelmed by a decadent experience. Sadly, Monterey bay gets one star only for its fantastic view of the city and the helpful wine expert.

I went here for my 20th birthday and had an amazing experience. I was in a group of six and we were sat immediately (with reservations) at  a table appropriate for our party. The service was excellent from the hostess to the coat check chick. Each piece of food I had was a delectable morsel of goodness. I had a bite of most of my friends dishes; my favorite was the crab cake that I ordered and the barbecue tuna. As I've said in other reviews, I'm a calamari lover, and theirs didn't quite measure up - but it wasn't terrible enough to take off a star and every other dish on our table was incredible. I would recommend however, taking the trip to the Pittsburgh location if you want an even more luxurious atmosphere.

I went here for my 21st birthday/Valentine's Day. My date and I had reservations and got sat right away. You have to take an elevator up to the restaurant, where there are gorgeous views. We were sat right next to the window, which I highly recommend if you can get it, and had a great view of the city while we dined. I can't comment on the drink selection too much since I was a newb when we went - I had my first alcoholic beverage here. I got the strawberry mojito which was too sweet for my tastes. Our server recommended a wine to pair with the grouper I ordered and it was successful! My date got tuna over forbidden rice and that was delicious too. The server realized it was my birthday and we got the lollipop cake trio for free as well as the manager stopping by to wish me happy birthday. I can't say enough good things about this place. The location, food and service are all at a level that the prices aren't painful. I can't wait to go back!

I was in town for a conference and took one of my customers out for dinner and drinks. I found this place on Yelp and the quality of the service, food and Drinks was outstanding. They have a great wine list with a bottle that will suit any palate. 

The she bisque was outstanding, crab cakes were pure crab and the Salmon preparation was delicious. We finished off the night with the Fosters Banana Cheese Cake and Angel Food Cheese Cheese Sandwich. 

I will warn everyone this is a pricy dining experience so if you are in a budget keep that in mind before making reservations. We had 6 in out party and ordered 6 cocktails, 1 $70.00 bottle of Merlot, 3 Apps, 1 salad, 1 Sushi Roll and 4 She Bisque Soup, 6 entrees and 3 deserts. Total check came to a littleOut bill was was over $650.00 without the tip. However, in my opinion it was well worth it!

I've been to Monterey Bay once for a business lunch and once for dinner with a large group.  Both times were very good--food was good, service excellent, and obviously the views are spectacular.  I read the comments about the outdated decor and agree, but I don't find that a major detraction, and really, it's all about the views, anyway.  

The crowd on the Friday night I went for dinner included a lot of very well-dressed older men and very pretty younger women, people obviously on their first dates, to couple who looked like they had been married for 60 years.  It was pretty good people watching.    

I wavered on 3 or 4 stars only because right now I don't go out of my way to visit there--which is what I typically have to do at minimum to give something 4 stars.  As I was sitting here writing, though, it occurred to me that I SHOULD be going there more often with out-of-town guests--it is probably the best thing I've seen up on Mt. Washington, though I haven't been to Isabella's yet (and know it always gets pretty good reviews, too).  And that is a great way to enjoy one of the most livable cities in the world!

This was my first time there, and I will definitely be back! We got the jumbo scallops & the lobster & crab mac n' cheese. Both were delicious! Our waitress was extremely efficient and helpful! The food is very pricy, however; it's all fresh. The view from our table was absolutely beautiful.

We took my Dad to dinner for his birthday. The food is very delicious with breathtaking views of Pittsburgh. The waitstaff was wonderful and takes very good care of you. It made for a very special night. We had reservation for a window seat, I highly recommend this restaurant with its stunning views.

The food was delicious  and the menu design allows for you to construct a perfect meal for you (you choose your fish and can pair it with and prep you would prefer, and order your side separately). The desert makes the night, you have to get the angel food grilled cheese sandwich (it sounds strange but it's to die for).

This place was AMAZING! My family and I have been to many fish and steakhouses before but this one was truly remarkable! 

First of all, it's a beautiful restaurant with a gorgeous view! Unfortunately, we didn't get the view of the city but we still got to watch a beautiful sunset as we enjoyed our meals. This place is so accommodating. We walked in without a reservation and luckily someone just canceled their reservation so we got their table! We were so lucky! The staff was very polite as well. 

On the menu, there were over 15 different fish to order. It was amazing! My father got the Walu cooked in the Caribbean style and loved it! I got one of their specials, the Surf and Turf. It was absolutely amazing! For dessert, we all shared the Angel Food Cake Grilled Cheese. OH MY GOD IT WAS SO GOOD! Give this dessert a try because it's absolutely amazing! 

I strongly suggest going to the restaurant. It was a great experience for my family.

Full Disclosure (We were the guests of my fiances employers i.e., didn't pay)

As for the decor, we were seated in a private room with a lot of floor length windows looking out at the wonderful view so I wasn't really paying attention to what some refer as outdated decor. 

We started off with a drink at the bar he had a rum and coke (very strong!) and I had a very well balanced cosmopolitan made with fresh lime juice (huge plus over the bottled stuff)

They had set up a menu for us with a salad, choice of entree and shared dessert platter. 

Even though the bread looked like just the take and bake variety they were wonderful (someone at our table even wanted to steal the bread basket from the other table to get more)

The salad was excellent and had a passion fruit dressing that I would love to buy and use everyday on my salads. 

For my entree I had the grilled swordfish oscar style (crab meat, asparagus, and hollindaise (spelling?))  this was excellent, there was just enough hollindaise to add richness, but not to much that it was swimming in it.  The fish was also cooked perfectly.   

My fiance had the tuna seared rare with some type of sesame sauce that was out of this world.  I am not a huge fan of tuna and I stole two pieces :). 

The portion sizes were outrageous.  I can't speak for the everyday portions, but these were more than generous. 

The dessert platter had key lime tarts, mini cheesecakes, truffles, and a chocolate mouse. 

I tried the key lime tart good, but a bit to sweet and the chocolate truffle which was just the perfect size and sweet bite to end the meal. 

Now being on the budget we are on and saving for a wedding, this place is not one I expected to be able to try for a long time, but the food was wonderful and I am glad we had the chance to enjoy it!

Have been going here since it opened. Always loved it.  Since they changed owners and made massive changes in their dining room and menu, it is mediocre at best.  Extremely pricey. Dinners average $38-40 and that doesn't include anything. A salad is an additional $8-10 and sides start about $8.  The selection on the menu has been significantly reduced as well as the optional choices they always gave you in how they prepare the food. Very disappointing.  Seems like the new owners bought the name only. There are better restaurants of this caliber which have a better selection and less pricey.

High quality food, good service, and a view of the golden triangle that's hard to beat.  It's not the kind of place for a regular meal because the prices are helping to pay for the view, but great for a special occasion.  We came here for our 10th anniversary and showed up as soon as it opened to make sure we got the table w/ the best view - guaranteed to remove panties.  Crab cakes are delicious and the "angel food cake grilled cheese" desert is something we'd never seen before, but highly recommend!  Our waitress was a hoot and was there anytime we even began to think of needing something.  The ambiance was nice and we'll definitely be back, but only for a special occasion.

First time since the remodel and its a step up but antiseptic not chic.  Ordered drinks and for the one cocktail the bartender just waved the bottle over the glass.  Grilled wedge was OK at best.  Scallops and crabmeat was OK at best and minimal in portion.  Filet was bland as bland could be, ahi tuna was ok but nothing spectacular, gratin potatoes were best part of the meal.  Service was lackluster, water filler was totally annoyed being there that the hostess podium was the hangout space for the unused servers....restaurant was 2/3 empty and for good reason.  If you want a meal with a view go to Altius
Went here for grandsons graduation dinner. Amazing food,service and views. Would go back again.
Great view and good food; nice for a business lunch or dinner

This place is beautiful. The food is okay but very expensive. The reason for one star is that one of our party became violently ill after dining there. We believe it could be food poisoning related to the walleye. When I called to report this to management I did not get an empathetic response. The message I got was essentially "not our fault". No caring whatsoever. In looking at other postings I saw other reports of possible food poisoning. While we do not know if our food poisoning was related to the restaurant be forewarned that you will not get a sympathetic ear if you report it.

This review is only for the M'ville location.  The quality of food here is just as good as the Mt. Washington restaurant.  However, the service and location are another story.  I went there today for a nice holiday lunch with friends.  We usually eat at more pedestrian places when we have lunch like T.G. Mcfunsters.. .and the like, but it being a holiday weekend.  Anyways, we get there and the place is relatively empty, but they still try to seat us at the worst table in the place.  I object and incur a pretty sarcastic "Well sit wherever you want then"  After being seated it's almost 20 minutes till we get our water.  I'm guessing punishment for my request.  The server arrives we order a variety of appetizers.  The crabcake is excellent and a must order whenever you  visit.  The calmari is pretty average and the ichiban is good.  The salads are pretty weak (typically this small item can tell you a lot about a restaurant).  One of us gets the Swordfish parmasan style... and as much as I would like to say it wasn't good, it was awesome!  Definitely not a light dish,  but really well executed.  I get a salmon dish with crabmeat and a cream sauce and again cooked perfectly and delicious.  I know by now I'm sounding Bi-polar with this review.   We also had another salmon dish that was perfect.  The food did make up for the service which continued to be off with us waiting for much of the food and the check.  I think we spent almost 2 hours here for what should have been an hour tops.  The location is attached to a mall, which makes no sense at all and really takes away from the food.  I really don't understand the choice to be located next to a JCPenny and a starbucks.  Anyways, bottom line they really do have some of the best Fish in Pittsburgh (maybe the best).  But, I definitely don't recommend this location go to Mt. Washington you can have the same high quality food without the poor service or location.

So, I find myself spending more and more time here lately since a friend recently moved into the apartments in the same building.  I've been going here for years and am definitely a a fan.  The valet parking is good, however a pet peeve is that you have to pay to valet.  I always think this should be complimentary with fine dining.  The elevator takes a fortnight to arrive to the top floor dining room is another small annoyance, but everything else is pretty close to five stars.  The main dining room is gorgeous with the best view of the burgh' or any city for that matter that you can have.  The hand painted palm trees are very nice and relaxing and the furniture is adequate.  They have plenty of space on the lower floor for big functions. I've had events in these big rooms for 50 to 100 folks multiple times.  However, a must visit is the wine room.  It is amazing.  You have three oak tables in a small room with wine bottles and floor to ceiling glass all around you.  Ask for Pat he is a great server and a true pro with respect to his craft.  He also always remembers me even though I haven't used the room for years.  They say the room seats 27 (3 tables of 9), but I don't suggest more than 24 in this space.  If you use this room you need at least 8 folks' and you have to choose one of the wine tasting menus.  They are $95 or $120 I believe for each 5 course wine tasting.  I suggest if you are going to use this room to splurge for the $120.  It's much better wine and includes a champagne toast.  This obviously is not a room I'd use often, but perfect for special occassions.  More and more I find myself simply sitting at the bar.  It has a great lounge and bar area, with plenty of seating.  If you find yourself in a bind to get a table in the dining room you can almost always find a table in the lounge with the same menu.  I've probably been here almost once a week the past couple months.  The bartenders are really good and definitely take care of there regulars.  As an aside, this place is also like the "melrose place" of Pittsburgh with many single folks choosing to stay in this building which has the restaurant located on the top floor.  The food is pretty much the best fish in Pittsburgh and less pricey than the some of the other fish joints like "original fish market".  My only complaint with the menu is that I wish they offered more shellfish options like crab and lobster and not just crab cakes (which btw are probably the best in the city, which is saying a lot for a town that loves crabcakes).   Some recent menu highlights have been the oysters rockefeller. I'd say skip this.  It was super heavy with a thick hollandaise, too much cheese and breadcrumbs.  The "ahi" tempura was really great and I found to be somewhat of a paradox in that it's close to raw great quality fish, but they find a way to put a light breading on it and deep fry it without the fish being overcooked.  My new favorite menu item.  The ichiban is good which is just a skewer of medium rare fish.  I also found the filet to be of great quality and reasonablyu priced for a "prime": cut for $37 for 10 oz.  You literally can't go wrong with any fish dish you choose, I'll just offer a couple suggestions.  If you want something rich and deeply flavored try the swordfish parmasan style.  It's very rich, but soooo delicious.  If you prefer something lighter with a lot of flavor try the Ahi Tuna sashimi style.  It's fantastic.  The prices are reasonable, service is good, and it's the perfect spot for out of town guests.  Definitely one of my Pgh. favs'.

Digusting red snapper! Dry salty just disgusting.  My only regret was not returning the 30 dollars dish.  However, everything was good except for the darn frozen red snapper they served me.  I ate Garbage.  The Chilean sea bass was excellent.  The lobster mac was amazing!  I just feel robbed cause the red snapper tasted like dead fish they bought from Florida.  I would stick to the Chilean Sea Bass.  I wouldn't go again....so mad with the freaking red snapper which tasted like dry salty ham from Aldi's.

Went here with a group. Setting is nice, with a phenomenal view overlooking the city. All the men in our group wore slacks and a button down with a suit-jacket, and all the women were either in nice (but casual) dresses, or dress pants. Our waiter was certainly knowledgeable, about both food and drinks.

We started with a seafood appetizer trio (crab cake, sashimi, Cajun shrimp) that was all excellent. The shrimp particularly had a strong (and a little spicy) flavor. We also had the oysters and bread. The butter was definitely a hit at the table.

For the main course, I ordered the sesame tuna. They give you sizable portions, maybe even a little too large (at least for me, after all the appetizers). Not much on the tuna, so the flavor of the fish certainly comes out.

For dessert, I had the pot de creme. The vanilla flavor came out beautifully, and the biscuit and berries that came out with it paired well. My partner ordered the rhubarb strudel, with two large pieces -couldn't finish it. That said, the flavor was great and there a little brulee action on the bottom that gave the strudel a nice crunch. 

This would be a great place for a special event. Probably a little over-priced, but the view truly is worth it, and overall, the food was excellent!

There is no finer place for seafood in Pittsburgh. I go with my wife every year and only expect it to get better as the new renovations are completed. try the Ahi Tuna sesame style. Good God! It is however, a bit expensive. Expect to drop about $200 there but in my world its worth every penny!

Came here with some co-workers for dinner. It was not really busy. When I first walked in, it was a bit outdated. When we got to the top floor I as surprised to see how big the restaurant was. The views are amazing, we got to see the sunset which was really nice. They have a great wine list. The food (I got the sea bass) was really good and cooked perfect. I can see why people recommend this place, they do have great seafood. Everyone at my table enjoyed their meal. The waitress we had was very attentive and manager checked in on our table as well. The desserts they have were good too. I really like this place but they do need to update decor. The have on the lower lever of the restaurant a bar area which is a great place to look out at the view and have drinks. Very laid back but classy atmosphere.

One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. Tasteful and elegant. Staff is very friendly and the food is always delicious. Great wine selection and atmosphere. Definitely a place to try when in Pittsburgh.

The view is undeniably amazing. The service is shockingly average considering the price point. The food is par for the course. Perhaps the average fish/seafood diner prefers wine, but when you ask if there is a draft list or what exactly the seasonal beers are, you would think a server in such an establishment would respond with more than just, "I don't know. It's what's listed there." I guess it's too much work to find out the answer? The Ichiban appetizer is tried 'n true. The fish selection and preparations are still somewhat unique, but the portion size was small and overall a far cry from the day of yore. The roasted, tri-color potatoes were average and monochrome. The dessert was the only thing keeping this review from two stars since a birthday was being celebrated. Disappointing.
The view is amazing easily carries the issues I have with the palm trees. The best place to take visiting guests who you want to be impressed with our city.

I went here with a group of coworkers for our staff holiday lunch arranged and paid for by the chair of our department. All I can say is WOW and if you go you absolutely MUST order the crab cake. This is seriously in the top two crab cakes that I've had in my life.  We also had the eggplant rolletini and calamari appetizers which we shared and both were excellent. A few others had The salmon as their entrees and one had the she crab soup. The desserts were equally spectacular as their savory counterparts. The choices were the angel food grilled cheese sandwich and The dark chocolate truffle cake. No one was disappointed by the end of lunch and everyone left full and happy. They also have a very nice wine list. The view from the party room was spectacular and the wait staff were very happy and attentive. The overall decor if the restaurant is still reminiscent of when it was Christopher's back in the day and that is honestly the only criticism that I have is that the decor is a bit outdated.

My boyfriend and I went here, as he's never been to Pittsburgh. The first thing I have to say is definitely make a reservation and ask and wait for a window table when you arrive. Our reservation was for 8:30 and we were seated at a window table by 9:00. It's worth the little wait!! Amazing view!!!! While we were waiting, we had drinks in the lounge area. We had a nigiri/sashimi plate and an incline roll for appetizers. Both were great and SO fresh for being sushi in PA. For dinner, we split a crab cake entree because we were getting full from the apps... which was easily the best crab cake I have ever had...it's not really breaded like most crab cakes...it's slightly torched. Our server was also great! The entire staff is so professional and make the experience. Also...the green onion butter is to die for! It's sometimes a gamble with upscale restaurants bc sometimes the atmosphere is what you really pay for while the food is subpar...this is definitely not the case here! Worth the prices!!

To start, the views are impressive! If you gave stars for that it would be a 5. But the food was unimpressive to say the least.

The tuna was fishy, slimy, and so off putting I had to step away from the table.

I can not believe that a fish house would allow that level of fish to be served.

The other only good note was the service.

Very good food prepared the way it is intended to be enjoyed. 
One of my table mate's ordered Sushi grade tuna but for what ever reason chose to have it cooked well done or heated through. In my opinion that destroyed everything that makes sushi/sashimi food unique taste and mouth feel. He should have just ordered the blackened swordfish. My Scallops were awesome, cooked perfectly with not a bit of chewing gum style shellfish.

I love fish-- any kind of fish. And moving from the Jersey shore to Pittsburgh was a hard blow to my fish-loving self. However, Monterey Bay is THE BEST place to get seafood in Pittsburgh. Come prepared to spend money, because good fish in Pittsburgh is not cheap. I really enjoyed their Chilean Sea Bass, oysters, swordfish, and blue-fin tuna. 

Try to sit by the window-- especially at sunset. A gorgeous view of the three rivers is the perfect complement to a delicious meal.

My wife and I made reservations almost a month in advance after doing some extensive research. I was in Pittsburgh on business a few weeks ago and it happened to coincide with my birthday weekend so she joined me for a couple of days.

The ambiance is fantastic, modern and sophisticated and its location offers views that are hard to match. 

We started the night with the Roasted Butternut and Beets Salad. Because it was not really in season it did not have butternut squash but it was still a great, earthy and sweet salad.

My wife followed with the Two MB Signature Crab Cakes which were perfectly seasoned and had great texture, something that many restaurants struggle with.

I had the Chimichurri Chilean Sea Bass and being from Argentina I must confess that I am very particular as to what carries the "chimichurri" label. That said, I am excited to report that it held true to its roots. The outside was firm, almost crispy while the meat remained soft, moist and flaky. A little salt and not much else was used to prevent the combination of the chimichurri and other spices from overpowering this sweet and delicate fish. I added two Seared Jumbo Sea Scallops and they were expertly prepared and accompanied by a lemon wedge wrapped in fine cloth.The presentation of such a simple dish was perfect.

As a side we shared the the Fried Brussel Sprouts which were cooked with bacon and a balsamic reduction that complemented them very well.

I was, at first, a bit worried about the wine list as I didn't see anything I would consider a high end wine, by the glass. I was pleasantly surprised, however, after trying a Malbec from WA (again, being from Argentina I am a bit of a snub when it comes to this wine) that left me wanting more and so I enjoyed a second glass. Try the Waterbrook Malbec if you like a medium body wine that pairs great with almost everything.

For desert we were served a complimentary Creme Br√ªl√©e that was delicious. We decided to take it back to the hotel for a midnight snack.

If you find yourself in Pittsburgh and want to enjoy more than just a great meal, Monterrey Fish Grotto should earn a spot on your short list. Chin Chin!

It's my 500th review! What better way to commemorate that than with a 5-star review?

For my xxth birthday (after all, you're never supposed to ask a woman her age. I'll leave the actual number up to your imagination), my boyfriend took me here for dinner. It's right up the Duquesne incline so if you're sitting by the window, you'll get an amazing view of Pittsburgh.

Everything from the beginning to the end was fantastic. Our waiter (I wish I could remember his name but I did have a few birthday drinks that night after all) was really attentive and nice - he even helped us snap a few pictures at the end of the night, even though I'm sure he was super busy.

For my entree, I went with the parmesan rockfish (Parmesan coated with lemon peppercorn cream). It was amazing. The cream sauce wasn't too heavy, which is something hard to find when ordering something with a cream sauce.

My boyfriend had the chimichurri swordfish (cilantro, basil, chile lime sauce), which tasted really refreshing. It would have went really well with a side salad.

None of the fish dishes come with sides, so we decided to get the lobster crab mac and cheese to share. This came out piping hot and cheesy, and you could actually taste the chunks of shellfish.

We ended up eating a little bit of everything and we were stuffed. To top it all off, they gave us a complimentary birthday dessert (anything from the dessert menu). I chose this pineapple cake thing which was pretty good, and not overly sweet. We also ordered the angel food grilled cheese sandwich, which our waiter said was their most popular. It's caramel iced Angel food cake, cream cheese filling, berry compote, vanilla ice cream, and toasted almonds. This was a little too sweet for me but the vanilla ice cream definitely helped balance it out a bit.

We ate our leftover fish the next day and it still tasted great - not something you can say too often about day-old microwaved fish.

Who knew you could get such fresh seafood in Pittsburgh?! Would definitely recommend if you're in town and are looking for dinner with a view.
The view is awesome.  Fish was excellent.   Had the grilled cheese sandwich  (yes that is what they call it) for dessert.  Treated our anniversary dinner very well.

Amazing view. Superb appetizers. Great wine list and fabulous food. The standout was, of all things... Brussels Sprout, which I hate!!!!, but tried. They were delicious. 
Pittsburgh is not known for great food - but this restaurant was AMAZING!
This visit was amazing! Great food and great service . Sit high and view the city. If there were more stars I would give them

We eat out 4-5 nights a week so are familiar with local restaurants and pricing. We thought it was very overpriced. It was a Thursday night and the restaurant only had 3 tables filled between 7:00-9:00. The fish was priced from $28-$36 for average sized portions and did not include a starch or vegetable. The side dishes were priced around $8.
The food was nice and the atmosphere lovely. Our server simply tolerated us.
$125 for dinner for two which included only 1 glass of wine.
